ingredients.3: 1 cup TJ's Gluten Free Pretzel Twists

parsed_ing.0: Oven Baked Cheese Bites with Black Summer Truffle
parsed_ing.1: Organic Popcorn with Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil

steps.0: In a large mixing bowl combine Cheese Bites, Popcorn, Almonds, and Pretzel Twists. Toss together and enjoy!

86.title: Warm Cruciferous Cranberry Slaw
86.description: Sometimes, spending hours lovingly preparing a hot, nutritious meal is just the kitchen therapy you need. Other times, the very thought of laboring over lunch or dinner is more torturous than it is therapeutic. Our Warm Cruciferous Cranberry Slaw is for those other times. Ready in just 10 minutes and best served warm, this hearty, winter-inspired side is a cinch to make and guaranteed to wow-further proof that one needn't be nimble with a knife or a first-class flambe artist to create a delicious dish-just a bag of Trader Joe's Cruciferous Crunch and a few crunchy, savory toppings.

ingredients.0: 1 bag TJ's Cruciferous Crunch
ingredients.1: 2 teaspoons TJ's Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil
ingredients.6: TJ's Shaved Parmesan, Romano & Asiago Cheese

steps.0: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add olive oil. When heated, add cruciferous crunch and saute 3 minutes until slightly wilted. Remove pan from heat and pour contents into a large bowl. Add salt and lemon juice and toss until coated. Divide greens among two plates and top with a handful of dried cranberries, almonds and cheese. Serve warm.

87.title: Spinach & Artichoke Sweet Potato Gratin
87.description: With their vibrant orange hue and naturally sweet flavor, Trader Joe's Organic Sweet Potatoes are the ideal base for this comforting gratin. Trader Joe's Spinach & Artichoke Dip provides plenty of creaminess and green veggie action between sweet potato layers, while our Quattro Formaggio Shredded Cheese Blend lends a savory sharpness to the finished dish. While this cold-weather recipe is large enough to feed a potluck crowd, the recipe halves easily for a smaller group.

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Oil Spray
ingredients.1: 1 bag (3 lbs.) TJ's Organic Sweet Potatoes, peeled and sliced into thin planks
ingredients.2: 4 packages TJ's Frozen Spinach & Artichoke Dip, microwaved according to directions
ingredients.4: 2 cups TJ's Quattro Formaggio Shredded Cheese Blend, divided

steps.0: Preheat oven to 400F. Stir milk into microwaved spinach dip, set aside. Grease a 9-inch by 13-inch baking dish with canola oil spray. Arrange half of the potato slices in an even layer in baking dish, slightly overlapping as you go. Spread half of the spinach dip over potatoes and sprinkle with half of the cheese. Repeat potato and dip layers (the rest of the cheese will be added later) and cover baking dish with foil.
steps.1: Bake on center rack of oven for 40 minutes. Remove dish from oven and discard foil. Sprinkle remaining cheese on top, return to oven and bake 25-30 minutes, until golden and bubbling. Remove from oven and let cool 15-20 minutes before serving.

88.title: Cranberry Orange Cornbread
88.description: Trader Joe's Gluten Free Cornbread Mix has the same classically moist & grainy texture, and sweet, buttery, corn flavor as our traditional cornbread mix - but without gluten (brown rice flour substitutes for wheat flour in this version). We've pumped it up by adding orange zest and fresh cranberries to bring a tangy-tart flair.

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Gluten Free Cornbread Mix (seasonal)
ingredients.4: 1 cup halved TJ's Organic Fresh Cranberries (seasonal)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease a 9 x 5-inch loaf pan, set aside.
steps.1: Add egg, oil and milk to a large mixing bowl and beat. Add cornbread mix and mix well for 2 to 3 minutes. Add orange zest and cranberries and mix until combine.
steps.2: Pour batter into prepared loaf pan.
steps.3: Bake on the center rack of oven for 40 - 50 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
steps.4: Remove from oven and let cool. Enjoy.

89.title: Sweet Potato Chili Cheese Fries
89.description: Trader Joe's Sweet Potato Frites are bright, golden-orange spears of delightful sweet potato with the skins removed. Steam blanched and par-fried before being frozen, they retain their fresh flavor and vibrant color when they bake yielding a crisp exterior and a creamy-yet-still-slightly-firm interior. These Frites pair splendidly with TJ's organic vegetarian chili for a sweet and savory spin on classic chili cheese fries. Dress it up with sour cream, chives and cheese for a filling snack that will be the perfect companion for game day in front of the TV.

ingredients.0: 1 Packages TJ's Sweet Potato Frites
ingredients.2: 1 Cup TJ's Sharp Shredded Cheddar Cheese, for garnish

steps.0: Preheat oven to 425°F. Spread frozen sweet potato fries evenly on a large baking sheet in a single layer. Cook for 30 - 35 minutes or until golden brown and desired crispness is achieved. Remove from oven and let cool slightly, then pile fries in the middle of the baking sheet.
steps.1: Heat chili in a medium saucepan on the stove over medium flame, stirring occasionally until warmed. Spoon warmed chili on top of sweet potato fries and sprinkle with one cup of cheese. Bake chili fries for 2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Remove from oven, let cool slightly and enjoy.

90.title: Everything Ham & Cheese Roll-Ups
90.description: The milk used to make Trader Joe's Sliced Alpine Semisoft Cheese gives it its buttery yellow hue, distinct aroma, and creamy mouthfeel-not to mention superior melting capabilities. Use these capabilities to your advantage by rolling it up with TJ's Organic Black Forest Ham in Buttery Crescent Roll dough. Sprinkled with TJ's Everything But The Bagel Sesame Seasoning Blend and baked until oozing, these roll-ups make for a cheesy, taste-bud tickling snack or appetizer.

ingredients.0: TJ's Everything But The Bagel Sesame Seasoning Blend
ingredients.2: 4 slices TJ's Sliced Alpine Semisoft Cheese, sliced in half
ingredients.3: 4 slices TJ's Organic Black Forest Ham, sliced in half

parsed_ing.0: Everything But The Bagel Sesame Seasoning Blend

corrected_ing.0: Everything But The Bagel Sesame Seasoning Blend

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Pour a few tablespoons of seasoning onto a shallow plate, set aside.
steps.1: Remove crescent roll dough from package and gently separate into 8 triangles. Top a dough triangle with a piece of cheese and a piece of ham. Roll into a crescent shape, then gently roll outside of dough in everything seasoning and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Repeat with remaining ingredients.
steps.2: Bake rolls on center rack of oven for 12-14 minutes, until rolls are golden brown and cheese is melted. Remove from oven and let cool slightly before serving.

91.title: Gouda Vibes Summer Cheese Plate
91.description: Made with certified organic, pasteurized cow's milk and aged for a minimum of 10 months on wooden boards, Trader Joe's Organic Gouda Cheese taps into a tradition of Dutch Gouda production that goes back to the 12th century. With 10 months of aging, it's been given just enough time to develop superbly nutty & lightly caramel-y flavors, while maintaining a slightly crystallized yet impossibly creamy texture that's just soft enough for easy shredding and melting.This combination of nuttiness and slight creaminess makes Trader Joe's Organic Dutch Gouda a perfect complement to tart, tannic fruit, or dry, snappy white wines and ciders. To demonstrate, in this recipe we encourage its savory study on a cheese plate, alongside TJ's Smoked Gouda and 1,000 Day Aged Gouda. Paired with tart stone fruit, sweet melon and dry roasted almonds, you'll have Gouda vibes all summer long...

ingredients.0: TJ's Organic Dutch Gouda
ingredients.6: 1/4 TJ's Cantaloupe, seeds removed and cut into cubes or scooped into balls

steps.0: Slice or cube cheeses as desired (wash your knife in between cheeses to keep the flavors separate). Arrange in piles on a large serving platter or cheese board. Fill in the gaps with fruit and almonds. Pour honey into a small dipping bowl or ramekin and nestle in between fruit and cheese. Serve with dry white wine, cider, or another sparkling summer refreshment of your choosing.

92.title: Elote Potato Salad
92.description: Summer is in full swing, which means Trader Joe's is serving up the best darn Potato Salad you ever did taste! What does "best darn" taste like, exactly? Creamy russet potatoes are mixed with real mayonnaise, chopped green onions, crunchy celery, and hard-cooked eggs, all simply seasoned and ready to enjoy. Whether you're poolside or park-bound, it's the total package.And while it's sure to please your 4th of July party patrons served right out of said package, Trader Joe's Old Fashioned Potato Salad is also a marvelous, not-quite-blank canvas for all manner of mix-ins. This recipe pairs our Potato Salad with Trader Joe's Mexican Style Roasted Corn for an electrifying, Elote-inspired side. Lip-smackingly savory, smoky, and pleasantly spicy, it's delicious served warm or cold alongside grilled chicken drumsticks or TJ's Carne Asada.

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Mexican Style Roasted Corn & Cotija Cheese (reserve included cheese packet for garnish)
ingredients.1: 1 TJ's Red Bell Pepper, cored, de-seeded and diced
ingredients.2: 1 container TJ's Old Fashioned Potato Salad

parsed_ing.0: Mexican Style Roasted Corn & Cotija Cheese

steps.0: Place corn and sauce pellets into a microwave safe dish, cover and cook on HIGH for 3 minutes. Remove cover, stir gently, and cook 1 minute longer.
steps.1: Transfer potato salad to a large serving bowl. Gently fold corn and bell pepper into potato salad. Garnish with cheese and cilantro and serve.

93.title: Greek Style Potato Salad
93.description: Summer is in full swing, which means Trader Joe's is serving up the best darn Potato Salad you ever did taste! What does "best darn" taste like, exactly? Creamy russet potatoes are mixed with real mayonnaise, chopped green onions, crunchy celery, and hard-cooked eggs, all simply seasoned and ready to enjoy. Whether you're poolside or park-bound, it's the total package.And while it's sure to please your 4th of July party patrons served right out of said package, Trader Joe's Old Fashioned Potato Salad is also a marvelous, not-quite-blank canvas for all manner of mix-ins. This recipe cools things down by combining our trusty ‘tater salad with diced red bell pepper, crunchy cucumbers, briny Kalamata olives, and Trader Joe's Organic Crumbled Feta Cheese. It's a Greek style side dish that positively sings alongside Trader Joe's Spatchcocked Lemon Rosemary Chicken.

ingredients.0: 1 container TJ's Old Fashioned Potato Salad
ingredients.2: 1 TJ's Red Bell Pepper, cored, de-seeded and diced
ingredients.4: 1/2 jar TJ's Kalamata Olives, drained and sliced in half

steps.0: Transfer potato salad to a large serving bowl. Gently fold in cucumbers, bell pepper, cheese, and olives. Garnish with parsley and serve.

94.title: Green Goddess Pasta Salad
94.description: Starting with a sturdy base of Trader Joe's Organic Brown Rice & Quinoa Spaghetti that's cooked perfectly al dente, this pasta salad layers snappy haricots verts and blanched kale with crunchy slivered almonds for an array of teeth-tickling textures. The whole thing is tied together with Trader Joe's Green Goddess Salad Dressing, a salad sidekick that offers fragrant notes of basil & chives, savory garlic & green onion, bright lemon juice, and tangy apple cider vinegar, ensuring flavorful zing in every forkful of pasta and veggies.While other versions of this heavenly dressing are made with mayonnaise, sour cream, or egg yolks (or sometimes all three!), our Green Goddess Salad Dressing gets its characteristic creaminess from the addition of luscious, ripe avocados, and nary a dairy product in sight. This makes it a consummate crowd-pleaser for appetites of all kinds, a paragon of the block party potluck, sovereign of the summer smorgasbord...

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Organic Brown Rice & Quinoa Spaghetti
ingredients.1: 1 bag TJ's Organic Tuscan Kale, stems removed OR 1 bag TJ's Cruciferous Crunch
ingredients.3: 1 bottle TJ's Green Goddess Salad Dressing
ingredients.6: TJ's Fresh Basil, rinsed and dried

steps.0: Cut corner off bag of haricots verts and microwave 2 minutes. Remove haricots verts from package and place on a clean dish towel to cool and dry. Transfer haricots verts to cutting board and slice in half crosswise; set aside.
steps.1: Bring a large pot of generously salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook 7 minutes. Add kale and cook about 2 more minutes, until noodles are very al dente and kale is wilted. Drain and rinse thoroughly with cold water. Drain very well and transfer mixture to a large bowl. Add haricots verts, dressing, and almonds to bowl and toss to combine. Season to taste with sea salt and toss once more.
steps.2: Serve immediately, or chill pasta salad for 1 hour. Tear up or slice fresh basil and garnish just before serving.

95.title: 1 Minute Lentil Salad
95.description: While traditional feta is made with sheep's milk, Trader Joe's Organic Crumbled Feta Cheese is made in Wisconsin with organic, rBST-free cow's milk. The cow's milk offers a milder flavor than sheep's milk, while retaining the pleasant tanginess so favored by feta fans. The curds are bathed in a salty brine (think of it as "pickling" but with cheese!), then drained, gently pressed and dried to allow the saltiness to infuse throughout. This process creates a buttery tanginess and a slightly firm texture that crumbles with ease. Crumbly, briny Cheese made with organic milk? Be still our palates! Although a handful of Feta atop a crisp romaine salad is a wonderful thing, there's an endless number of ways to enjoy its salty goodness outside of leafy greens. Stir it into rigatoni with sausage, white beans, and kale. Gently warm some green olives in olive oil with chili flakes and lemon peel, then pour the mixture over a shallow bowl of Organic Crumbled Feta Cheese, and serve with crusty bread for dipping. Or, mix it with TJ's Fresh Bruschetta Sauce and Steamed Lentils for an instant appetizer, side dish, or light lunch.

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Steamed & Fully Cooked Lentils
ingredients.1: 1 package TJ's Organic Crumbled Feta Cheese

steps.0: In a medium bowl, combine lentils, feta and bruschetta sauce, and stir. Garnish with fresh basil or parsley, if you like, and serve with your favorite TJ's crackers.

96.title: Chunky Salsa with Cream Cheese
96.description: Made with big chunks of organic diced tomatoes, organic tomato paste, organic onions, and organic jalapenos, then spiced with organic cayenne pepper and organic dehydrated garlic, Trader Joe's Organic Thick & Chunky Salsa is fresh and flavorful, packing just the right amount of medium-level heat. And, boy, is this Salsa versatile. Sure, you can use it as you would any other-in burritos, tacos, and quesadillas, with tortilla chips, etc. But you can also use it in less expected ways. Spoon it atop baked chicken or fish. Pour a few jars into a slow cooker with TJ's Bone-In Skin-On Chicken Thighs and vegetables. Use it as the sauce on a tasty Mexican-inspired pizza. Or, simply pour it over rich cream cheese for a lightning-fast appetizer, and dig in with your favorite TJ's Tortilla Chips!

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Cream Cheese, softened
ingredients.1: 1 1/2 cups TJ's Organic Thick & Chunky Salsa

steps.0: Unwrap cream cheese and arrange on serving plate or in wide shallow bowl. Top with salsa. Grab your favorite Trader Joe's Tortilla Chips and dig in!

97.title: PB&J Snack Mix
97.description: In the style of our popular Freeze Dried Strawberries, Freeze Dried Fuji Apple Slices, etc., our new Trader Joe's Freeze Dried Red Seedless Grape Slices are just what their name suggests: sweet, tangy red seedless grapes that have been picked at peak ripeness, then immediately sliced and freeze-dried with their skins left on to lock in their intense flavor. Unlike most of the dried fruit you'd find at a grocery or convenience store, these Grapes are free from added sulfur (unsulfured), free from added sugar (unsweetened), and never exposed to any high temperatures in the drying process.Trader Joe's Freeze Dried Red Seedless Grape Slices are great for snacking anytime-we've discovered that smaller children find them not only delicious, but surprisingly fascinating as well. But, least you think these Grape Slices are just for kids, we're pleased to inform you that they also make a great addition to a bowl of cereal, a batch of trek mix, or a scoop of ice cream. You could even pair them with Trader Joe's Bamba Peanut Snacks to evoke the flavors of PB&J in crunchy snack form...

ingredients.0: 2 bags TJ's Freeze Dried Red Seedless Grapes Slices

parsed_ing.0: Freeze Dried Red Seedless Grapes Slices

steps.0: Combine grape slices and Bamba in a medium bowl. Shake it up to evenly distribute (you want to make sure to get PB&J flavor in every handful). Dig in!

98.title: Good As Gold Mini Meatballs
98.description: Trader Joe's Carolina Gold Barbeque Sauce is a rich, thick golden-hued, mustard-based sauce that reminds us of some of the best-grilled meats we've enjoyed in the Carolinas. It's sweet & smoky, with a hint of molasses and an ideal blend of spices. Use it as a glaze near the end of barbecuing, as a condiment for burgers and sandwiches, or as a dipping sauce for Trader Joe's Gluten Free Breaded Chicken Breast Nuggets, veggies, or fries.  You can even go non-traditional and use it as a simmer sauce for Trader Joe's Party Size Mini Meatballs. No matter how you use it, your result will be worth its weight in gold - Carolina Gold.

ingredients.0: 1 bag TJ's Party Size Mini Meatballs
ingredients.1: 1 bottle TJ's Carolina Gold Barbeque Sauce

steps.0: Place meatballs in a large microwave-safe container with lid. Microwave 4 minutes.
steps.1: Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, heat barbeque sauce on low, stirring occasionally.
steps.2: Remove bowl of meatballs from microwave. Add meatballs to saucepan and stir to coat with sauce. Continue to heat on low, about 3 minutes, until sauce is bubbly.
steps.3: Transfer meatballs and sauce to a serving bowl. Garnish with chives and chili flakes to taste, and dig in!

99.title: Cheesy Baguette
99.description: Too often, French cheese is enjoyed only for cheese's sake, isolated to cheeseboards and wine tastings, while its non-continental cousins are much more likely to be used to their fullest potential on sandwiches, burgers, and the like. No longer. With Trader Joe's French Fromage Slices, we can finally shout, "vive la cheeseburger!" with gleeful impunity. With its super creamy mouthfeel and soft-ripened, full-flavored profile (very similar to a French Brie), our French Fromage Slices pair exceptionally well with juicy and sweet, tart and acidic, or deeply savory flavors. Try melting them in a cheesy baguette showered with Trader Joe's Onion Salt for an easy appetizer, and then see where your imagination takes you...

ingredients.0: 1 TJ's Organic French Baguette
ingredients.1: 5 TJ's French Fromage Slices Semisoft Cheese, torn into pieces
ingredients.2: TJ's Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil

steps.0: Preheat oven to 400°F. Halve baguette crosswise to create two smaller baguettes. Slice a small valley along the top of each baguette. Use your fingers to gently pull the baguettes open without breaking them apart. Stuff the baguettes with cheese, leaving a bit of the cheese sticking out across the top.
steps.1: Transfer baguettes to a large rimmed baking sheet. Use a pastry brush to lightly coat the baguettes and cheese with a bit of olive oil, then generously shower them with seasoning. Bake on center rack of oven for 8-12 minutes, until cheese is melted and baguettes are lightly browned. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Using a serrated knife, gently slice each baguette into 6 pieces. Enjoy warm.

100.title: Cheesy Jalapeño Beer Bread
100.description: "Just add beer and butter"-possibly the five best words to be combined in one sentence. It's also the phrase you'll find gracing each box of Trader Joe's Beer Bread Mix. The flavor of the finished loaf really depends on what kind of beer you use: Go with a lager for a lighter profile, an IPA for a hearty, hoppy taste, or a stout for a rich result with a slightly darker finished product. Or really embrace the DIY ethos and whip up a batch o' bread using a bottle of homebrew. This recipe calls for a clean, crisp lager to serve as the backdrop to TJ's Hot & Sweet Jalapenos and savory Unexpected Cheddar. Serve generous slices alone or alongside a hearty bowl of soup-or really gild the lily with a swoosh of Trader Joe's Cultured Salted Butter!

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Oil Spray
ingredients.3: 1 block TJ's Unexpected Cheddar, grated and divided
ingredients.4: 1/2 cup TJ's Hot & Sweet Jalapenos, halved, plus more for garnish

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 9"x5" loaf pan with canola oil spray; set aside.
steps.1: Add beer bread mix to a large bowl and make a well in the center. Pour beer into well and gently stir until a shaggy dough forms (do not overmix). Gently stir in 3/4 of the grated cheese and the halved jalapenos.
steps.2: Spread dough into greased loaf pan. Top with remaining cheese and a few jalapeno slices for garnish. Pour melted butter evenly over top.
steps.3: Place a large rimmed baking sheet on the bottom rack of oven to catch any drips. Place the loaf pan on the center rack and bake 55-65 minutes, or until a toothpick placed in center of loaf comes out clean.
steps.4: Remove pan from oven and let cool 15 minutes before removing loaf from pan. Slice and enjoy!

101.title: Cranberry Baked Camembert Cheese
101.description: Interested in a soft-ripened cheese with a little more oomph? Le Rustique Camembert fits the bill. Native to Normandy, France, this Camembert is a holiday staple in the Trader Joe's cheese canon. Similar to Brie (but from a different native region of France), this creamy, pleasantly tangy, full-flavored cheese makes a fabulously fancy & festive appetizer when baked and topped with tangy Trader Joe's Cranberry Orange Relish.

ingredients.0: 1 wheel Le Rustique Camembert (seasonal)
ingredients.3: TJ's Walnuts and Fresh Rosemary, for garnish (optional)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Unwrap camembert and place in the center of a small cast iron skillet or ceramic baking dish. Place on center rack of oven and bake 5-15 minutes (check every 5 minutes or so and remove from oven when cheese is oozing to your desired preference).
steps.1: Top cheese with cranberry relish*. Let cool slightly and garnish with walnuts and rosemary. Serve with water crackers for dipping.
steps.2: *You can add the cranberry relish prior to baking, if desired; the color and tanginess of the relish will be somewhat subdued if you go this route.

102.title: Toscano Cheese Board
102.description: Trader Joe's Toscano Cheese combines the robust, nutty characteristics of aged parmesan with a creamy farmstead Cheddar-a particular profile that allows for maximum fromage flavoring. One variation on our shelves is soaked in Syrah, imbuing the cheese with jammy blackberry and plum notes. Another version offers a generous coating of Black Pepper, for a nose-tingling aroma and pungent flavor. Both Cheeses are excellent on a serving board with honey, whole grain mustard, fresh grapes, and an array of your favorite crackers.

ingredients.0: TJ's Creamy Toscano Cheese Soaked in Syrah
ingredients.1: TJ's Toscano Cheese with Black Pepper
ingredients.4: TJ's Crisps (Fig & Olive or Raisin & Rosemary)
ingredients.6: TJ's Prosciutto or TJ's Uncured Salame di Parma Mild Salami

parsed_ing.0: Creamy Toscano Cheese Soaked in Syrah

steps.0: Remove cheese from fridge 30 minutes prior to serving. Set each wedge on opposite ends of a large cheese board or serving platter. (Try to build your board in the location where it will be enjoyed-the precarious piles of goodies may roll around when you move the board!)
steps.1: Slice each cheese wedge and shingle slices along the length of the board. Place two small dipping dishes or ramekins on board; fill one with honey and fill the other with mustard.
steps.2: Add a few piles of crisps to each side of the board. Fill the gaps on the board with haphazard piles of grapes, prosciutto, cornichons, and almonds. Enjoy!

103.title: Manchego Fig Bites
103.description: Produced using the whole milk of the region's native Manchega sheep, Trader Joe's Manchego Anejo Cheese exemplifies the clean, buttery, slightly nutty flavor and delightfully crumbly texture of Manchego, then takes it to another level altogether by aging it for a full year. All that extra time lets the cheese develop rich, caramelized notes and a firm, but still gracefully elastic structure, making it a staunchly dependable appetizer companion for dried figs, prosciutto, and a crisp glass of Sauvignon Blanc.

ingredients.0: 1 wedge TJ's 12-Month Aged Manchego Anejo, cubed
ingredients.2: 6 slices TJ's Prosciutto, sliced in half lengthwise
ingredients.3: TJ's Whole Grain Dijon Mustard and TJ's Honey, to serve (optional)

parsed_ing.3: Whole Grain Dijon Mustard and TJ's Honey

steps.0: Fold a slice of prosciutto back and forth on itself to create a ruffled look. Gently skewer the folded prosciutto with a toothpick, followed by a fig half and a cube of cheese. Repeat assembly process with remaining ingredients.
steps.1: Serve alone or with TJ's Whole Grain Dijon Mustard and your favorite TJs Honey for dipping.

104.title: Unexpected Cheddar Cheese Ball
104.description: At first bite, Trader Joe's Unexpected Cheddar tastes like an aged Cheddar. And then something unexpected happens. The smooth creaminess of the Cheddar gives way to a tangy flavor and slightly crumbly texture, a subtle hint of salt crystallization is discovered, and it begins to taste like an aged Parmesan. Surprising, astonishing, and unanticipated. Unexpected indeed! This easy appetizer recipe imbues the classic holiday cheese ball with that same Unexpected spirit-it's a little spicy, very cheesy, and utterly irresistible.

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Unexpected Cheddar, broken into chunks
ingredients.5: 1/2 package TJ's Sweet & Spicy Pecans, chopped
ingredients.6: TJ's Golden Rounds Crackers, for serving

steps.0: Add cheeses, chili pepper sauce, seasoning and lemon juice to food processor bowl. Pulse to bring mixture together, scraping down sides of bowl as needed. Continue to process until mixture is smooth, 1-2 minutes.
steps.1: Lay a square of cling wrap large enough to cover cheese ball on work surface. Scoop cheese mixture into center of wrap, then gather wrap up on all sides, gently shaping the mixture into a ball. Twist the ends of the cling wrap tightly, and refrigerate cheese ball (2 hours minimum, but overnight really lets the flavors meld together!).
steps.2: Before serving, remove cheese ball from fridge. Spread chopped pecans on work surface. Unwrap cheese ball and press into chopped pecans, gently reshaping as needed. Serve with a cheese spreader, surrounded by TJ's Golden Rounds Crackers.

105.title: Sausage & Kale Stuffing
105.description: Subtly sweet and not too hot, Trader Joe's Sweet Italian Pork Sausage is pre-seasoned and ready to star in everything from sausage & peppers to meat sauce. Add to it this stuffing recipe for your Turkey Day Feast, and be prepared for coworkers to ask, "What's that delicious smell?" when you reheat leftovers for lunch.

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Oil Spray
ingredients.4: 1 lb. TJ's Sweet Italian Pork Sausage or Hot Italian Pork Sausage, casing removed
ingredients.6: 1 package TJ's Organic Cooked & Peeled Chestnuts, halved
ingredients.7: TJ's Shaved Parmesan, Romano & Asiago Cheese
ingredients.8: TJ's Cranberry Sauce & Turkey Gravy, for serving (optional)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 13x9-inch casserole dish with canola oil spray and set aside.
steps.1: In a large saucepan, mix butter, water and seasoning pouch from stuffing mix and bring to a low boil for 3-5 minutes. Remove from heat and gently fold in croutons until thoroughly moistened. Transfer to a large bowl, cover and let sit 10 minutes.
steps.2: While stuffing sits, heat a large saute pan or skillet over medium. Add sausage to pan and saute, stirring occasionally, until cooked through, about 8 minutes. Add kale to pan and saute a few minutes more to wilt. Remove from heat and stir in chestnuts.
steps.3: Gently fold sausage mixture into stuffing until evenly distributed. Transfer to casserole dish in an even layer. Top with a generous handful of cheese.
steps.4: Place dish on center rack of oven and bake until center is heated through and top is golden brown, 30-45 minutes. Remove stuffing from oven and let cool slightly. Serve with gravy and cranberry sauce on the side.

106.title: Cheesy Hash Brown Casserole
106.description: Who needs mashed potatoes when you can crumble Trader Joe's Turkey and Stuffing Seasoned Kettle Chips atop a Cheesy Hash Brown Casserole? First you taste the turkey, then comes the stuffing. If you close your eyes, you'll swear you can taste the creamy gravy... even as you crunch into these 100% American-grown, patiently kettle-cooked potato chips.

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Oil SPray
ingredients.1: 11/2 bags TJ's Shredded Hash Browns, thawed
ingredients.3: 1 package TJ's Condensed Portabella Mushroom Soup
ingredients.4: 2/3 package (8 ounces) TJ's Shredded Sharp Cheddar
ingredients.5: 1/2 package TJ's Green Onions, trimmed and thinly sliced, divided
ingredients.6: 2 cups crushed TJ's Turkey and Stuffing Seasoned Kettle Chips

parsed_ing.6: Turkey and Stuffing Seasoned Kettle Chips

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 9x13 casserole dish with canola oil spray, set aside.
steps.1: In a very large bowl, stir sour cream and condensed soup until combined. Add hash browns and stir to coat evenly with soup mixture. Gently fold in cheese and 3/4 of the green onions. Spread mixture evenly in prepared casserole dish and cover with crushed potato chips.
steps.2: Bake casserole on center rack of oven until center is heated through and cheese is bubbling, 45-55 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Top with remaining green onions before serving.

107.title: Stuffing Muffins
107.description: These portable parcels of stuffing goodness are a warm and inviting antidote to chilly fall days. The recipe starts with Trader Joe's Cornbread Stuffing Mix, liberally seasoned with chicken broth, garlic & onion powders, and fragrant spices. Once the stuffing is prepared, Dried Cranberries are folded in for a slightly sweet chew.Like finding the secret decoder ring inside the cereal box, simply slice into a Stuffing Muffin to reveal the reward baked within: a moist, savory Turkey Meatball. It's a delightful surprise, made tastier with a dip in our savory Turkey Gravy.

ingredients.0: 1 box TJ's Cornbread Stuffing Mix
ingredients.5: 6 TJ's Fully Cooked Turkey Meatballs, microwaved according to package directions and halved

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix butter, water and seasoning pouch from stuffing mix in a large saucepan and bring to a low boil for 3-5 minutes. Remove from heat and gently fold in croutons until thoroughly moistened. Cover and let sit for 10 minutes.
steps.1: While stuffing sits, place turkey meatballs in a microwave-safe dish. Cover and microwave 2-3 minutes. Remove from microwave, slice in half and set aside. Remove lid from stuffing and gently stir in cranberries.
steps.2: Grease a 12-cup muffin pan with canola oil spray. Fill muffin cup about 1/3 full with stuffing. Add a turkey meatball half (flat side down) and cover with stuffing until you have a small mound that sits slightly above the rim of the pan. Repeat with remaining stuffing and turkey meatball halves. Place pan on center rack of oven and bake 40-45 minutes. Remove pan from oven and let sit 10 minutes.
steps.3: While muffins cool, heat gravy according to package directions. Gently remove muffins from pan with a fork or butter knife. Serve with gravy for dipping.

108.title: Chèvre With Honey Brioche Toasts
108.description: Trader Joe's Chevre with Honey Goat's Milk Cheese combines the sweet goodness of honey with the tangy temptation of goat cheese. Slather it on Brioche Toasts and pair with your favorite rose for a simple, slightly sweet appetizer or afternoon snack.

ingredients.0: 2 packages TJ's Chevre With Honey Goat's Milk Cheese

parsed_ing.0: Chevre With Honey Goat's Milk Cheese

steps.0: Slather brioche toasts with goat cheese and garnish with blueberries. Enjoy!

109.title: Everything Cream Cheese Crispbreads
109.description: Top Trader Joe's Gluten Free Crispbreads with Whipped Cream Cheese and Everything But The Bagel Sesame Seasoning Blend for a hearty snack or fancy appetizer that comes together in less than five minutes.

ingredients.0: TJ's Gluten Free Crispbreads
ingredients.2: TJ's Everything But The Bagel Sesame Seasoning Blend

parsed_ing.2: Everything But The Bagel Sesame Seasoning Blend

corrected_ing.2: Everything But The Bagel Sesame Seasoning Blend

steps.0: Generously slather a crispbread with cream cheese. Sprinkle liberally with seasoning blend and top with fresh dill. Enjoy!

110.title: Five-ish Layer Dip
110.description: If you build it, they will dip-"it" being a creamy, Five-ish Layer Dip, of course. Topped with an organic blend of our most popular cheeses (Mozzarella, Monterey Jack and Cheddar), this recipe is a perennial party favorite.

ingredients.0: 1 can TJ's Organic Salsa Style Refried Black Beans
ingredients.2: 1 tub (16 oz) TJ's Organic Sour Cream
ingredients.4: 1/2 bag TJ's Organic Shredded 3 Cheese Blend
ingredients.8: TJ's Restaurant Style Tortilla Chips (or your favorite TJ's Tortilla Chips) for dipping
ingredients.9: 2-quart serving dish (or individual ramekins) for dip assembly

parsed_ing.0: Organic Salsa Style Refried Black Beans

steps.0: In a 2-quart serving dish, use a spatula to spread beans across the bottom of the dish in an even layer. Continue gently layering with guacamole, sour cream, and salsa (rinse your spatula when switching ingredients to keep your layers clean).
steps.1: Top with cheese, green onions, cilantro, and olives. Dig in with your favorite TJ's tortilla chips.

111.title: Prosciutto Melon Bites
111.description: Trader Joe's Sliced Prosciutto is crafted for us by a well-known, award-winning Italian salumeri here in the U.S. They begin with full hams that are cured in the traditional Italian style, then allowed to age slowly for 10-12 months. As the hams age, their flavor intensifies and their character builds, resulting in richly-flavored Prosciutto that's outstanding on Panini with arugula & Asiago, and super on a pizza-try it with pesto or a cream-based sauce and inch-long cuts of asparagus. We especially enjoy it with fresh melon in this no-cook, summery appetizer recipe that pairs wonderfully with a crisp, fruity rose or dry cider.

ingredients.0: 1/2 TJ's Tuscan Melon (or small cantaloupe), cubed
ingredients.1: 1 package TJ's Sliced Prosciutto, gently sliced in half lengthwise

steps.0: Lay a piece of prosciutto on a clean, dry work surface. Set a melon cube at one end, and wrap prosciutto around melon. Top with a fresh basil leaf or two, and push a toothpick through the center to secure. Enjoy!

112.title: Spicy Fried Pickles
112.description: The bite of vinegar and dill in our Organic Hot & Spicy Dill Pickle Chips get an extra boost from the addition of organic chili powder. Drop these formidably fiery Pickle Chips in a Josephsbrau Pilsner beer batter and fry them up for a drool-worthy appetizer or burger topping.

ingredients.0: 2 jars TJ's Organic Kosher Hot & Spicy Dill Pickle Chips, drained

parsed_ing.0: Organic Kosher Hot & Spicy Dill Pickle Chips

steps.0: Line a large cutting board with paper towels. Arrange pickles atop paper towels and pat dry, set aside.
steps.1: In a medium bowl, whisk beer, egg, baking powder and salt. Add flour and whisk until smooth, set aside.
steps.2: Pour sunflower oil in a medium saucepot (about an inch high) and heat to medium high-oil should reach 375°F. Oil is ready when a drop of batter sizzles when added to the pot.
steps.3: While oil heats, place a cooling rack atop a rimmed cookie sheet. (This is where your pickles will hang out after you fry each batch-the air circulation helps avoid sogginess, so don't skip this step!)
steps.4: Working in batches (8-10 pickles at a time, depending on the size of your pot), dredge pickle chips in beer batter, shake off excess and carefully lower into hot oil with tongs. Fry 3-4 minutes, turning halfway through with a slotted spoon, until chips are golden brown. Remove from pot and place on cooling rack to cool for a few minutes. Enjoy!

113.title: Pickled Party Mix
113.description: Think of this recipe as a cheese board in snack mix form: the combination of pucker-producing Pickled Popcorn, crunchy Cheddar Rockets, and savory Smoked Almonds hits all the flavors of the real thing, no knives required.

ingredients.0: 1 bag TJ's Popcorn in a Pickle
ingredients.2: 2 cups TJ's Smoked Seasoned Mesquite Almonds

steps.0: In a large serving bowl, gently combine popcorn, cheddar rockets and almonds. Enjoy!

114.title: Harissa Potato Salad
114.description: Trader Joe's Traditional Tunisian Harissa is one of those special sauces that you will want to put on everything and anything, once you get a taste. It's prepared in small batches with fresh, red chiles that are grilled in a tumbler over an open flame, and blended with a traditional mix of herbs and spices. This deep red concoction is smooth and spreadable, with a little smoke flavor (from the grilling), and a healthy amount of heat. Yes, it is as flavorfully divine as it sounds.Create a traditional dish with this Tunisian Harissa atop TJ's Albacore Tuna in Olive Oil. For a flavorful dip with a kick, stir some Harissa into your favorite TJ's Hummus. Or, liven up classic potato salad with a spoonful (or two, or three) of this spicy stuff for an effortless summer side dish.

ingredients.0: 1 container TJ's Old Fashioned Potato Salad
ingredients.1: 1 tablespoon TJ's Traditional Tunisian Harissa (or more, if you're feeling brave!)
ingredients.2: 4 slices TJ's Fully Cooked Uncured Bacon, microwaved and crumbled into pieces

steps.0: Combine potato salad and harissa in a medium serving bowl. Taste and add more harissa, if desired. Gently fold in bacon crumbles. Enjoy immediately, or refrigerate until ready to serve.

115.title: Blueberry Corn Cake
115.description: The slightly sweet flavor profile of TJ's Cornbread Mix is amplified by the even sweeter addition of our famed, frozen Wild Boreal Blueberries in this Southern-inspired dessert. Serve this sweet-but-not-too-sweet cake warm, generously slathered with whipped honey butter, and you'll be in cornbread heaven.

ingredients.0: 3/4 cup TJ's Organic Sour Cream
ingredients.5: 1 1/2 cups TJ's Frozen Wild Boreal Blueberries, divided

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan, set aside.
steps.1: In a large bowl, whisk sour cream, oil, milk and egg until smooth. Add cornbread mix and stir gently to combine; do not overmix.
steps.2: Add 1/2 cup frozen blueberries to prepared baking pan. Scrape cornbread batter atop blueberries, spreading batter evenly to sides of pan. Cover surface of batter with remaining blueberries.
steps.3: Place baking pan on center rack of oven and bake 40-45 minutes, until cake is golden and edges pull away from sides of pan. Remove from oven and let cool 15 minutes before slicing.

116.title: Green Goddess Grilled Corn
116.description: Nothing says summer like fresh corn grilled in its own husk. Baste it with Trader Joe's Green Goddess Salad Dressing and a smattering of chili flakes before you toss it on the grill, and you've got a fresh-tasting, unfussy side dish to pair with the rest of your summer fare.

ingredients.0: 8 ears TJ's Fresh Corn
ingredients.3: TJ's Sea Salt & Pepper, to taste

steps.0: Remove two or three outer layers of the husk from each ear of corn. A few layers should remain to protect the corn as it cooks. Gently peel back the remaining husks to expose the corn and remove as much of the silk as is possible. Place husks back over the ears and add to a large bowl or baking dish. Fill with water to cover corn and soak for 1 hour.
steps.1: Gently peel back the husks once again to expose the corn. Baste generously with dressing, and top with chili flakes (if using), salt and pepper.
steps.3: Fold the husks back into place and line up all the corn on a sturdy sheet of aluminum foil. Place the foil directly on the grill over medium heat. Grill 15 minutes, turning frequently. Remove foil from grill and cook another 5 minutes, allowing the husks to get nice and charred. Remove from grill and let cool for a few minutes before serving.

117.title: Kickin' Corn Dip
117.description: When we crafted this Kickin' Corn Dip recipe in our test kitchen, our tasters simply couldn't get enough of it. It takes three cheeses to create its creamy base: velvety cream cheese, spicy Monterey Jack, and our finely shredded Mexican Blend for superb meltability.The chipotle peppers, adobo sauce and lime juice in Trader Joe's Cowboy Caviar Salsa cut through the all that creamy richness with irresistible heat and tangy flavor-this dip is not for the faint of heart, folks. Topped with our frozen Roasted Corn (and even more cheese for good measure), it's baked until bubbling, ready to be scooped up by your favorite (corn) tortilla chips, crudites, or Cornbread Crisps.

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Cream Cheese, softened
ingredients.2: 3/4 cup TJ's Shredded Monterey Jack Cheese
ingredients.3: 1 cup TJ's Fancy Shredded Mexican Blend Cheese, divided

steps.0: Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease a 2-quart baking dish with cooking spray, set aside.
steps.1: Add cream cheese to a medium size, microwave safe bowl. Microwave on half power for 1 minute intervals, whipping with a fork in between, until warm and smooth. Add cowboy caviar, Monterey Jack cheese and 3/4 cup fancy shredded Mexican blend and stir to combine. Scrape mixture into prepared baking dish and top with remaining cheese and roasted corn.
steps.2: Place dish on center rack of oven and bake 30 minutes, until well browned and bubbling. Cool slightly before digging in with your edible scoop of choice.

118.title: Sweet & Spicy Glazed Carrots
118.description: Trader Joe's Organic Whole Carrots become tender and sweetly fragrant thanks to a hot bath in TJ's Brewed Ginger Beer and honey. Simple yet elegant, this dish is equally delicious served hot or cold. Feel free to reduce or omit the cayenne pepper for the heat-averse crowd.

ingredients.0: 1 bag (1 lb.) TJ's Organic Carrots
ingredients.1: 1 bottle (12 oz.) TJ's Brewed Ginger Beer
ingredients.2: 2 tablespoons TJ's Cultured Butter or Salted Butter
ingredients.5: TJ's Unsalted Dry Toasted Sliced Almonds and Fresh Chopped Parsley, for garnish

parsed_ing.5: Unsalted Dry Toasted Sliced Almonds and Fresh Chopped Parsley

steps.0: Peel carrots and trim ends. Slice on a diagonal, about 1/4-inch thick. Add carrots, ginger beer and butter to a large saute pan. Cover and bring to a simmer. Remove lid and stir. Reduce heat to low, replace lid and simmer 5 minutes more.
steps.1: Remove lid and stir in cayenne pepper and honey. Continue to cook, stirring occasionally until liquid is reduced to a thick glaze, about 15 minutes. Remove pan from heat and let cool 5 minutes. Garnish with almonds and parsley before serving.

119.title: Falafel Scones with Harissa Yogurt
119.description: This savory, slightly sweet scone gets a dose of Mediterranean flavor from our very own Falafel Mix.

ingredients.0: 1 cup TJ's Plain Whole Milk Greek Yogurt
ingredients.1: 2 heaping teaspoons TJ's Traditional Tunisian Harissa (or more, to taste)
ingredients.5: 1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon TJ's Baking Powder
ingredients.6: 1/2 cup (1 stick) TJ's Unsalted Butter, cold, cut into small chunks
ingredients.9: 1/2 cup TJ's Sundried Tomatoes in Olive Oil, roughly chopped OR 1/2 TJ's Roasted Red Bell Pepper, drained and thinly sliced

steps.0: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or spray with cooking spray; set aside. Combine yogurt and harissa in a small bowl, cover and refrigerate.
steps.1: In a large bowl, combine falafel mix, flour, sugar, and baking powder in a large bowl. Cut the butter into the dry ingredients until crumbly, leaving pea sized chunks of butter. Set aside.
steps.2: In a medium bowl, lightly beat the eggs and heavy cream. Make a well in the center of dry mixture and add egg mixture. Fold gently with a spatula, until just combined. Gently stir in sundried tomatoes, if using.
steps.3: Divide dough in half. Stretch dough into a circle, about 6 inches in diameter and 1/2 inch thick, and place it on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat with remaining dough. Cut each circle into six triangles, and top with sliced red bell pepper, if using.
steps.4: Place baking sheet on center rack of oven and bake 15-17 minutes until golden. Remove from oven and transfer scones to a wire rack to cool. Wait 5 minutes, then serve with harissa yogurt for drizzling.

120.title: Fruit & Cashew Butter Toast
120.description: A toast with the most! Pile the fruit as high as your heart desires.

ingredients.0: 2 slices of your favorite TJ's Multigrain Bread
ingredients.2: 1 cup TJ's Frozen Peach Slices, defrosted
ingredients.5: 2 tablespoons TJ's Creamy Salted Cashew Butter
ingredients.6: Additional mint for garnish, if desired

steps.0: Toast slices of bread to desired crispiness.
steps.1: While bread is toasting, slice defrosted peaches into one-inch pieces. Place peaches, blackberries, honey, and chopped mint in a bowl and stir to combine.
steps.2: Spread cashew butter on toast. Divide fruit salad evenly atop toast. Garnish with additional mint leaves and a drizzle of honey, if desired. Serve immediately

121.title: Roasted Carrots Of Many Colors
121.description: Trader Joe's Organic Carrots of Many Colors taste like carrots-no surprise there-but their color really pops on a plate. Slice these vibrant taproots into spears, present them on a tray, and serve them with your favorite dip. Or toss them with olive oil, thyme, and salt & pepper, and roast them for about 20 minutes. The earthy, sweet flavor of these roasted carrots is equally at home alongside an Easter ham or Thanksgiving turkey dinner.

ingredients.0: 1 package (2 pounds) TJ's Organic Carrots Of Many Colors, rinsed and dried
ingredients.1: 1 tablespoon TJ's Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil
ingredients.2: 1 tablespoon TJ's Organic Apple Cider Vinegar OR Balsamic Vinegar

steps.0: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside.
steps.1: Peel carrots and trim ends, discard ends and peels. Slice carrots in half crosswise, then slice in half lengthwise. Add carrots to a large bowl and drizzle with olive oil, vinegar, and salt, and toss to coat. Spread carrots evenly on prepared baking sheet and tuck a few sprigs of fresh thyme in between the carrots.
steps.2: Place baking sheet on center rack of oven and roast 15-20 minutes, until carrots are fork tender. Turn oven to broil (high) and broil carrots 2-3 minutes (watch carefully to avoid burning). Remove sheet from oven and let cool 5 minutes before serving.

122.title: Minted Peas & Goat Cheese
122.description: This bright, fresh side dish is a perfect partner to our Spatchcocked Lemon Rosemary Chicken.

ingredients.0: 2 packages TJ's English Peas
ingredients.1: 2 teaspoons TJ's Organic Tunisian Extra Virgin Olive Oil
ingredients.4: Dash TJ's Sea Salt, to taste

parsed_ing.1: Organic Tunisian Extra Virgin Olive Oil

steps.0: Microwave peas according to package directions. Add peas to a colander and rinse under cold water for 1-2 minutes to stop cooking. Shake colander to remove excess water, and pour peas into a medium-sized bowl. Add olive oil, lemon juice and mint, and gently stir to combine. Add sea salt to taste.
steps.1: To serve, spoon peas into a bowl or plate, and top with goat cheese crumbles.

123.title: Loaded Totchos
123.description: Crisp and pleasantly salty with a warm, tender interior, Trader Joe's Trader Potato Tots hit the mark for appetizer awesomeness and superb late-night snacking. They're crafted with shredded Northwest potatoes that are pressed into bite-size nuggets and fried to achieve a gloriously golden, crunchy exterior. Use them as a base for cheesy Totchos with hot & sweet jalapenos, black beans, and your protein of choice-we opted for a batch of Jackfruit Carnitas for a marvelously meatless presentation.

ingredients.0: 1 bag TJ's Trader Potato Tots
ingredients.1: 1 block TJ's Jalapeno Jack Cheese, shredded and divided
ingredients.2: 1 can TJ's Organic Black Beans, drained
ingredients.3: 1/2 batch of Jackfruit Carnitas (or 2 cups of your favorite cooked protein)
ingredients.4: TJ's Hot & Sweet Jalapenos, Sour Cream & Cilantro (for garnish)

steps.0: Spread tots on a large, rimmed baking pan and cook according to package directions. Remove pan from oven and set on heat-safe work surface.
steps.1: Using tongs or a spatula, pile half of the tots in the center of the pan. Sprinkle with half of the cheese, then pile remaining tots on top. Scatter black beans, jackfruit carnitas, remaining cheese and jalapenos atop the tots.
steps.2: Return pan to oven and cook 5-10 minutes more to melt the cheese. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Garnish with cilantro and sour cream, and enjoy!

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Party Size Mini Meatballs

steps.0: Slow Cooker Method: Add meatballs, sauce and chutney to a 2-quart slow cooker and stir until meatballs are evenly coated. Heat 2-3 hours on high, stirring after 1 hour. Switch slow cooker to warm setting to serve.
steps.1: Oven Method: Preheat oven to 350°. Place meatballs in a baking dish (appx. 9" x 9") and cover with masala sauce. Place on center rack of oven and cook for 20-30 minutes, or until meatballs are heated through and sauce is hot. Serve with chutney for dipping.

125.title: Brie-lieve it or not
125.description: Few culinary combos have the power to create crowds at a buffet like crunchy chips and hot cheese dip...

ingredients.0: 1 wedge TJ's Triple Creme Brie

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Unwrap brie and place in the center of a small baking dish (there should be room for the cheese to spread and fill the dish as it melts). Place on center rack of oven and bake 10-15 minutes or until gently bubbling (watch closely after the 10 minute mark to avoid burned cheese!). Remove from oven and let cool 5 minutes. If desired, stir in a spoonful of pumpkin butter, then grab some Pumpkin Tortilla Chips and dig in!

126.title: Tahini Salad Dressing
126.description: Food may not be the first thing that comes to mind when you hear the phrase "dress for success," but it should be. After all, a well-seasoned salad dressing can make or break a meal, especially if salad is the focal point. Too heavy and the flavors of the other components are lost; too light and there's nothing to really hold it together. Trader Joe's Organic Tahini provides the perfect balance in this recipe, and allows it to transcend seasons-drizzle it atop roasted broccoli salad in the winter, or on grilled chicken & spinach salad during the warm summer months. And while this recipe may have "salad dressing" in the name, don't let that stop you from transcending salad and dressing chicken kebabs, grilled shrimp, cubed tofu, or roasted veggies for dinner success.

ingredients.0: 1/4 cup TJ's Organic Tahini
ingredients.2: 1/4 cup water; 2 teaspoons TJ's Minced Garlic
ingredients.3: 1/8 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste

steps.0: Add all ingredients to a small bowl and whisk vigorously until well incorporated. Taste and adjust seasoning as necessary. Drizzle with abandon and enjoy!

127.title: G.O.A.T. (Greatest Of All Toast)
127.description: These flavorful Trader Joe's Yellow Cling Peaches are grown in Valencia, Spain where they're nurtured in proximity to the warm Mediterranean Sea-then peeled, pitted, and preserved in white grape juice. Serve the beautiful, intact Halves with a dollop of cheese or cream in the center and a sprinkle of granola or coconut. Slice to add a pop of color & burst of juicy sweetness to your ice cream, yogurt, or fruit salad. Or try this sweet-savory breakfast or snack combo and layer them on toast atop a hearty schmear of Trader Joe's Goat's Milk Cheese Marinated with Herbs.

ingredients.0: 4 slices TJ's Multigrain Bread
ingredients.1: 1 container TJ's Goat's Milk Cheese Marinated With Herbs, softened to room temperature
ingredients.2: 4 TJ's Cling Peach Halves, thinly sliced

parsed_ing.1: Goat's Milk Cheese Marinated With Herbs

steps.0: Toast multigrain bread to desired level of doneness. Top each piece of toast with a goat cheese disk and spread to cover evenly. Top with peach slices and basil. Drizzle with oil & herbs from cheese container, if desired. Enjoy!

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Grilled Asparagus Spears, thawed according to package directions and chopped into large pieces
ingredients.1: 1 bag TJ's Roasted Corn, microwaved according to package directions
ingredients.3: 2 TJ's Red Bell Peppers (or Enjoya Peppers), chopped
ingredients.4: 1/2 to 3/4 cup TJ's Organic Rose Vinaigrette

steps.0: Combine vegetables in a large bowl. Drizzle with vinaigrette and gently toss to coat. Season to taste with salt. Chill in refrigerator for 1 hour and serve.

129.title: Sesame Quinoa Salad
129.description: With its fresh flavors and varying textures, this quinoa salad is the perfect base for delicately grilled shrimp or fish.

ingredients.0: 1/2 bag TJ's Organic Tricolor Quinoa
ingredients.2: 1/2 bag TJ's Sugar Snap Peas, sliced
ingredients.6: 1/4 to 1/2 cup TJ's Fat Free Sesame Vinaigrette (to taste)

steps.0: Prepare the quinoa according to package directions. While quinoa cooks, add pineapple tidbits to a saute pan over medium heat. Cook 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Turn heat to medium-high and add snap peas and green onions to pan. Add 2 tablespoons water and cover with lid to steam, about 2 minutes. When water has evaporated, remove pan from heat.
steps.1: In a large bowl, add all ingredients, tossing gently to combine. Season to taste with salt & pepper, and add more dressing if desired. Serve warm, or chill for 1 hour and serve.

130.title: Street Corn Pasta Salad
130.description: Elote is a Mexican street food marvel that consists of a grilled corncob slathered in mayonnaise and covered in cotija cheese. Then, there's esquites. This is the easier-to-eat, less-messy version of elote, where the corn is cut off the cob, put into a cup, and mixed with the aforementioned mayo & cotija. Modeled after the latter, Trader Joe's Mexican Style Roasted Corn with Cotija Cheese is the at-home version of this favored street food, and your ticket to a deceptively simple summer side dish. Spiked with lime juice and studded with cilantro, the frozen corn is enrobed in a creamy, smoky sauce that melts as it cooks, delivering a crunchy, spicy dish that packs a huge hit of flavor without a ton of prep work. Enjoy this Mexican Style Roasted Corn with Cotija Cheese as-is, or toss with al dente TJ's Red Lentil Sedanini and tender Organic Black Beans for a refreshing take on pasta salad.

ingredients.0: 1 bag TJ's Organic Red Lentil Sedanini
ingredients.1: 1 bag TJ's Mexican-Style Roasted Corn with Cotija Cheese
ingredients.2: 1 can TJ's Organic Black beans, drained
ingredients.4: 1/2 tablespoon TJ's Spanish Extra Virgin Olive Oil

parsed_ing.1: Mexican-Style Roasted Corn with Cotija Cheese

steps.0: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta to pot, return to boil and cook for 5-6 minutes, until al dente. Drain pasta and rinse with cold water to stop cooking. Transfer pasta to a large bowl and toss with olive oil to keep from sticking; set aside.
steps.1: While pasta boils, microwave corn according to package directions. Add corn, cheese packet, black beans and lime juice to pasta, tossing gently to combine. Salt and pepper to taste, garnish with cilantro and enjoy.

ingredients.0: 1/2 package TJ's Uncured Bacon Ends & Pieces, chopped (optional)
ingredients.3: 1/2 cup TJ's Organic Sriracha & Roasted Garlic BBQ Sauce
ingredients.4: Freshly chopped Cilantro, Chives or Parsley, for garnish (optional)

parsed_ing.3: Organic Sriracha & Roasted Garlic BBQ Sauce

steps.0: Preheat oven to 400º F. Heat a large skillet over medium flame, add bacon and brown 5-7 minutes. Remove bacon and set on a paper towel lined plate to drain. Pour off bacon fat from pan; add onion to pan and saute until translucent, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat.
steps.1: Pour beans into a 9x13 baking dish. Add bacon, onion, and bbq sauce and stir to combine. Place dish on center rack of oven and bake for 45-50 minutes, or until beans are bubbly, caramelized around the edges and slightly browned on top. Remove dish from oven and let cool 5 minutes. Garnish with cilantro, chives or parsley and enjoy!

132.title: Roasted Broccoli Salad
132.description: Paired with cole-cousins in the form of red wine vinaigrette-tossed Cruciferous Crunch-with a handful of Slivered Dry-Toasted Almonds, and a swoosh of rich Trader Joe's Mediterranean Hummus-this is more than just a salad; it's an exciting side dish that easily morphs into a full meal with the addition of chicken or tofu.

ingredients.0: 1 bag TJ's Organic Broccoli Florets
ingredients.4: 1 bag TJ's Dry Toasted Slivered Almonds

steps.0: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. Arrange broccoli florets evenly on baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice, and season with red pepper flakes, salt and pepper. Place sheet on center rack of oven and roast 20-23 minutes, tossing halfway through cooking. Remove from oven and allow to cool slightly.
steps.1: While broccoli cooks, in a large bowl toss cruciferous crunch with red wine vinaigrette. Set aside to wilt.
steps.2: Prepare four serving bowls. Spread a large spoonful of hummus inside each bowl with the back of a spoon. Divide wilted cruciferous crunch among the bowls and top each with roasted broccoli and a sprinkle of slivered almonds. Serve immediately.

133.title: Cilantro Crema
133.description: This creamy sauce is perfect for drizzling atop fajitas or Carnitas Tacos.

ingredients.0: 1/2 cup TJ's Organic Sour Cream

steps.0: Add all ingredients to the bowl of a blender or food processor. Blend for 1-2 minutes until smooth. Pour into a bowl or squeeze bottle and drizzle atop eggs, burritos, tacos, salads, fajitas, burgers...

134.title: Avocado Crema
134.description: This creamy green sauce is perfect for drizzling atop burgers or Mango Fish Tacos.

ingredients.0: 2 TJ's Avocados

steps.0: Add all ingredients to the bowl of a blender or food processor. Blend for 1-2 minutes until smooth. Pour into a small serving bowl or squeeze bottle and drizzle atop eggs, burritos, tacos, salads, fajitas, burgers...

ingredients.0: 1 tablespoon TJ's Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil

steps.0: In a large skillet, heat coconut oil over medium-high heat. Add diced onions and saute 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add riced cauliflower to skillet and saute another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add cumin and saute another two minutes, until fragrant. Season to taste with salt and serve immediately.

136.title: Everything but the Bagel Dip
136.description: Meet the easiest, tastiest recipe for all of your chip-and-dip needs: Trader Joe's Everything but the Bagel Sesame Seasoning Blend with Organic Sour Cream. And don't forget the Ridge Cut Potato Chips!

ingredients.0: 1 tub (16 ounces) TJ's Organic Sour Cream
ingredients.1: 1/2 jar TJ's Everything but the Bagel Sesame Seasoning Blend

parsed_ing.1: Everything but the Bagel Sesame Seasoning Blend

corrected_ing.1: Everything but the Bagel Sesame Seasoning Blend

steps.0: Spoon sour cream into a serving bowl. Fold in seasoning and stir until well mixed. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Garnish with chopped chives, if desired. Serve with potato chips, carrot sticks, pita chips, celery sticks, bell peppers, pretzel slims, cucumbers...

137.title: Kiss My Cornbread with Jalapeños & Bacon
137.description: Folding Trader Joe's Hot & Sweet Jalapenos into our pleasantly sweet Cornbread Mix gives this recipe some heat, without any need for fire extinguishers. Including bacon makes it that much more delicious, because, well, bacon (we used our Uncured Applewood Smoked Bacon, but feel free to sub in your favorite TJ's bacon here). And while it's perhaps gilding the lily a bit, our Clarified Butter (Ghee) is the ideal partner to honey for added sweet & savory in every bite.

ingredients.0: 2 parts TJ's Clarified Butter
ingredients.6: 1/2 cup TJ's Hot & Sweet Jalapenos, diced
ingredients.7: 4 slices TJ's Apple Smoked Bacon, cooked and chopped

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease bottom and sides of an 8-inch square baking pan. In a small bowl, mix clarified butter and honey; set aside.
steps.1: Beat eggs, oil, and milk in a large mixing bowl. Add cornbread mix and stir just until moistened-do not over mix. Fold in diced jalapenos and chopped bacon. Pour mix into prepared pan.
steps.2: Bake on the center rack of oven 35-38 minutes or until golden brown and toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Serve warm, with honey butter.

ingredients.0: 3 cups TJ's Cheddar Rockets
ingredients.4: 1 tablespoon TJ's Taco Seasoning (2 tablespoons for a spicier mix)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 300°F. In a large mixing bowl, mix cheddar rockets, oyster crackers, pretzel slims, and peanuts. In a separate small bowl, mix taco seasoning, canola oil, and water. Pour mixture over cereal and toss until pieces are completely coated. Spread mixture evenly onto baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes, stirring after 10 minutes. Cool completely before serving.

ingredients.0: 1/4 cup TJ's All Purpose Flour
ingredients.4: *If you'd prefer to skip the pretzel-making, substitute the ingredients above with 1 package of TJ's Big Soft Pretzels, prepared according to package instructions & cut into bite-sized pieces.
ingredients.5: 1 teaspoon TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil
ingredients.7: 4 cups TJ's Shredded Sharp Cheddar Cheese (or your preferred Cheddar)
ingredients.12: TJ's Sea Salt & Black Pepper, to taste

steps.0: Prepare the Pretzel Bites:
steps.1: Remove dough from package and let rest for 10 minutes. Preheat oven to 350°F. Spray a large baking sheet with cooking spray. In a small bowl, beat one egg and set aside. Roll out pizza dough to about 1/2 inch thick. Cut into 1 1/2 inch strips, and then cut strips lengthwise into small rectangles. Brush tops of dough pieces with egg and use grinder to add desired amount of salt on top. Place bites on a baking sheet, two inches apart. Bake 12-15 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool 5 minutes prior to serving.
steps.2: Prepare the Beer Cheese Dip:
steps.3: In a medium saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add shallots and cook until translucent. Add beer, garlic powder, Dijon, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Lower heat and slowly add cream cheese, whisking to incorporate. Slowly add shredded cheeses and stir until melted. Serve immediately.

140.title: Grandmommy's Gravy
140.description: This is an heirloom family gravy recipe that's been handed down for four generations. Made simpler with Trader Joe's Mirepoix (an essential soup- and sauce-starter comprised of conveniently chopped carrots, celery and onions), the base of this rich gravy calls for a roux (say "ROO"). It's a mixture of fat and flour used to thicken soups, stews, gravy and other velvety sauces. Proceed with caution: one taste and you'll be tempted to slurp this Southern classic right out of the gravy boat.

ingredients.0: 1 Turkey Neck, from TJ's Fresh Whole Turkey of your choice (if you choose to omit turkey neck, increase measurement of TJ's Turkey Stock to 3 Cups, and increase simmering time to thicken the gravy)
ingredients.8: 2 tablespoons pan drippings from cooked turkey (optional)

parsed_ing.0: Fresh Whole Turkey of your choice

steps.0: Place the turkey neck in a medium pot with 2 1/2 Cups of water. Cover and bring to a boil. Remove lid, reduce heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until meat can be pulled from turkey neck with forks. Turn off heat, set shredded turkey meat and stock aside, and discard turkey neck.
steps.1: While turkey neck stock simmers, heat olive oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add Mirepoix to pan and saute for 20 minutes or until browned, stirring occasionally. Turn off heat and set aside.
steps.2: For the roux: In a wide sauce pan, melt the unsalted butter over medium heat. Add flour and whisk vigorously until flour is fully incorporated with butter, being careful not to burn the mixture. Roux will darken slightly to a light caramel color.
steps.3: Measure 2 cups of the turkey neck stock from pot and slowly incorporate into the roux, whisking constantly. Repeat the process with 1 cup TJ's Turkey Stock, incorporate slowly and whisk constantly. Add sauteed Mirepoix, salt, pepper and pan drippings (if desired) to the gravy and stir until combined. Reduce heat to low and simmer until desired consistency is reached. Serve immediately*.
steps.4: *If dinner is not quite ready, keep gravy covered on the stove over low heat, stirring occasionally. Just before serving, add stock to thin gravy to desired consistency.

141.title: Mediterranean Seven-Layer Dip
141.description: Pairs with: warmed Pita Bread, Multigrain Pita Crackers, Pita Chips (see a trend...?) This easy recipe switches up the traditional Mexican-inspired 7-Layer dip. A variety of textures and a hint of spice make this dip a party pleaser. You might even want to use the dip to fill pita pockets. Sounds like we're onto something...

ingredients.0: 1 cup TJ's Hummus

steps.0: In a baking dish or wide bowl, spread hummus to cover bottom of dish.
steps.1: Drain and rinse white beans, then layer evenly over hummus. Stir together Greek yogurt and harissa until combined. Spread Greek yogurt mixture on top of white beans. Add chopped cucumbers, chopped tomatoes, and sliced Kalamata olives, respectively, on top of dip. Sprinkle with Feta cheese and fresh ground black pepper, if desired.

142.title: Pumpkin Spice Honey Dip
142.description: What's that? A fall-inspired dessert dip? Sign us up. Yes, dip doesn't just have to be an appetizer. Or maybe it's an appetizer dessert? No matter when you serve this sweet, creamy dip, the Pumpkin Pie Spice adds seasonal flair you'll want to dip into again, and again, and again.

ingredients.0: 2 cup TJ's Vanilla Greek Yogurt

steps.0: Combine all ingredients in a bowl and stir until blended. Serve with sliced apples or Cinnamon Apple Sticks for dipping.

ingredients.0: 1 Butternut Squash, roasted and cubed
ingredients.2: 1/2 teaspoon Paprika, plus more for garnish
ingredients.6: 1/4 cup Trader Joe's Avocado Oil, plus more for garnish
ingredients.7: Your favorite chips or veggies for dipping (we like Organic Blue Corn Tortilla Chips)

steps.0: Add all ingredients, except avocado oil, to food processor or blender. Turn on food processor/ blender and slowly drizzle oil into the mixture, about 30-45 seconds.
steps.1: Once the oil has been added, turn off the machine and scrape down sides of bowl. Blend for another 30 seconds to 1 minute. Spoon into serving dish. using spoon to create a well in the center of hummus.
steps.2: Garnish with olive oil and paprika. Serve with chips or veggies for dipping, or dig in with a spoon!

144.title: Bared Bacon Cheddar Cornbread Cake
144.description: Bacon, Sharp Cheddar, and Cornbread – showcasing Uncured Apple Smoked Bacon, this savory cake makes a fine side for chili or BBQ pork chops. Stick a candle in it and make a cornbread-lover's birthday wish come true!

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Oil Spray
ingredients.5: 2 cups TJ's Sharp Cheddar Cheese, shredded
ingredients.6: 1 pkg TJ's Fully Cooked Uncured Applewood Smoked Bacon

parsed_ing.6: Fully Cooked Uncured Applewood Smoked Bacon

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F.
steps.1: Prepare 2 Cake Pans (8"x8"x2"): use bottom of cake pan to measure/trace 2 circles on parchment paper; cut out the circles and set aside. Spray the inside of the cake pans with canola oil.  Place parchment circles in the pan bottoms and spray over top with butter flavored oil. Set aside.
steps.2: Prepare & Bake Cakes: in a large mixing bowl, beat eggs, sunflower oil, and milk. Add cornbread mix and stir until moistened, being careful not to overmix. Fold in shredded Cheddar. Divide batter between prepared cake pans. Place on center rack of oven and bake. At 35 minutes, test centers with a toothpick; when toothpicks come out clean, remove cornbread to cool (in pans) for 10 minutes. After 10 minutes, run a knife around the inside of the pans, flip pans upside down and ease cornbread out onto a cooling rack to cool completely, about 40-50 minutes.
steps.3: Prepare Bacon: while cornbread is cooling, prepare bacon according to package stove top directions. Let rest on paper towels to cool completely. Once cooled, chop bacon into ½ inch pieces. Set aside.
steps.4: Prepare Frosting: add mascarpone, crème fraiche and Dijon mustard to the mixer bowl. Using an electric mixer with whip attachment, start mixing on low setting; gradually increase speed to medium and whip to stiff peaks, about 2 minutes or less.
steps.5: Assemble Cake: place a dollop of frosting onto cake plate to anchor. Place 1 cornbread cake, top side down, on top and center on plate. Frost and sprinkle with ¼ of chopped bacon. Top with second cornbread cake and lightly frost sides the entire cake. Frost cornbread top with what remains, and pile on remainder of bacon, as decoratively as you like!

145.title: Mac N' Cheese & Pulled Pork Nachos

ingredients.0: 1 bag TJ's Organic White Corn Tortilla Chips
ingredients.1: 1 package TJ's Diner Mac n' Cheese or TJ's Hatch Chile Mac & Cheese
ingredients.2: 1 package TJ's Pulled Pork in Smokey BBQ Sauce
ingredients.4: 1 Tbsp. TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil (any variety will do)
ingredients.5: 1 cup TJ's Diced Yellow Onions or 1 medium TJ's Yellow Onion, diced
ingredients.6: TJ's Green Dragon Sauce to taste

parsed_ing.2: Pulled Pork in Smokey BBQ Sauce

steps.0: Combine butter and oil in a frying pan and over medium heat. Once butter is melted, add diced onions and heat for approximately 10 minutes or until onions are golden brown, stirring occasionally. While onions are caramelizing, prepare pulled pork in microwave according to package instructions, then prepare mac n' cheese in microwave according to package instructions. Arrange about 3/4 bag of chips onto a large platter. Spoon the mac n' cheese onto chips, then pile the pulled pork atop the mac n' cheese. Top with your caramelized onions and as much or as little Green Dragon Sauce as your heart desires! Feel free to add the remainin1/4 bag of chips to the pile as nachos are consumed.
steps.1: Option: Preheat oven to 450°F while prepping onions. Follow directions as described above. Prior to adding Green Dragon Sauce, bake nachos in the oven* for 5 -7 minutes for extra crispiness and melty-ness. Remove from oven and top with Green Dragon Sauce. (*If selecting this option, be sure to arrange chips on or in an oven-safe dish!)

ingredients.0: 1 (1lb) bag TJ's Dutch Yellow Baby Potatoes
ingredients.3: 4 Tablespoons TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil

steps.0: Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Bring a medium pot of salted water to a boil. Add potatoes and boil until fork tender, about 10 minutes. Drain potatoes. Place potatoes onto a cutting board then gently smash (we used the base of a heavy glass Pyrex measuring cup) until each potato reaches about half its thickness, being careful to keep the potato intact. Drizzle about 2 tablespoons of olive oil onto a baking tray, then gently transfer each smashed potato onto the baking tray with a spatula. Generously brush the remaining olive oil atop the potatoes then sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place tray of potatoes in the heated oven and bake for 15 minutes. Flip the potatoes, season salt and pepper and bake an additional 10 more minutes the tops are until golden brown and crispy. Serve immediately.

ingredients.0: 1 bag TJ's Jumbo Cooked Shrimp (Peeled, Tail Off, Whole)
ingredients.3: 3 cups quartered TJ's Mini Heirloom Tomatoes
ingredients.5: 3 Tablespoons TJ's Jalapeno Pepper Hot Sauce

steps.0: Remove shrimp from bag and place in a colander. Run shrimp under cold water for 5 to 7 minutes to defrost, set aside to drain.
steps.1: Cut baguette into 3-inch pieces lengthwise (about 6 pieces), slice each piece into halves crosswise.
steps.2: Grease skillet on stove and bring to medium heat. Spread 1 teaspoon of mayonnaise on each slice of baguette and toast face-down in skillet until golden brown (about 2 minutes each). (Alternatively, place baguettes, cut side up, on a baking sheet and broil until browned and crispy (about 3-5 minutes).)
steps.3: In a medium sized bowl, mix together defrosted shrimp, tomatoes, parsley, and chili pepper sauce.
steps.4: To assemble, spoon 1/4 cup of shrimp mixture over each slice of toasted bread. Enjoy immediately.

ingredients.0: 1 cup TJ's Uncured Bacon Ends and Pieces, chopped small
ingredients.2: 3 cloves TJ's Premium Peeled Garlic, chopped
ingredients.6: 1/2 cup TJ's Organic Brown Sugar BBQ Sauce & Marinade

parsed_ing.6: Organic Brown Sugar BBQ Sauce & Marinade

steps.0: Preheat oven to 400ºF. Heat a large skillet over medium flame, add bacon and brown. Remove bacon and set aside. Pour off bacon fat; add onion to pan and saute until translucent. Add garlic and stir for 1 minute longer.
steps.1: Pour beans into a 9x13-inch casserole dish. Add bacon, onion, garlic, mustard, brown sugar and bbq sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Place dish in oven and bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until beans are bubbly, caramelized around the edges and slightly browned on top. Garnish with cilantro, chives or parsley. Enjoy!

149.title: Jalapeño Corn Kickers
149.description: We're known to be corny and cheesy (Hawaiian shirts anyone?). We thought we'd 'kick' it up with an app that's just right for us. And for your next party.

ingredients.0: 1 8oz package (about 5) TJ's Jalapenos
ingredients.1: 1 package TJ's Chunky Artichoke & Jalapeno Dip
ingredients.3: 1 cup TJ's Shredded Mozzarella Cheese, divided
ingredients.4: 2 teaspoons finely chopped TJ's Cilantro, plus more for garnish
ingredients.5: 1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste

steps.0: Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cover a baking sheet with aluminum foil and set aside.
steps.1: When working with jalapenos, wear disposable gloves to avoid eye irritation. Slice the jalapenos in half lengthwise. For a nicer presentation, slice each stem in half as well. Scrape out the seeds and membranes from each half. Place jalapenos on the baking sheet and set aside.
steps.2: In a medium bowl, combine artichoke dip, 1 cup corn, 1/2 cup mozzarella and 2 teaspoons cilantro. Stir until well incorporated. Taste and add fresh ground black pepper as desired.
steps.3: With a small spoon, fill each jalapeno half with about 1 tablespoon of the cheese mixture. Smooth the mixture so that it fills the entire cavity evenly, reaching the top edge of the pepper, but not overflowing (if the peppers are filled too much, they can tip over while baking). Sprinkle reserved 1/2 cup of mozzarella over the jalapenos. Arrange peppers on the baking sheet and bake until cheese is browned and bubbling and the peppers have softened, about 20 minutes. Remove from oven and cool before serving. Garnish with extra cilantro.

ingredients.0: 1 Tbsp TJ's Butter
ingredients.1: 1 medium TJ's Yellow Onion, sliced thinly
ingredients.4: ¼ cup TJ's Balsamic Vinegar of Modena

steps.0: In a medium skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add onion slices and stir to coat with butter. Sprinkle the onions with salt. Stir until onions until they cook down and begin to turn golden, about 5 minutes. Add sugar and continue to stir until onions darken to a medium golden color and turn translucent, about 5 more minutes. Add balsamic vinegar, scrape up the bits from the bottom of the pan and turn heat to low. Heat until most of the liquid absorbs, about 5-7 more minutes. Taste and season with more salt if needed, then serve. For richer flavor, the onions can be cooked for up to an additional 45 minutes if desired. Serve in soups or casseroles or on salads, burgers, sandwiches, steaks and eggs. Store in refrigerator for up to three days or freeze.

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Anchovy Fillets in Olive Oil, drained and diced
ingredients.1: 3 small TJ's Premium Peeled Garlic Cloves, minced
ingredients.3: 2 teaspoons TJ's Dijon Mustard with White Wine
ingredients.4: 1/3 cup + 1 Tbsp TJ's Sicilian Selezione EVOO
ingredients.5: 1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
ingredients.6: 1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste

steps.0: In a medium bowl, mash the anchovies and garlic with a fork to form a paste. Add the lemon juice and mustard and stir until well incorporated. Slowly whisk in oil until it starts to emulsify. Taste and add salt and pepper as desired. Makes about 1 cup of dressing.
steps.1: Serving ideas: over bitter greens (radicchio, kale, arugula, Belgian endives) with freshly grated parmesan, dress a Nicoise salad or as a dip for crusty bread

ingredients.0: 2 tablespoons grated TJ's Pecorino, Romano and Parmesan Cheese Blend
ingredients.4: 1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
ingredients.5: 1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
ingredients.6: 1/3 cup TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil

steps.0: In a small bowl, whisk together cheese, vinegar, sugar, 21 seasoning salute, salt, and pepper. Slowly whisk in oil until emulsified. Taste and adjust seasoning as desired. Makes about 1 cup of vinaigrette.
steps.1: Serving ideas: mixed in a tortellini salad, or as a marinade for fish or chicken

ingredients.0: 1 bag TJ's Shishito Peppers
ingredients.5: 1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
ingredients.6: 1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste

steps.0: Pour 1 tablespoon olive oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add the peppers and sauté about 3-5 minutes, turning occasionally until they blister on all sides. Remove peppers from heat and slice off the stems and discard. Combine shishito peppers, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 tablespoons lime juice, 2 tablespoons greek yogurt, 2 garlic cloves and salt and pepper in a blender. Pulse until desired consistency. Taste and adjust seasoning as desired. Makes about 1/2 cup of sauce.
steps.1: Serving ideas: Dress a Southwestern salad (butter lettuce, corn, beans, tomatoes, red onion and tortilla chips), drizzle over shrimp tacos, or spread on a BLT sandwich

ingredients.0: 1 Tablespoon TJ's Red Wine Vinegar
ingredients.1: 5 grinds TJ's South African Smoke Seasoning (Seasonal)
ingredients.3: 3 TJ's Premium and Peeled Garlic Cloves

steps.0: Combine 1 tablespoon vinegar, 5 grinds South African seasoning, 1 teaspoon oregano, 3 garlic cloves and 2 tablespoons of EVOO in a blender or food processor. Pulse until garlic minces to desired consistency. Add cilantro and parsley and pulse a few more times until desired consistency. Pour mixture into a small bowl and stir in reserved 3 tablespoons of EVOO. Taste and adjust seasoning as desired. Makes about 1/2 cup of sauce.
