steps.0: Toast roll halves in toaster or oven for 5 minutes, until crisp and golden. Remove from oven. Slather each toast with hummus, and top with two egg halves and a few tomato slices. Season with salt & pepper and enjoy!

241.title: Breakfast Tacos
241.description: Whether or not you're a meat eater has nothing to do with whether you'll enjoy the spiciness of Trader Joe's Soy Chorizo. Carnivores and herbivores alike sing the praises of this meatless wonder-one bite, and it's easy to see why.This soy protein-based -izo iteration delivers complexly kicking spices, with no cholesterol and 60% less fat. Thanks, soy! Once you remove it from its plastic casing (please, please do not eat the plastic; it's inedible!), you have an entire world of dishes at your fingertips. Burritos, rice, chili, potato hash, chile con queso, or this big-enough-to-feed-a-crowd recipe for breakfast tacos...

ingredients.0: 1 bag TJ's Roasted Potatoes with Peppers & Onions
ingredients.2: 1 package TJ's Soy Chorizo, removed from casing
ingredients.5: 2 packages TJ's Corn & Wheat Tortillas, or your favorite TJ's tortillas
ingredients.7: TJ's Mild or Hot Pico de Gallo Salsa

steps.0: Preheat oven to 400°F. Spread potatoes, peppers & onions on a very large (or 2 medium-sized) rimmed baking sheet. Place sheet on center rack of oven and bake 20-25 minutes, until potatoes are crisp and golden. Remove from oven and transfer to a serving dish.
steps.1: While potatoes roast, prepare soy chorizo: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add soy chorizo and saute 5-8 minutes, until slightly browned and temperature reaches 165°F. Transfer to a serving bowl and cover to keep warm (wipe skillet with a paper towel; you'll use it to scramble the eggs).
steps.2: If desired, warm tortillas in a clean, dry skillet (or use tongs if warming directly over the burner); cover and keep warm for serving.
steps.3: In a large bowl, beat eggs and season with salt and pepper. Melt remaining oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Pour egg mixture into center of pan and stir slowly. When curds start to form, reduce heat to low and gently fold eggs over. Cook 2-3 minutes more, then transfer eggs to a plate and let rest 1 minute to finish cooking.
steps.4: Assembly: Fill a tortilla with soy chorizo, roasted potatoes, and scrambled eggs. Garnish with cheese, salsa, and avocado. Alternatively, lay the ingredients out buffet-style, and let your guests be the captains of their own breakfast taco ships. Enjoy!

242.title: Hot Cider Oatmeal
242.description: We've been selling orchards full of Trader Joe's Spiced Cider for more than 20 years, and we anxiously anticipate its return, year after year. It's made exclusively for us, with the juice of bursting-with-flavor apples, and brewed with spices like cinnamon, allspice and cloves. Just when you think the flavor has fully revealed itself, you discover a subtle hint of citrus at the finish that really pleases the palate.Delicious hot or cold, this Spiced Cider provides perky personality wherever it's poured. Our current favorite use? In place of water when preparing a piping hot bowl of oatmeal on a frosty winter morning...

ingredients.0: 1 cup TJ's Spiced Apple Cider (seasonal) or Cold-Pressed Fuji Apple Cider (Seasonal)
ingredients.1: 1/2 cup TJ's Gluten Free Rolled Oats
ingredients.2: TJ's Organic Brown Sugar, Freeze Dried Fuji Apple Slices, and Dried Cranberries, for garnish

steps.0: In a medium saucepan, bring cider to a boil. Reduce heat and add rolled oats. Cook for 10-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until desired consistency. Remove from heat, cover and let stand two minutes before serving. Top with brown sugar, freeze dried apple slices, and dried cranberries, and enjoy!

243.title: Egg Nog Breakfast Bowl
243.description: Trader Joe's Egg Nog Yogurt starts with tart, thick, whole milk Greek yogurt that's packed with protein-11 grams per serving, to be exact! An egg nog base of egg yolks, natural flavors and nutmeg spice is added, creating a light-golden yogurt with an even creamier texture, and just the right amount of egg nog flavor. Sweet enough for dessert, it's a great addition to a breakfast bowl with granola and a handful of TJ's Pomegranate Seeds.

ingredients.0: 1 container TJ's Greek Whole Milk Egg Nog Yogurt OR Cultured Coconut Nog (seasonal)

parsed_ing.0: Greek Whole Milk Egg Nog Yogurt

steps.0: Spoon yogurt into a small serving bowl. Top with a spoonful of preserves, a handful of granola, and a few spoonfuls of pomegranate seeds. Enjoy!

244.title: PB&J Protein Bowl
244.description: Get your PB&J fix for breakfast, sans bread: Blend Trader Joe's Organic Vanilla Pea Protein with frozen strawberries, banana and unsweetened almond beverage, then garnish with crunchy Peanut Butter Protein Granola!

ingredients.0: 2 cups TJ's Frozen Strawberries
ingredients.1: 2 scoops TJ's Organic Vanilla Pea Protein Powder, TJ's Vanilla Soy Protein Powder, or TJ's Vanilla Whey Protein Powder
ingredients.3: 1/2 cup TJ's Unsweetened Vanilla Almond Beverage
ingredients.4: 2 tablespoons TJ's Creamy Salted Peanut Butter, plus more for drizzling
ingredients.5: Handful TJ's Peanut Butter Protein Granola
ingredients.6: Handful TJ's Fresh Strawberries, hulled & thinly sliced, for garnish (optional)

steps.0: Add frozen strawberries, protein powder, banana, and almond beverage to a blender pitcher. Blend until smooth, adding more almond beverage if needed (mixture should be thick). Scrape mixture into bowls. Top with granola and sliced strawberries, and drizzle with peanut butter. Grab a spoon and dig in.

245.title: Scone Pinwheels with Honey Goat Cheese
245.description: Trader Joe's Mixed Berry Scone Mix is made even more delicious when Honey Goat Cheese is involved. What looks like a tricky recipe is, in fact, a relatively simple-and downright spectacular-addition to a breakfast-in-bed or winter brunch spread. A drizzle of honey and sprinkle of chopped mint make these Pinwheels an especially special treat.

ingredients.0: 1 box TJ's Mixed Berry Scone Mix
ingredients.2: TJ's All Purpose Flour, for work surface
ingredients.3: 2 packages TJ's Honey Goat Cheese, softened to room temperature
ingredients.5: TJ's Honey and Fresh Mint, for garnish

steps.0: Preheat oven to 375°F. Lightly grease a large baking sheet or line with parchment paper, set aside.
steps.1: Add scone mix to a large bowl. Add water and stir with a fork, just until water is absorbed and a sticky dough forms. Do not overmix. Cover and refrigerate 1 hour.
steps.2: Lightly dust a large cutting board with flour. Roll scone dough into a rectangle, roughly 10 inches by 12 inches. Spread softened goat cheese to cover dough completely. Starting from the short side, use your fingertips to gently roll dough inward, creating a pinwheel (use a lightly floured spatula to lift dough from board if it gets stuck). Cover pinwheel log in cling wrap and freeze 1 hour*.
steps.3: Remove pinwheel log from freezer. Remove plastic wrap and slice log crosswise into 8 pieces. Place slices pinwheel side-up on prepared baking sheet and lightly brush with whisked egg.
steps.4: Place sheet on center rack of oven and bake 15-17 minutes, until scones are golden brown. Remove sheet from oven and let cool 5 minutes, then transfer scones to a wire rack. Drizzle with honey, garnish with mint and serve immediately.
steps.5: *Scone pinwheel log can be prepared 1 day ahead. Remove from freezer and let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes prior to slicing and baking.

246.title: Raspberry Ricotta Toast
246.description: Long before it became a famed food trend, toasted bread slathered with toppings was simply a satisfying way to start your day, or a satiating snack to get you through between meals. Self-described fans of simple, satiating, and satisfying food that we are, we couldn't help but adore this restrained "recipe" for ricotta toast. (We know, no one needs a recipe for toast, but we couldn't resist the photo op!) Creamy and comforting, a pool of ruby red raspberry preserves in the center offers a tart counterpoint to the fresh, milky flavor of Trader Joe's Ricotta Cheese. If you're in a rush, opt for the toaster over buttery pan prep and you'll have breakfast in hand in about five minutes. We'll toast to that!

ingredients.0: TJ's Cultured Butter, softened
ingredients.2: TJ's Traditional Whole Milk Ricotta Cheese OR Part Skim Ricotta Cheese

steps.0: Preheat a nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Slather butter on both sides of brioche. Place in preheated pan and cook 1-2 minutes per side, until golden. Transfer toast to a plate.
steps.1: Cover toast with a generous scoop of ricotta. Use the back of a spoon to create a well in the ricotta and fill with raspberry preserves. Enjoy immediately.

247.title: Fifty Fifty Toast
247.description: Trader Joe's Honey with Honeycomb is truly the bee's knees, and it's also fairly straightforward: a jar of honey that's got a piece of honeycomb inside. Drizzle it atop mascarpone cheese and fresh citrus on hearty, whole grain bread for a sweet, sunny start to your day.

ingredients.0: TJ's European Style Multigrain Bread (available in the West Coast) OR your favorite thinly sliced TJ's Multigrain Bread, lightly toasted

steps.0: Generously slather toast with mascarpone; set aside. Using a sharp knife, cut the poles off the citrus so the flesh is exposed. Stand citrus upright, and slice peel and pith off in sections until fully removed. Turn citrus on its side and slice thinly. Arrange citrus slices atop prepared toast and drizzle with honey. Serve immediately, with a piece of honeycomb on the side.

248.title: Brunchfast Burritos
248.description: You can put almost anything in a breakfast burrito (or brunchfast burrito, if you're not feeling bright-eyed and bushy-tailed until late morning), but two ingredients are absolute musts: eggs and tortillas. You scramble your eggs, you wrap them in a tortilla, and if you're not feeling very adventurous, you could be done. We tend toward the adventurous, so we suggest all kinds of inclusions; importantly, we suggest you always include Trader Joe's Hashbrowns and Uncured Fully Cooked Bacon for savory crunch. (Trust us here.)

ingredients.0: 12 TJ's Large Eggs
ingredients.6: 1 package TJ's Dry Rubbed Bacon OR Uncured Fully Cooked Bacon
ingredients.9: Your favorite TJ's Hot Sauce, Salsa, or Sriracha

steps.0: Preheat oven to 400°F. Arrange oven racks in upper and lower thirds of oven. Place a wire rack on a large rimmed baking sheet. Arrange hash browns on rack and bake on upper rack of oven for 10 minutes.
steps.1: If using dry dubbed bacon: While hash browns are baking, line a second baking sheet with parchment paper and place a wire rack on the baking sheet. Arrange bacon evenly on wire rack. Place sheet on lower rack of oven. Bake hash browns and bacon 20 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.
steps.2: If using fully cooked bacon: microwave bacon according to package directions; set aside.
steps.3: In a large bowl, thoroughly whisk eggs and milk, set aside. Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over high heat. Pour egg mixture into center of pan and stir slowly. When curds start to form, reduce heat to low and gently fold eggs over. Cook 2-3 minutes more, then transfer eggs to a plate and let rest 1 minute to finish cooking.
steps.4: Assemble burritos: Lay tortilla on a flat work surface. Place 1/6th of scrambled eggs in the center of the tortilla. Layer a hash brown and 2 slices of bacon atop eggs. Top with 1/4 cup shredded cheese, sliced avocado, and a drizzle of hot sauce. Pull half of the tortilla closest to you up to meet the top half, then pull the tortilla and fillings back toward you. Fold in the left and right sides of the tortilla, then roll tightly until closed. Repeat burrito assembly with remaining ingredients. Enjoy!

249.title: Basic Breakfast Sandwich
249.description: You probably know how to assemble a sandwich-but you may not know that cooking bacon on a sheet pan eases sandwich assembly (and cleanup!), giving you time to focus on frying eggs like a pro.

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Dry Rubbed Bacon
ingredients.2: 1 package TJ's Sliced Aged Swiss Cheese
ingredients.4: TJ's Gluten Free Whole Grain or Multigrain Bread (toasted or untoasted, your call!)
ingredients.6: 6-8 TJ's Large Eggs (1 egg per sandwich)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 375°F. Place a wire rack on top of a large rimmed baking sheet. Arrange bacon slices evenly on rack. Bake on center rack of oven for 15-20 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool 5 minutes.
steps.1: Pre-assemble sandwiches: layer a handful of arugula, 2-3 slices bacon, 1 slice cheese, and tomato atop one slice of bread. Repeat for each sandwich.
steps.2: Fry the eggs: melt 1 tablespoon butter in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Crack 3-4 eggs into skillet and sprinkle with salt & pepper. Cook 1 minute, until whites are slightly opaque. Reduce heat to low, cover skillet with lid and cook 4-6 minutes more, to desired level of yolk doneness.
steps.3: Using a spatula, carefully lift eggs out of skillet and slide onto prepared sandwich halves. Top with second slice of bread. Cook remaining eggs following steps above and assemble remaining sandwiches. Serve immediately.

250.title: Brunch Fried Rice
250.description: Crispy fried rice cradles creamy eggs and avocado in this one-pan brunch (or lunch, or dinner) favorite.

ingredients.0: 3 tablespoons TJ's Sunflower Oil
ingredients.2: 6-8 TJ's Large Eggs (1 egg per guest)
ingredients.3: 2 bags TJ's Organic Baby Spinach, for serving
ingredients.4: TJ's Avocado, sliced, and TJ's Sriracha Sauce, for garnish

steps.0: Heat oil in a large nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Add fried rice to pan and toss to coat. Cover and saute 5-7 minutes until chicken is heated through, stirring halfway through cooking.
steps.1: Remove lid and reduce heat to medium. Spread rice evenly in pan and create wells in the rice with the back of a spoon. Crack an egg into each well and replace lid. Cook 5-7 minutes or to preferred egg doneness. Remove lid and remove pan from heat.
steps.2: Divide spinach among plates. Using a spatula, carefully separate rice around each egg into individual servings. Gently place an egg rice patty atop each bed of spinach. Top with sliced avocado and a generous squirt of sriracha sauce, and dig in!

251.title: Cheesy Tot Breakfast Bake
251.description: Trader Joe's Unexpected Cheddar, Potato Tots, and savory sausage & eggs-this cheesy casserole is the ultimate in breakfast comfort food.

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Spray, to grease pan
ingredients.2: 3/4 to 1 block TJ's Unexpected Cheddar, shredded and divided (you'll have about 2 cups shredded)
ingredients.6: TJ's Trader Potato Tots (roughly half a bag)
ingredients.7: 3 slices TJ's Fully Cooked Bacon, diced, for garnish (optional)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a casserole dish with canola spray; set aside.
steps.1: Remove sausage from casing and add to a large skillet. Place skillet over medium heat and saute sausage 10-15 minutes until cooked through, stirring occasionally.
steps.2: Line the bottom of the casserole dish with cooked sausage. Cover with half of the shredded cheese; set aside.
steps.3: Whisk eggs, milk and 21 seasoning in a large bowl. Pour evenly over sausage and cheese mixture. Arrange potato tots in a single even layer atop mixture (save the rest for later!).
steps.4: Place dish on center rack of oven and bake for 30 minutes. Remove dish from oven and sprinkle with remaining cheese, to taste. Return dish to oven and bake an additional 25-30 minutes. (Add diced bacon to oven during last 10 minutes of cooking, if desired). Remove dish from oven and let cool slightly before serving.

ingredients.0: 1 can TJ's Buttermilk Biscuits
ingredients.6: 4 Fresh Sage leaves, chopped (plus more for garnish)

steps.0: Cook biscuits according to package directions. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add ghee and melt to coat pan. Add ground turkey to pan, breaking it into pieces with a spoon as it cooks, about 8-10 minutes. When the turkey reaches 165ºF and is no longer pink, reduce heat to medium. Sprinkle half of the flour over the turkey and stir to combine. Add remaining flour and stir to combine. Add one cup of milk to the pan and stir. Continue to add milk as the gravy thickens, one cup at a time.
steps.1: Add syrup and chopped sage to gravy and stir to combine. Cook gravy 5 minutes more, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper to taste. To serve, place biscuits in a shallow bowl and top with gravy and chopped sage. Serve immediately.

ingredients.0: 1 can TJ's Buttermilk Biscuits
ingredients.4: TJ's Fire Roasted Diced Green Chiles, for garnish (optional)

steps.0: Cook biscuits according to package directions. Remove soy chorizo from casing. In a large skillet over medium heat, add soy chorizo, breaking it up into pieces as it cooks, about 8-10 minutes. When soy chorizo reaches 165ºF, reduce heat to medium. Add salsa and stir to combine. Add almond milk to pan and cook for 5-7 minutes as gravy thickens, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat.
steps.1: To serve, break open 2 biscuits in a shallow serving dish and top with 1/4 of gravy and green chiles, if using. Repeat with remaining biscuits and gravy and serve immediately.

254.title: Biscuits & Gravy Casserole
254.description: You can't make classic biscuits and gravy without savory pork sausage-this much we know is true. This casseroled take on the quintessential recipe features Trader Joe's All Natural, No Antibiotics Ever Ground Pork. Made from pigs raised on an all-vegetarian diet without hormones or antibiotics-ever, this Ground Pork is 80% lean and 20% fat, so it cooks up super moist and tender.

ingredients.0: 1 package (1 pound) TJ's All Natural No Antibiotics Ever Ground Pork
ingredients.5: TJ's Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil Spray, to grease pan

parsed_ing.0: All Natural No Antibiotics Ever Ground Pork
parsed_ing.5: Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil Spray

steps.0: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown the ground pork, breaking it up into pieces with a spoon as it cooks, about 8-10 minutes. When the pork has reached 145ºF and is no longer pink, reduce heat to medium. Sprinkle half of the flour over pork and stir to combine. Add remaining flour and stir to combine. Add one cup of milk to the pan and stir. Continue to add milk one cup at a time as gravy thickens. Cook for another 5-8 minutes to further thicken the gravy.
steps.1: Preheat oven to 350ºF. Grease a 9x13 pan with olive oil spray and set aside. In a large bowl, add eggs and 21 Seasoning Salute and whisk to combine; set aside. Open the biscuits and tear each biscuit into four pieces. Line the bottom of the greased pan with half of the biscuit dough. Pour egg mixture on top of biscuit dough. Sprinkle cheese evenly atop egg mixture. Pour sausage gravy over egg mixture and top with remaining biscuit dough pieces.
steps.2: Insert pan in oven and bake for 20 minutes. Cover pan with foil and bake for another 12-15 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool slightly before serving.

255.title: Citrusy Baked Oatmeal
255.description: This bright, warming baked oatmeal combines Trader Joe's Gluten Free Rolled Oats and tangy citrus for a morning meal that's sure to please any day of the week. The addition of egg and honey helps hold everything together, while the trek mix lends textural crunch. Fancy enough to bring to Sunday brunch, yet simple enough to prep on a weekday morning and bake while you get ready for the day ahead? Yes please!

ingredients.0: 2 cups TJ's Rolled Oats
ingredients.1: 3 TJ's Cara Cara Oranges (if unavailable, Navels or Valencias will work just fine)
ingredients.2: 1 1/2 cups TJ's Unsweetened Vanilla Almond Milk
ingredients.5: 1/4 cup of your favorite TJ's Honey
ingredients.6: 1 cup TJ's Go Raw Trek Mix (or Oh My! Omega Trek Mix)

steps.0: In a medium bowl, add oats, 1 cup almond milk and the juice of 2 Cara Cara oranges and stir. Let sit for 20 minutes, allowing oats to soak in liquid.
steps.1: Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease a 9-inch pie dish with 1 tablespoon ghee and set aside. In a large bowl, combine egg, honey, remaining ghee, and almond milk. Add soaked oats, Trek Mix, baking powder, salt and cinnamon and stir gently until combined.
steps.2: Pour the oat mixture into the greased pie dish. Thinly slice the remaining Cara Cara orange and layer slices atop mixture. Sprinkle with sugar, if desired, and bake for 30 minutes, until the center is set. Turn the oven to broil (low) and cook until orange slices are caramelized, about 3 minutes. Let cool 10 minutes prior to serving.

256.title: Pumpkin Choc-Oat Chip Muffins with Pumpkin Butter-Butter
256.description: What impressed us most about Trader Joe's Gluten Free Pumpkin Bread & Muffin Baking Mix was that if we hadn't known it was gluten free, we wouldn't have known it was gluten free-it's that good! And no, that's not a typo in the recipe title-these chocolate-chunk studded muffins are gilded with Pumpkin butter-infused butter.

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Spray (to grease muffin tin)
ingredients.1: 1 box TJ's Gluten Free Pumpkin Bread & Muffin Mix (seasonal)
ingredients.6: 1 cup TJ's Gluten Free Rolled Oats
ingredients.8: 2 sticks TJ's Unsalted Butter, softened to room temperature

parsed_ing.1: Gluten Free Pumpkin Bread & Muffin Mix

steps.0: Preheat oven to 400°F. Grease muffin pan with canola spray and set aside. In a large bowl, whisk together muffin mix, water, oil and eggs. Add applesauce, oats and chocolate chunks and stir gently; do not overmix. Spoon batter into muffin tins about 2/3 full. Bake for 26-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool for 20 minutes.
steps.1: While muffins are cooling, mix softened butter and pumpkin butter in a small bowl until well blended. Break open muffins and serve with a healthy dollop of Pumpkin Butter Butter. Muffins will keep in an airtight container for three days.

257.title: Baked Pear with Yogurt and Granola

ingredients.0: 1/2 cup Water
ingredients.1: Juice from half of a TJ's Lemon
ingredients.3: 1 ripe TJ's D'Anjou Pear, peeled, halved and cored
ingredients.4: 4 Tbsp TJ's Organic Grass Fed Plain Whole Milk Yogurt
ingredients.5: 1/2 cup TJ's Gluten Free Cranberry Maple Nut Granola

parsed_ing.4: Organic Grass Fed Plain Whole Milk Yogurt
parsed_ing.5: Gluten Free Cranberry Maple Nut Granola

steps.0: Preheat oven to 375°F.
steps.1: Combine water, lemon juice and brown sugar in a bowl and set aside.
steps.2: Place pear halves, cut side up on a foil-lined baking sheet and begin baking for about 40 minutes. Baste with lemon mixture every 10 minutes. Remove from oven once pears are fork tender. Let cool 5 minutes before serving or refrigerate overnight for use the following morning.
steps.3: To serve, spoon yogurt into pear cavities then sprinkle with granola.

ingredients.0: 1 cup TJ's Just Almond Meal
ingredients.4: Zest and juice from 2 large TJ's Lemons
ingredients.5: 1/4 cup TJ's Organic Virgin Coconut Oil, melted (microwave for 30 seconds)
ingredients.11: Zest and juice from 1 large TJ's Lemon

steps.0: Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a muffin tin with 10 muffin liners, or grease slots with coconut oil and set aside.
steps.1: In a medium bowl, mix together 1 cup almond meal, 2 tablespoons almond flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder and 1/8 teaspoon salt. Set aside.
steps.2: In a separate medium bowl, combine lemon zest, lemon juice, 1/4 cup melted coconut oil, 2 tablespoons maple syrup and 4 beaten eggs. Add the dry ingredients to wet ingredients and stir until just combined. Fold in 1 cup of diced strawberries. Do not over mix.
steps.3: Add 1/4 cup spoonfuls of the batter to 10 muffin slots. Bake 17 minutes or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean.
steps.4: To make glaze: in a small saucepan, combine 1/2 cup water, 1/2 cup sugar and the zest and juice from 1 lemon. Heat to a rapid boil until glaze thickens and coats the back of a spoon, about 10-15 minutes.
steps.5: Remove muffins from oven and let cool. Drizzle glaze atop muffins and enjoy!

ingredients.0: 4 cups shredded TJ's Zucchini (4-5 medium zucchinis)
ingredients.3: 1 medium TJ's Yellow Onion, sliced thinly
ingredients.5: 1/4 cup TJ's Balsamic Vinegar of Modena
ingredients.6: 2 cups frozen TJ's Roasted Corn, defrosted
ingredients.8: 2 Tablespoons chopped TJ's Cilantro, plus more for garnish

steps.0: To extract the moisture from the zucchini, spread the zucchini out on a tray and sprinkle with 1 teaspoon salt. Set aside.
steps.1: While the zucchini sits, prepare the balsamic caramelized onions: In a medium skillet over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon of butter. Add onion slices and stir to coat with butter. Sprinkle the onions with reserved 1/2 teaspoon salt. Stir until onions cook down and begin to turn golden, about 5 minutes. Add 2 teaspoons sugar and continue to stir until onions darken to a medium golden color and turn translucent, about 5 more minutes. Add 1/4 cup balsamic vinegar, scrape up the bits from the bottom of the pan and turn heat to low. Heat, stirring occasionally, until most of the liquid absorbs, about 5-7 more minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
steps.2: Preheat oven to 375°F. In small batches, place the zucchini shreds in a clean cloth and squeeze the water out. Repeat as needed. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt reserved 2 tablespoons of butter. Add zucchini shreds and cook until slightly golden. Add corn and stir until heated through. Transfer zucchini and corn to a large bowl and let cool completely (if the mixture is too hot for these next steps, the ingredients clump together and will result in uneven cooking!).
steps.3: Add caramelized onions, mozzarella, 2 tablespoons cilantro and 6 eggs to zucchini. Gently stir until uniform. Transfer mixture to a greased 9.5 inch glass pie dish. Cover loosely with greased foil, grease side down. Place on center rack of oven and bake 25-30 minutes, until there is no liquid when a knife is inserted into the center of the egg bake. Remove foil and broil until the cheese on top is brown and bubbly, about 3-5 minutes. Remove from oven and cool. Garnish with cilantro just before serving.
steps.4: Serve warm with fruit for breakfast, or with a side salad for lunch or dinner.

ingredients.0: 1 box (8 pieces) TJ's Toaster Waffles, heated
ingredients.3: 1 16oz container TJ's Strawberries, hulled and sliced top to bottom
ingredients.4: 1/2 cup TJ's Sliced Honey Roasted Almonds

steps.0: Dollop two tablespoons of Greek yogurt atop each waffle. Sprinkle strawberries, bananas and almonds over each waffle and serve immediately.

ingredients.0: 12 TJ's Eggs
ingredients.3: 1 cup TJ's Shaved Cheese Blend, divided
ingredients.5: 6 TJ's Super Sweet Baby Bell Peppers, cored and sliced into rings
ingredients.8: 1/2 link TJ's Soy Chorizo, casing removed and crumbled
ingredients.9: 1/2 cup sliced TJ's Mini Pearl Grape Tomatoes (garnish)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 375°F. In a large bowl, whisk together 12 eggs, 1/3 cup half & half and about 5 dashes of 21 seasoning salute. Whisk until eggs are nice and fluffy. Stir in 3/4 cup of shredded cheese then set aside.
steps.1: Heat a deep, 10-inch ovenproof skillet (a well-seasoned cast iron skillet works best), over medium heat. Spray with canola oil, then saute bell peppers and onions until they just begin to soften, about 2 minutes. Add baby spinach and sprinkle with a few dashes of 21 seasoning salute. Keep stirring until spinach begins to wilt, another 2 minutes. Add crumbled soy chorizo and stir another minute until well incorporated. Remove about 1/3 of the ingredients from the skillet and set aside on a plate (for garnishing the top of the frittata).
steps.2: Make sure all the ingredients are in an even layer on the bottom of the skillet, then pour the egg mixture over the top. Cook the frittata over medium heat, without stirring, until about 1 inch from the edge has begun to set, about 4-5 minutes. Sprinkle the sauteed ingredients that had been set aside over the top of the frittata and turn off heat.
steps.3: Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for about 16-18 minutes. Do not overcook. The consistency should be more like a custard than a sponge, so keep a close eye on it toward the end. The center might still look a little jiggly even when it is ready-so to check doneness-cut a small slit in the center of the frittata. If you see runny eggs in the cut, bake for another few minutes; if the eggs are set, it's done!
steps.4: For a crispy top, heat broiler then sprinkle reserved 1/4 cup of cheese over the top of the frittata then broil until cheese is browned and bubbling, about 1 minute. To serve, run a rubber spatula around edge of frittata and transfer to a plate. Cut into wedges, garnish with tomatoes and cilantro and enjoy!

ingredients.0: 2 tablespoons Kerrygold Irish Unsalted Butter, divided
ingredients.1: 6 slices TJ's Uncured Apple Smoked Bacon
ingredients.3: 3 TJ's Tomatoes on the Vine, halved
ingredients.8: 1 batch Easy As Crispy Corned Beef Hash (optional)

parsed_ing.8: Easy As Crispy Corned Beef Hash

steps.0: Preheat oven to 200°F. In a medium frying pan over medium-low heat, melt 1 tablespoon of butter. Add bacon and fry until soft and well browned, but not crispy, about 10 minutes. Set on a cookie sheet and place in the oven to keep warm.
steps.1: Turn the frying pan heat up to medium. Fry the bangers until the turn golden brown and the juices run clear or until the internal temperature reaches 170°F. Transfer cooked bangers to the cookie sheet in the oven.
steps.2: In a small saucepan over low heat, begin warming the baked beans. In another skillet, saute mushrooms over low heat until warmed. Meanwhile, fry the tomatoes until they are browned on all sides. Once finished, add to the cookie sheet in the oven.
steps.3: Add another tablespoon of butter to pan and fry the bread. Once golden, add to the warmed plate in the oven.
steps.4: Finally, fry 6 eggs to your taste. Divide ingredients among 6 plates, along with the prepared Corned Beef Hash and serve.

ingredients.0: 1 slice TJ's Uncured Apple Smoked Bacon, diced
ingredients.4: 1 TJ's Wheat or Whole Grain Bagel, sliced in half and toasted

steps.0: In a small pan over medium heat, add bacon and cook until browned, about two minutes. Toss in kale and stir until wilted about two more minutes. Remove from pan and set aside. Give the pan a spray with canola oil then fry your egg as desired. Arrange kale, bacon and fried egg over the toasted bagel and enjoy! Serve with fresh fruit.

ingredients.0: 2 slices of your favorite TJ's Bread
ingredients.5: 1/4 teaspoon TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract

steps.0: Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place two slices of bread on a cookie sheet and begin baking for 5 minutes.
steps.1: Meanwhile, in a small bowl, add 1 1/2 tablespoons of clarified butter, 1 tablespoon of sugar, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, a couple dashes of nutmeg and 1/4 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Stir until combined.
steps.2: Remove bread slices from oven, flip the slices over, then spread the cinnamon-sugar mix atop each slice, smoothing the mixture all the way to the edges.
steps.3: Place bread slices back into the oven for 7 more minutes, until the cinnamon-sugar topping bubbles slightly.
steps.4: Remove the cinnamon toast from the oven and rest on the cookie sheet to finish toasting and cool slightly, about 2 minutes.
steps.5: Slice the banana into medallions, place two "ears" and a "nose" atop each slice. Slice the bottom tips off of the strawberries, then slice the tips in half from top to bottom. Arrange the strawberry slices along the bottom edge of the toast to form a red "bow-tie". Finally, place the raisins atop the toast to form the "eyes" the tip of the "nose". Enjoy!

ingredients.0: 1/2 cup TJ's Rolled Oats
ingredients.1: 1/4 cup TJ's Nonfat Greek Yogurt (any kind)
ingredients.2: 1/2 cup TJ's Almond Beverage (Vanilla or Plain)

steps.0: In a resealable jar, add oats, greek yogurt, almond beverage and chia seeds. Stir, then seal the jar with a lid. Place in refrigerator 6 hours or overnight. The oats will soften and the mixture will become very thick. When ready to eat, if desired, add a splash of extra almond beverage to thin out the consistency. Garnish with toppings such as almonds, granola and raspberries. Serve cold.

ingredients.0: 1/2 cup TJ's Raw Almonds
ingredients.2: 1 cup (about 14) TJ's Fancy Medjool Dates, pitted

steps.0: Combine almonds, flaxseed and pitted dates in a food processor or blender and pulse until ingredients are crumbled in an even consistency. Spoon mixture into a medium sized bowl. Add cashew butter, rolled oats and cacao (or chocolate) then stir until combined. Refrigerate mixture in bowl for 15 minutes to set. Remove from refrigerator, then form mixture into 1 1/2 inch balls. Makes about 12 balls. Enjoy right away and store remaining bites in a resealable bag in the freezer.

ingredients.0: 1 can TJ's Canola Oil Spray
ingredients.1: 2 packages TJ's Prosciutto, sliced in half
ingredients.2: 1 package TJ's Polenta, sliced into thin disks then cut into eighths
ingredients.6: 12 leaves TJ's Fresh Basil, chopped (optional garnish)
ingredients.7: Standard 12-slot muffin tin (or 12 ceramic ramekin or 12 short mason jars placed on a baking tray)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray cups with canola oil. Arrange two prosciutto halves in each cup so that they cover the bottom, sides and are coming out the top of the cup. Add two to three pieces of polenta in a flat layer over the prosciutto, then add a slice of tomato. Gently press the layers down to ensure enough room for the eggs. Crack an egg over each cup being careful not to break the yolk. If the egg overflows out of the cup, scoop out some of the egg whites (otherwise the egg will create an air seal over the cup and the prosciutto will not crisp properly).
steps.1: Bake on the center rack for about 13-15 minutes or until the egg whites are firm. Remove from oven and let cool a few minutes. Run a knife around the edges of each cup, carefully remove the egg nests and place on a serving platter. Sprinkle with half a teaspoon of pesto each and garnish with basil. Serve immediately.

268.title: Sticky Monkey Buns
268.description: Ooey, gooey, fruity! Easy to make and a delight to enjoy for a special brunch spread or holiday gathering.

ingredients.0: 1 can TJ's Coconut Oil Spray
ingredients.4: 1 roll TJ's refrigerated Buttermilk Biscuits, separated & sliced into quarters
ingredients.5: 1 jar TJ's Fleur de Sel Caramel Sauce
ingredients.6: 2 ripe TJ's Bananas, sliced into medallions
ingredients.7: 1/3 cup TJ's Unsalted Dry Roasted Pecan Pieces
ingredients.9: Standard 12-slot muffin pan (or 10 ceramic ramekin or 10 mason jars placed on a baking tray)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Spray muffin pan with coconut oil spray, set aside.
steps.1: In a medium bowl, whisk together sugar, brown sugar and cinnamon. Toss biscuit pieces in sugar mixture until well coated; set aside.
steps.2: Add 1 tablespoon caramel sauce to 10 of the greased muffin pan cups. On top of the caramel, layer the following ingredients in order: 4 banana slices, 1 teaspoon of pecans, and one small handful of jumbo raisins. Gently press three of the coated biscuit pieces over each cup (you will have a couple extra pieces - be creative).
steps.3: Place pan in center rack of oven and bake approximately 15 minutes or until dough turns golden brown and an inserted toothpick comes out clean. Remove pan from oven and allow to cool for 1 minute. Flip the entire muffin pan over a clean cutting board to release sticky buns from the cups. Serve warm.

ingredients.0: 1 can TJ's Canola Oil Spray
ingredients.1: 36 (less than 1 bag) TJ's Trader Potato Tots
ingredients.3: 1 package fresh TJ's Trimmed Leeks, ends trimmed, quartered lengthwise & roughly chopped
ingredients.4: 6 slices TJ's Uncured Apple Smoked Bacon
ingredients.6: 1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
ingredients.7: 1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
ingredients.9: Standard 12-slot muffin tin (or 12 ceramic ramekin or 12 mason jars placed on a high-rimmed baking tray)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 400°F degrees. Spray cups with canola oil. Line each cup with three potato tots and set aside.
steps.1: Add butter and leeks to a skillet over medium heat, and saute 2-3 minutes until leeks are caramelized. Transfer sauteed leeks to a medium bowl. In the same pan, cook bacon according to package directions. Once crispy, remove to cool, blot dry, then chop into small pieces.
steps.2: Add bacon pieces to bowl of leeks, then stir in eggs, salt and pepper. Set aside. Add three to four pinches of goat cheese on top of the potato tots in each cup. Then, evenly distribute the egg mixture among the cups.
steps.3: Place pan in center rack of oven and bake 20-23 minutes until egg is cooked and tops have browned slightly. Allow to cool for a minute, then run a knife around the edge of each cup, and carefully remove tottins and place in a serving platter. Enjoy!

ingredients.0: 1 TJ's Bagel

steps.0: Slice bagel in half and toast. Spread a tablespoon of cream cheese on each side, then layer half the remaining ingredients on each side making two sandwiches. Serve immediately, and make sure to follow up with a mint (you’ll need it).

271.title: Cocoa Almond & Banana Stuffed French Toast

ingredients.0: 6 thick slices TJ's Artisan Bread (we used the Rustic variety)
ingredients.8: 4-5 TJ's Strawberries, sliced into heart shapes

steps.0: Make a deep cut into each slice of bread to create a pocket, and stuff generously with cocoa almond spread and bananas. Whisk milk, eggs and cinnamon together in a medium dish. Melt butter in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat. While skillet is heating, dip each side of the stuffed bread pocket into the egg mixture then fry in batches until golden brown on both sides. Top each slice with another layer of cocoa almond spread, sliced bananas and syrup. Garnish the plate with fresh strawberries and enjoy!

ingredients.0: 1 cup TJ's Frozen Fancy Berry Medley
ingredients.1: 1 cup TJ's Almond Beverage - choose your favorite variety!
ingredients.2: 2 tablespoons TJ's Organic Vanilla Flavored Hemp Protein Powder OR Vanilla Flavored Whey Protein Powder
ingredients.3: 3 tablespoons TJ's Creamy Unsalted Almond Butter
ingredients.6: 1 cup TJ's Granola (we used TJ's Gluten Free Granola - Loaded Fruit & Nut Variety)
ingredients.7: 1 tablespoon Organic Raw Blue Agave Sweetener

parsed_ing.1: Almond Beverage - choose your favorite variety!
parsed_ing.2: Organic Vanilla Flavored Hemp Protein Powder

corrected_ing.1: Almond Beverage - choose your favorite variety!

steps.0: Toss frozen berries, almond milk, protein powder, almond butter, chia seeds and 1 banana in a blender. Pulse a few times until liquefied. Split mixture into separate serving bowls. Top each bowl with granola, sliced bananas, and sweetener.

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Potato Pancakes
ingredients.1: 1 cup TJ's New Zealand Grass Fed Sharp Cheddar, shredded

parsed_ing.1: New Zealand Grass Fed Sharp Cheddar

steps.0: Preheat oven to 400°F. Arrange potato pancakes on a non-stick baking sheet and cook for 8 minutes. Flip pancakes and cook for 7 minutes. Add shredded cheese and cook for an additional minute. Top with sour cream and chives and serve.

ingredients.0: 1 package (8 waffles) TJ's Frozen Toaster Waffles
ingredients.2: 1 package TJ's Blueberries, fresh or frozen

steps.0: Toast waffles according to directions on box. While waffles are toasting, combine blueberries, cream cheese, sugar and a splash of vanilla in a food processor or blender and mix until smooth. Spread the blended mixture between two waffles, sprinkle on a few whole blueberries, sandwich and enjoy.

ingredients.0: 1 loaf TJ's Crusty French Bread, torn into pieces
ingredients.3: 1 cup TJ's Sweet Italian Style Chicken Sausage (pre-cooked), sliced (or TJ's Italian Sausage-less Sausage)
ingredients.4: 1 cup TJ's Monterey Jack Cheese, grated

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350° and grease baking pan with your choice of oil or butter. Place bread pieces in pan and distribute evenly. Beat the eggs, milk and any spices you desire (salt, pepper, garlic powder...) and pour over the bread. Add the remaining ingredients and bake for 25 minutes or until top is golden brown and a knife put in the center comes out clean. Let sit for 5 minutes before serving (oh, you can wait). Enjoy.

276.title: Chicken Sausage & Lentil Soup
276.description: For a comforting meal that won't weigh you down, look no further than this deceivingly humble, decidedly delicious bowl of soup. This Tuscan-inspired combo calls on zucchini, tomato, and garlic chicken sausage to build a flavorful base, but feel free to sub in whatever suits your available supplies.Try bell pepper & jalapeno chicken sausage for a spicy kick, or kale & smoked apple chardonnay chicken sausage for a sweet-savory spin. The red lentils can be swapped with whatever grains or short pasta you have on hand-simply adjust the simmering time.

ingredients.0: 2 tablespoons TJ's Olive Oil
ingredients.4: 1 package TJ's Fully Cooked Garlic & Herb Chicken Sausage, sliced into coins
ingredients.5: 1 cup TJ's Red Split Lentils, rinsed and drained
ingredients.6: 1 package TJ's Organic Free Range Chicken Stock
ingredients.8: TJ's Grated Parmesan, lemon & chopped fresh herbs for garnish (optional)

parsed_ing.4: Fully Cooked Garlic & Herb Chicken Sausage

steps.0: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion, zucchini and a pinch of salt. Saute until onion is translucent.
steps.1: Add tomatoes, chicken sausage, lentils, chicken stock, and 1 cup water to pot and stir. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer until lentils are cooked through, about 10 minutes.
steps.2: Season soup to taste with salt & pepper. Ladle into bowls, garnish with grated Parmesan, fresh herbs, or a squeeze of lemon (or all three!) and dig in.

277.title: Easy Bolognese-y
277.description: In need of a comforting concoction to beat the dinner doldrums? Look no further than a warm bowl of al dente pasta topped with savory meat sauce. This recipe relies on pantry and fridge basics (namely, noodles, sauce, meat, and veggies), so feel free to substitute with whatever you've got on hand. Enjoy the finished dish as-is, or lean into the checkered tablecloth restaurant vibe and serve with garlic bread and a glass of Grifone Sangiovese.

ingredients.0: 1 pound TJ's Organic Ground Beef
ingredients.2: 1/2 bag TJ's Organic Broccoli Slaw, chopped into small pieces

steps.0: Add ground beef to a large skillet and season with garlic powder. Cook until slightly browned. Add chopped slaw to browned beef and cook a few minutes more, stirring occasionally. Add marinara, stir, then simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
steps.1: While sauce simmers, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package directions. Before draining, reserve a half-cup of pasta water and stir into sauce.
steps.2: Drain pasta, then toss with a bit of olive oil to keep from sticking. Divide pasta among serving bowls and top with meat sauce. Yum!

278.title: Stay Home Soup
278.description: We put together a mouthwatering "#StayHome soup" using a box of soup, a can of beans, and some onions, olive oil, and cumin. We used Trader Joe's Organic Butternut Squash Soup & Organic Garbanzo Beans, but you can use *any* box or can of soup and *any* kind of beans-simply adjust your featured spice accordingly. Other combos we love: Tomato soup with basil & white beans, split pea soup with cayenne & kidney beans, roasted corn soup with oregano & black beans...the pantry's the limit!

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Low Sodium Organic Butternut Squash Soup
ingredients.4: 1 can TJ's Organic Garbanzo Beans, partially drained

parsed_ing.0: Low Sodium Organic Butternut Squash Soup

steps.0: Heat soup according to package directions; set aside and keep warm.
steps.1: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cumin, saute until onions are translucent.
steps.2: Add beans and a pinch of salt to pan. Saute until beans are heated through and liquid is reduced. Remove from heat.
steps.3: Ladle soup into shallow serving bowls. Top each bowl with a scoop of beans and garnish with salt and olive oil. Serve as-is, or with crackers, or crusty bread, or crisp salad greens...

279.title: Cashew Chicken Lettuce Wraps
279.description: Inspired by a favorite dish at a nearby Chinese restaurant, this combination of sesame stir-fried ground chicken, crunchy cashews, warm ginger, et al. really pops when portioned out atop cool, crisp (not to mention naturally low-carb) lettuce leaves. Not cooking for five? No problem! This recipe has Sunday night #mealprep written all over it.

ingredients.0: 1 tablespoon TJ's Olive Oil
ingredients.1: 1 tablespoon TJ's Organic Toasted Sesame Oil
ingredients.8: 1 package TJ's Chile & Garlic Cashews, chopped

steps.0: Combine olive & sesame oils and heat in large skillet. Add chicken and cook over medium-high heat until chicken is cooked through, about 8 minutes, or until internal temperature reaches 165°F.
steps.1: Add diced onions, stir to combine, and cook for about 5 minutes or until onion is soft and translucent. Stir occasionally.
steps.2: Add Soyaki, soy sauce, rice vinegar, ginger, cashews, chives, salt and pepper. Cook for another 5 minutes or until fragrant.
steps.3: Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
steps.4: Rise head of lettuce, pat dry, and pull off desired leaves. Spoon about 1/4 cup of the mixture into each of the lettuce leaves to serve. Enjoy!

280.title: Linguine Limone Alfredo with Shrimp
280.description: Inspired by a well-known & well-loved dish at an equally well-known & well-loved Italian restaurant here in L.A., Trader Joe's Limone Alfredo Sauce tastes like a bright, sunny spring afternoon... If said spring afternoon was, say, mixed with whole milk, whipping cream, butter & real Parmigiano Reggiano cheese, that is! This zesty, creamy Alfredo is perfect with long-cut pasta like Trader Joe's Linguine, and since it also brightens up seafood like you wouldn't believe, we suggest adding some garlic-sauteed shrimp to the pasta party...

ingredients.0: 1/2 package TJ's Linguine
ingredients.2: 1/2 bag TJ's Frozen Cooked Medium Shrimp

steps.0: In a large pot, bring water to a rolling boil; add salt if desired. Add noodles and stir gently to separate. Bring water back to a boil and cook 8 - 10 minutes or until desired doneness is reached.
steps.1: Remove from heat and drain pasta well. Place pasta back in empty pot.
steps.2: In a medium skillet, melt butter. Once melted, add shrimp and garlic; saute for 2 - 3 minutes, just until shrimp are thoroughly heated.
steps.3: Add sauce and shrimp to noodles and mix until thoroughly coated. Add parsley if desired and salt to taste.
steps.4: Serve and enjoy!

281.title: Creamy Pesto Chicken & Broccoli Bow Tie Pasta
281.description: You might be dining in your jammies tonight (#JOEMO!), but this classy entree brings the bow ties anyway! Don't let elegant neckwear fool you, though-this Creamy Pesto Chicken & Broccoli Bow Tie Pasta is seriously a cinch to whip up.

ingredients.0: 1/2 bag TJ's Italian Farfalle
ingredients.4: 1 cup TJ's Roasted & Salted Pecan Halves
ingredients.5: 1/2 package TJ's Organic Broccoli Florets (fresh not frozen)

steps.0: Bring a medium pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta to boiling water. Cook uncovered, stirring occasionally for about 7-10 minutes. Remove pasta and drain thoroughly. Place back in empty pot.
steps.1: Cook broccoli according to package instructions. Chop broccoli and chicken into bite-sized pieces; chop or smash pecans into smaller pieces.
steps.2: Add pesto, mascarpone, broccoli, chicken, pecans, and salt to pasta and mix until thoroughly combined. If needed, place pot back on burner and mix over low heat instead. (Heat will soften the mascarpone, making it easier to work with.)
steps.3: Serve and enjoy!

282.title: Caprese Risoni
282.description: Grains are great, but legumes? Legumes are legendary. Trader Joe's Organic Chickpea & Red Lentil Risoni isn't just a rice replacement- it's remarkably tasty in its own right! Cook it up and see for yourself with this Caprese-inspired recipe...

ingredients.0: 1 cup TJ's Organic Chickpea & Red Lentil Risoni
ingredients.2: 6 TJ's Organic Tomatoes on the Vine

steps.0: In a medium saucepan, bring 1.5 cups of water to a boil. Stir in 1 cup of Risoni and return to boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 9 minutes, stirring occasionally.
steps.1: Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 5 minutes.
steps.2: Cut tomatoes into quarters.
steps.3: Mix together Risoni, tomatoes, pesto, cheese, and drizzle with glaze.
steps.4: Serve immediately and enjoy!

283.title: Pesto Kale Gnocchi
283.description: Like their cauliflower cousins, these chewy pillows of real, fresh kale, potato starch, and chickpea flour offer up a surprising amount of flavor and boast the same, satisfyingly chewy texture of "regular" gnocchi. You can serve them with whatever sauce & accoutrements you fancy, but we quite like them all dressed up in Trader Joe's Vegan Kale, Cashew & Basil Pesto. (Never hurts to double-down on kale, right?)

ingredients.0: TJ's Olive Oil
ingredients.4: 1/4 cup TJ's Vegan Kale, Cashew & Basil Pesto

steps.0: Heat 1 - 2 tablespoons of oil in a saute pan over medium heat.
steps.1: Add gnocchi and heat for 7 to 10 minutes.
steps.2: In a medium bowl combine gnocchi, tomatoes, cheese, and pesto. Mix until evenly coated.
steps.3: Serve warm and enjoy!

284.title: Slow Cooker Chicken Chile Verde
284.description: Who wouldn't want to come home to a nice, warm meal? This Salsa Verde-style salute to the slow cooker yields you just that! Simply toss two jars of Trader Joe's Salsa Verde, two pounds of Trader Joe's Chicken Thighs, twelve cloves of minced garlic, half a teaspoon of ground cumin, and a large diced onion into your cooker, and you've got yourself an easy-peasy, hands-off, mess-free meal in just a few hours.

ingredients.0: 1 large TJ's Onion, diced
ingredients.1: 12 cloves TJ's Premium Peeled Garlic, minced
ingredients.2: 2 TJ's Jalapenos, deseeded and diced (use gloves!)
ingredients.8: TJ's Lime wedges, chopped Cilantro, for garnish (optional)

steps.0: Add onion, garlic, jalapeno, chicken thighs, salsa verde and cumin to slow cooker and stir to combine.
steps.1: Cook on LOW for 6-8 hours or HIGH for 2-4 hours, until chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165 degrees.
steps.2: Shred chicken with a fork and serve with rice and beans.
steps.3: Garnish with lime wedges and chopped cilantro.

285.title: Paul's Quinoa Chili
285.description: Named for a guy who didn't eat meat but who really knew his chili, this has to be one of the easiest, tastiest meatless dishes we've cooked up all year-and that's saying something! (Carnivores, stay calm; just brown some ground beef & toss it in the pot if you'd like.) The secret ingredient? Trader Joe's Organic Chili Seasoning Blend, of course...

ingredients.0: 1 cup TJ's Organic Tricolor Quinoa
ingredients.5: 1 can TJ's Organic Diced & Fire Roasted Tomatoes with Organic Green Chiles
ingredients.6: 1 can TJ's Organic Kidney Beans, drained
ingredients.7: 2 tablespoons TJ's Organic Chili Seasoning Blend

parsed_ing.5: Organic Diced & Fire Roasted Tomatoes with Organic Green Chiles

steps.0: Rinse quinoa thoroughly in cold water & drain. Place rinsed quinoa in a medium pot with 2 cups of water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer, cover, and cook for about 15 minutes, or until all water is absorbed. Remove from heat and set aside.
steps.1: Heat olive oil in a large pot, add onions, and saute for about 5 minutes, or until they began to soften. Add quinoa, tomato sauce, tomatoes, beans, chili seasoning and salt and mix until well combined.
steps.2: Let simmer uncovered for about 25 minutes. Remove from heat and let rest for 5 minutes.
steps.3: Serve warm and enjoy!

286.title: Fall Turkey Chili With Pumpkin
286.description: When the weather starts to cool down, and Trader Joe's Organic Pumpkin cans make their debut in the grocery aisle, you'll know it's time to make this chili. Tender ground turkey, savory seasonings and velvety pumpkin puree make this dish a hearty, stick-to-your-ribs kind of meal.

ingredients.0: 1 Tbsp TJ's Pure Imported Olive Oil
ingredients.4: 1 pkg (1.5 lbs) TJ's All-Natural Ground Turkey
ingredients.5: 1 can TJ's Organic Diced & No Salt Added Tomatoes
ingredients.7: 1 can TJ's Organic Kidney Beans, drained
ingredients.8: 1/2 can TJ's Whole Kernel Corn, drained

parsed_ing.5: Organic Diced & No Salt Added Tomatoes

steps.0: In a large saucepan or stockpot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onions and bell peppers and saute until onions are translucent and fragrant, about 3-4 minutes. Add garlic and stir for 30 seconds. Add turkey and break up in pan with spoon, sauteing until turkey is browned and cooked through. Stir in tomatoes, pumpkin, beans, corn and spices. Bring to a boil, and then reduce heat and simmer 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Garnish with sour cream, cheese, avocado and cilantro, and serve.

287.title: Enchilada Pie
287.description: Trader Joe's Sweet & Crisp Whole Kernel Corn has been warming our shelves with its bright yellow label for years, making it one of our most recognizable products. In this recipe, we’ve paired these naturally sweet kernels with the savory flavors of an unrolled enchilada. Layers of corn tortillas, cheese, butternut squash, black beans, and hatch chiles round out this meatless dish for a meal that won't disappoint. Top with crunchy green onions and sliced avocado for a satisfying dinner you'll want to add to your weekly rotation after just one bite.

ingredients.0: 1 Bags TJ's Cut Butternut Squash
ingredients.1: 1 Can TJ's Whole Kernel Corn, drained
ingredients.2: 1 Can TJ's Organic Black Beans, drained
ingredients.3: 1/2 Can TJ's Hatch Chopped Green Chiles
ingredients.6: 2 Cups TJ's Shredded Fancy Mexican Style Cheese Blend divided
ingredients.8: 3 TJ's Green Onions diced, for garnish
ingredients.9: 1 ripe TJ's Avocado, diced, for garnish

parsed_ing.6: Shredded Fancy Mexican Style Cheese Blend divided

corrected_ing.6: Shredded Fancy Mexican Style Cheese Blend divided

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 10-inch pie pan or casserole dish and set aside.
steps.1: Cut the corner of the bag of squash and microwave, 3 minutes until softened. Let cool slightly and dice.
steps.2: Combine corn, beans, chile, squash, taco seasoning, a pinch of salt and 1/2 cup enchilada sauce in a bowl and mix until evenly coated.
steps.3: Pour remaining enchilada sauce on a large plate. Coat both sides of the tortillas in sauce. Place a layer of tortillas on the bottom of the prepared pan, tearing tortillas as needed to fill the gaps. Top with 1/2 of the vegetable mix and 1/2 cup of cheese. Cover with another layer of dipped tortillas, top with the remaining vegetable mix and another 1/2 cup of cheese. Add the final layer of dipped tortillas and the remaining 1 cup of cheese on top.
steps.4: Place pie on center rack of oven and bake for 30-40 minutes, or until cheese is melted and golden brown, and pie is slightly bubbling. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Garnish with green onion and avocado and enjoy.

288.title: Chimichurri Stir-Fry
288.description: In South America, Chimichurri is perhaps as common a condiment as ketchup is in America - albeit much more flavorful and distinctive. Trader Joe's Peruvian Style Chimichurri Rice with Vegetables delivers on this distinction with the inclusion of cilantro, creme fraiche, garlic, ginger and Peruvian panca peppers.  A one-of-a-kind dish on its own, our Chimichurri Rice makes for a flavorful base in this one-skillet stir fry recipe. We've paired it with fresh broccoli (#eatyourveggies) and jalapeno sausage to create a quick yet yummy meal for when you're short on time.

ingredients.0: TJ's Olive Oil
ingredients.2: 2 Packages TJ's Peruvian Style Chimichurri Rice with Vegetables

parsed_ing.2: Peruvian Style Chimichurri Rice with Vegetables

corrected_ing.2: Peruvian Style Chimichurri Rice with Vegetables

steps.0: Slice sausage into coins. Add a small amount of oil to a large skillet over medium heat and pan fry sausage for 7 to 9 minutes flipping halfway through, until browned on both sides. Remove sausage from pan and let cool slightly.
steps.1: Add broccoli and 3 tablespoons of water to the same pan, cover and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Remove cover, add Chimichurri rice and two additional tablespoons of water and stir. Cook over medium heat for 5 additional minutes, or until rice is hot, stirring occasionally.
steps.2: Add sausage back to pan and cook a minute more to warm through. Spoon into serving bowls and enjoy.

289.title: Lemon Ricotta Ravioli Salad
289.description: Cut to resemble the sunflowers, or girasoli, that blanket the Italian countryside each summer, Trader Joe's Ricotta & Lemon Zest Ravioli are a revelation in warm-weather cuisine. Made for us by a trusted Italian pasta partner, these tender, eggy, sunflower-shaped pasta pockets are stuffed with a bright & creamy filling of fresh ricotta cheese, real Sicilian lemon zest, salt, butter, & breadcrumbs. For a delicious dinner in a flash, simply throw together a crisp arugula salad, then top it with these quick-cooking Ravioli and a shower of salty, shaved Parmesan... Mangia bene!

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Ricotta & Lemon Zest Ravioli (limited)
ingredients.3: TJ's Shaved Parmesan, Romano & Asiago Cheese
ingredients.5: TJ's Dry Toasted Pine Nuts OR TJ's Roasted Not So Salty Cashew Pieces

steps.0: Bring 4 quarts of lightly salted water to a boil. Add ravioli, bring back to a gentle boil. Cook 3 minutes until al dente. Drain and set aside.
steps.1: In a large bowl, toss arugula with a small amount of dressing to coat. Divide dressed arugula among shallow serving bowls. Top with ravioli, a generous shower of cheese, a sprinkle of pine nuts (optional), and a few grinds of lemon pepper. Serve immediately, with more dressing on the side.

290.title: Baked Parmesan Chicken Tenders
290.description: Trader Joe's Gluten Free Rice Crumbs are here to answer the call for breading without glutinous boundaries. Our supplier takes salted, puffed, medium-grain white rice (and nothing else!) and grinds it into a flurry of Crumbs designed to create a gloriously crisp crunch when baked or fried. In addition to their Gluten Free distinction, these kosher-certified Crumbs contain no added sugar or other extraneous seasonings; their mild flavor is equally adaptable to any sweet or savory recipe calling for bread crumbs-versatility for the win! Here, we've combined them with savory Parmesan cheese and our equally versatile 21 Seasoning Salute for a delightfully seasoned baked chicken tender coating.

ingredients.0: 11/2 cups TJ's Gluten Free Rice Crumbs
ingredients.6: 2 packages TJ's Organic Chicken Breast Tenders
ingredients.7: Your favorite TJ's Sauce for dipping (Dijon Mustard, BBQ Sauce, Green Dragon Hot Sauce...)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 425°F. Spread rice crumbs on a large baking sheet. Place on center rack of oven and bake 10 minutes. Remove from oven and transfer rice crumbs to a shallow bowl to cool.
steps.1: Coat baking sheet with cooking spray, set aside. Remove chicken from packaging and pat dry with paper towels, set aside.
steps.2: Add cheese, 21 seasoning, and salt to cooled rice crumbs, set aside. In another shallow bowl, whisk eggs, set aside. One by one, dredge a chicken tender in egg, letting excess drain off before dredging in rice crumb mixture. Dredge tender once more in egg and rice crumb mixture, then transfer to prepared baking sheet. Repeat with remaining tenders.
steps.3: Spray tops of dredged chicken tenders with canola oil spray. Place baking sheet on center rack of oven and bake 15 minutes. Use tongs to flip chicken tenders and bake 8-10 minutes more, until internal temperature of chicken reaches 165°F and exterior is a light golden brown. Remove from oven and transfer chicken tenders to a wire rack to cool slightly before serving.

291.title: Cheesy Hot Pepper Pasta
291.description: Trader Joe's Italian Bomba Hot Pepper Sauce builds heat, bite by bite, until you reach a crescendo of spice so invigorating that it paradoxically keeps you coming back for more. Drizzle it on pizza, grilled chicken, veggies, or scrambled eggs. Or, saute it with garlic, oil, cheese and lemon to create a vibrantly flavored sauce for coating pasta.

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Organic Italian Artisan Gigli Pasta
ingredients.2: 1-2 tablespoons TJ's Italian Bomba Hot Pepper Sauce
ingredients.3: 1 teaspoon TJ's Garlic Powder or Minced Garlic
ingredients.4: Zest and juice of 1/2 a TJ's Lemon (juice reserved)
ingredients.5: 1 cup TJ's Grated Parmesan Cheese, plus more for garnish

steps.0: In a large pot, bring 4 quarts salted water to a rolling boil. Add pasta, stir gently and return to a boil; boil 4-5 minutes until very al dente, stirring frequently. Drain pasta, reserving 1/2 cup of pasta water for sauce.
steps.1: Add oil, garlic, lemon zest, and bomba sauce to a large, high-sided skillet. Saute over medium heat until garlic and lemon are fragrant. Add pasta and cheese to skillet and fold gently to coat.  Add reserved pasta water a splash at a time, if needed, to thin sauce as desired. Remove from heat and fold in lemon juice. Divide pasta among serving bowls and garnish with more cheese before serving.

292.title: Oktoberfest Feast
292.description: While Trader Joe's Bavarian Bratwurst weren't around for the inaugural Oktoberfest festivities, we think they'd fit right in on the buffet table if they were. Made in Germany, these pork-sausage Brats are succulently plump, well-seasoned, and fully cooked, needing only a quick pan-fry or turn on the grill to achieve a golden-brown glow. They're the ideal summer-to-fall transition food, ready to pair with cool, crunchy Trader Joe's Sauerkraut with Pickled Persian Cucumbers and Josephsbrau Oktoberfest Lager.

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Uncured Bavarian Bratwurst
ingredients.2: TJ's Sauerkraut with Pickled Persian Cucumbers
ingredients.3: TJ's Deli Style Spicy Brown Mustard

steps.0: Heat a skillet over medium. Add bratwurst and pan-fry 8-10 minutes, until lightly browned and bratwurst reach an internal temperature of 165°F. Remove from heat.
steps.1: To serve, place each sausage in a hot dog bun, top with sauerkraut and drizzle with mustard. Serve with cold bottles of Josephsbrau Oktoberfest Lager on the side.

293.title: Beef-less Burritos
293.description: Making a taco better than its already-delicious self sounds like a tall task, but then you probably haven't tried a taco that's been doused in Trader Joe's Organic Spicy Taco Sauce. We start with a base of distilled vinegar and tomato paste; add some heat thanks to chili pepper powder, red jalapeno pepper puree, and cayenne peppers; and round out the flavor with spices like garlic powder, pepper, and oregano. This savory, tangy, and spicy sauce isn't so spicy that you'd have any qualms about dousing your food in it. And just because it's called Taco Sauce doesn't mean you have to use this stuff exclusively on tacos. Burritos, taquitos, tamales, quesadillas, nachos, scrambled eggs, burgers, chicken tenders... they're are all fair game! In this recipe, we've simmered Trader Joe's Beef-less Ground Beef and diced mushrooms in our Spicy Taco Sauce for a multipurpose, meatless taco or burrito filling with just the right amount of heat.

ingredients.0: 1 tablespoon TJ's Olive Oil
ingredients.3: 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons TJ's Organic Spicy Taco Sauce
ingredients.5: 1/2 head of TJ's Iceberg Lettuce, shredded

steps.0: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add diced mushrooms to skillet and let cook undisturbed for 5 minutes, until most of the moisture has evaporated. Add beef-less beef and taco sauce to skillet and saute another 5-7 minutes, until heated through.
steps.1: To serve, scoop beef-less beef into a warm tortilla and top with lettuce, tomato and cheese. Fold as you like and serve with more taco sauce for drizzling.

294.title: Salmon Burgers
294.description: Like its namesake brunch beverage, Trader Joe's Bloody Mary Salsa boasts a base of sweet, juicy tomatoes, buoyed by a sour pickling brine, lemon juice, & nose-tingling horseradish. Jalapeno & green chili peppers add heat; Worcestershire sauce, capers, garlic, & onions offer a savory balance. It's that tangy, tongue-tingling Bloody Mary taste you love, plus just enough spice to keep you sipping-or in this case, dipping-for more.In addition to the aforementioned dipping (chips or veggies, your call), this Salsa's bright, zesty profile is a welcome foil to grilled veggies or fish. Paired with Trader Joe's Premium Salmon Burgers, it makes for a speedy summer supper.

ingredients.0: 1 box TJ's Premium Salmon Burgers
ingredients.3: 1 TJ's Large Avocado, pitted and thinly sliced
ingredients.4: 1/4 TJ's Jumbo Red Onion, peeled and very thinly sliced

steps.0: Prepare salmon burgers according to package instructions. Place cooked salmon burger on bottom of brioche bun. Spoon salsa over burger. Arrange a few avocado slices atop salsa, followed by red onion and a handful of greens. Close burger with top half of brioche bun. Repeat with remaining ingredients and enjoy right away.

295.title: Green Dragon Fish Tacos
295.description: On a heat scale of "Meh" to "Yowza!!" Trader Joe's Green Dragon Hot Sauce rates a solidly satisfying "Whoa!" (About a 7 on the more mundane 1-10 scale). Made with jalapenos, tomatillos, cilantro, garlic, and habanero pepper powder, with a dash of vinegar and a splash of lime juice, it's a creative condiment that's delicious on... just about everything. Seriously! Drizzle Green Dragon on eggs, salads, burgers, enchiladas, fried rice, fish tacos...

ingredients.0: TJ's Battered Fish Nuggets
ingredients.1: 2-3 TJ's Organic Tomatoes on the Vine
ingredients.3: TJ's Organic Shredded Green & Red Cabbage with Orange Carrots

parsed_ing.3: Organic Shredded Green & Red Cabbage with Orange Carrots

steps.0: Preheat oven to 475°F. Arrange fish nuggets on a greased baking sheet. Bake on center rack of oven for 15-18 minutes until crisp. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.
steps.1: While fish nuggets bake, slice tomatoes and set aside. Warm tortillas in a pan over medium heat or directly over the gas flame, using tongs to flip.
steps.2: To assemble each taco, place two nuggets in a warm tortilla and top with tomatoes and cabbage. Drizzle with as much hot sauce as you like and enjoy!

296.title: Sheet Pan Fajitas
296.description: Trader Joe's Pollo Asado Autentico is, more or less, the chicken version of our classic Carne Asada: thin strips of boneless, skinless chicken breast, marinated in an ever-so-slightly spicy, bright, citrus-y marinade. The chicken is grill-ready, but also makes a lip-smackingly simple sheet pan meal when roasted with peppers and onions. Nothing complicated or fancy here; but oh boy is it delicious.

ingredients.0: 1 TJ's Yellow Onion, thinly sliced
ingredients.1: 1 bag TJ's Frozen Melange a Trois (Red, Yellow & Green Bell Pepper Strips)

steps.0: Position oven racks in upper and lower thirds of oven. Preheat oven to 400°F.
steps.1: Place onion, bell peppers, and olive oil in a medium bowl and toss to combine. Divide mixture among two large baking sheets; set aside.
steps.2: Remove pollo asado from package and slice into 2x1-inch strips. Divide pollo asado between baking sheets. Place sheets on upper and lower racks of oven and bake 25-30 minutes, rotating halfway through, until chicken reaches 165°F. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.
steps.3: While fajitas bake, slice limes into wedges. Rinse and dry cilantro and remove stems. Warm tortillas in a skillet over medium heat, or directly over flame, if desired.
steps.4: To assemble, fill a warm tortilla with fajitas and top with pico de gallo, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime. Repeat until satisfied.

297.title: Cheesy Red Pepper Pizza
297.description: Encouraged by our Customers' love for TJ's Cauliflower Pizza Crust, our Buyer recently approached our Italian supplier to see what else we could come up with. After tinkering with the recipe for a stretch to get it juuuust right, a new star was born: Trader Joe's Broccoli & Kale Pizza Crust. Like its predecessors, its gluten-free ingredient list is simple as can be: broccoli and black kale (which make up over 50% of the recipe), corn flour, water, cornstarch, potato starch, olive oil, and salt. For the best Broccoli & Kale Crust-ed pizza of your life, pre-cooking the crust is a must prior to adding your toppings. Do so, and you'll be rewarded with crispy edges and a slightly chewy center, not to mention earthy, vegetal flavor...

ingredients.0: 1 TJ's Broccoli & Kale Pizza Crust
ingredients.1: 1/3 jar TJ's Red Pepper Spread with Eggplant & Garlic
ingredients.2: 5 slices TJ's Fresh Mozzarella Cheese Log

parsed_ing.1: Red Pepper Spread with Eggplant & Garlic

steps.0: Par-bake crust according to package directions. Remove crust from oven. Slather red pepper sauce evenly atop crust, followed by cheese slices. Return pizza to oven and cook 5-8 minutes, or until cheese is melted. Remove pizza from oven and let cool slightly before slicing and serving.

298.title: Pressure Cooker Corned Beef & Cabbage
298.description: Pickling spices of mustard, coriander, bay leaf, red chili pepper, and dill seed create the signature flavor profile of Trader Joe's Uncured Corned Beef Brisket: savory and fragrant, balanced by tangy vinegar powder and sweet brown sugar. We've opted for a high quality, tender brisket cut with no nitrates or nitrites, which creates an impossibly juicy, incredibly flavorful finished dish. Traditionally, corned beef is cooked low and slow-but if you don't have three or four hours to stand stove-side, opt instead for pressure cooker preparation. Complete with complex beer braised flavor, and fork-tender carrots, potatoes, and cabbage, the end result is corned beef and all the fixings, ready for a St. Patrick's Day potluck in a fraction of the time.

ingredients.0: 1 TJ's Jumbo Yellow Onion, trimmed and cut into large chunks
ingredients.2: 1 bottle (11.2 fl. oz.) Guinness Draught Irish Stout
ingredients.4: 1 bag (1.5 pounds) Organic Mini Potato Medley OR Red Potatoes
ingredients.5: 1 bag TJ's Organic Cut & Peeled Carrots
ingredients.6: 1 head TJ's Green Cabbage, trimmed and cut into wedges
ingredients.7: TJ's Whole Grain Mustard, for serving

steps.0: Place onion chunks in pressure cooker. Remove brisket from package and cut into three large pieces. Arrange brisket atop onions, fat-side down. Pour beer and water over brisket.
steps.1: Seal pressure cooker lid and cook on high pressure for 20 minutes per pound (that's 70 minutes for a 3.5-pound brisket; add or subtract cook time as necessary based on the weight of your brisket). Let pressure release naturally for 20 minutes, then manually release remaining pressure. Carefully transfer brisket pieces to a cutting board and cover with foil.
steps.2: Strain cooking liquid, reserving 1.5 cups liquid to cook vegetables; discard solids. Add potatoes, carrots and cabbage wedges to pressure cooker and cover with reserved liquid. Seal lid and cook on high pressure for 3 minutes. Quick release pressure. Use tongs to transfer vegetables to a large serving platter; reserve cooking liquid for serving.
steps.3: Gently slice corned beef against the grain and arrange next to vegetables on serving platter. Spoon cooking liquid atop corned beef. Serve with whole grain mustard on the side.

299.title: Vegetable and Soba Noodle Shrimp Stir Fry
299.description: Prepare Trader Joe's Vegetable and Soba Noodle Stir Fry Kit as directed, and the vegetables (namely, broccoli florets, Bok Choy, savoy cabbage, snow peas, and green onion) will be crunchy, and the soba blissfully chewy-both enhanced by the included sweet stir fry sauce with classic ginger, garlic and sesame flavors. Add some thawed, fully cooked shrimp during the last few seconds of cooking, and in less than 10 minutes, you'll have a complete meal on your hands!

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Vegetable and Soba Noodle Stir Fry
ingredients.2: 1 package TJ's Fully Cooked Medium Shrimp (70-110 count)

parsed_ing.0: Vegetable and Soba Noodle Stir Fry

steps.0: Remove noodles from package and soak in a bowl of hot water for two minutes to soften (or microwave in a microwave safe bowl filled with water for 30 seconds). Drain and use your fingers to gently separate noodles; set aside.
steps.1: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Add vegetables and saute 3 to 4 minutes, stirring frequently. Add noodles to skillet and saute an additional 1 to 2 minutes, or until heated through. Add sauce and toss to coat the vegetables and noodles. Turn off heat. Add shrimp to pan and toss once more to coat. Divide among shallow serving bowls and enjoy immediately.

300.title: Corny Chicken Poblano Ravioli
300.description: We created Trader Joe's Creamy Chicken Poblano Ravioli with one of our trusted ravioli suppliers, starting with a filling made from chunks of breast meat that comes from chickens raised cage-free and fed an all-vegetarian diet with no antibiotics ever. The chicken is paired with plenty of poblano peppers, giving each bite a fresh-chili flavor and mild heat. Four kinds of cheese (ricotta, mozzarella, Parmesan & Romano) fill out the filling, along with heavy cream, and breadcrumbs-all seasoned with oregano, garlic, sea salt, and black pepper, then wrapped in egg & durum wheat pasta. Whew!While a pasta of this pedigree doesn't need much more than a drizzle of olive oil to shine, we're never ones to resist upping the ante. In this recipe, we've paired the Ravioli with Trader Joe's Mexican Style Roasted Corn with Cotija Cheese for an extra hit of heat and fresh corn flavor. What's more, it can be on the table (read: in your belly!) in about 20 minutes.

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Mexican Style Roasted Corn with Cotija Cheese
ingredients.1: 1 package TJ's Creamy Chicken Poblano Ravioli

parsed_ing.0: Mexican Style Roasted Corn with Cotija Cheese

steps.0: In  large pot, bring 4 quarts of water to a boil. While water boils, prepare roasted corn according to package directions, reserving cotija cheese for serving. Set aside.
steps.1: Add ravioli to boiling water and cook 5 to 6 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, gently transfer ravioli to a colander to drain.
steps.2: Divide prepared corn among four plates, followed by ravioli. Drizzle with olive oil and garnish with reserved cotija cheese and cilantro, if using. Enjoy immediately.

301.title: Mushroom Miso Soup
301.description: If you've gone overboard with cheesy casseroles or creamy pastas in search of cold weather comfort food, let this reset recipe guide you back to balanced shores. Sauteed onion, crimini mushrooms, and tender bok choy are bathed in Trader Joe's Miso Broth, which boasts a triple-flavor-threat of miso, mushroom and ginger, and adds incredible depth and lip-smacking savory-ness to anything in its presence. The addition of Organic Sprouted Tofu in the last few minutes of cooking makes this soup ideal for a light lunch on its own (although you could always serve it in smaller portions as a first course!).

ingredients.0: 2 tablespoons TJ's Olive Oil
ingredients.5: 1 package TJ's Baby Bok Choy, rinsed and trimmed
ingredients.6: 1 package (16 oz.) TJ's Organic Extra Firm Sprouted Tofu, cut into bite-size pieces
ingredients.7: TJ's Sesame Oil & Soy Sauce, for garnish

steps.0: Heat a large pot over medium heat, add 2 tablespoons olive oil. When oil is hot, add onion and a pinch of salt. Saute onions for 3 minutes. Add mushrooms and stir. Saute 10-15 minutes, until mushrooms are browned and most of the water from the mushrooms has evaporated.
steps.1: Add broth to pot and bring to a boil. Add bok choy and reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for 5 minutes. Add tofu and cook another 2-3 minutes, just until heated through. Remove from heat and season to taste with salt. Ladle soup into large bowls, garnish with a splash of sesame oil and soy sauce, and enjoy!

302.title: Shawarma Chicken & Rice Soup
302.description: The aromatic marinade enveloping Trader Joe's Shawarma Chicken Thighs pulls double duty as a tenderizer and flavor booster in this well-spiced (but not spicy) take on classic chicken & rice soup. Built on a base of Trader Joe's Mirepoix, a convenient, chopped & ready-to-cook blend of carrots, celery & onion, this is a soup that tastes even better after a day in the fridge, where the spices can further intensify. Serve it alongside a crisp green salad and warm pita for a comforting winter meal.

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Shawarma Chicken Thighs
ingredients.4: 2 packages TJ's Organic Chicken Stock, plus 2 cups water

steps.0: Using a sharp knife, chop chicken into bite-size pieces. Transfer chicken to a paper towel-lined plate to blot some of the excess oil, set aside.
steps.1: Heat a large pot over medium heat, add 2 tablespoons olive oil. When oil is hot, add mirepoix and a pinch of salt. Saute until onions are translucent, 3-5 minutes. Add chicken, chicken stock, and water to pot and stir. Partially cover and simmer for about 30 minutes, until chicken is cooked through.
steps.2: Add rice, cumin, and 1 teaspoon salt to pot and stir. Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes more. Uncover, remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes. Skim excess oil and stir in lemon juice. Season soup to taste with salt. Ladle soup into large bowls and enjoy!

303.title: Simple Strip Steak & Sautéed Veggies
303.description: Inside each bag of Trader Joe's Organic Green Vegetable Foursome is a verdant vegetable blend of broccoli florets, shelled peas, trimmed French green beans, and tender zucchini quarters. The veggies are organically grown, blanched & gently cooked with organic garlic, onions, parsley, and savory spices.This process yields tender-crisp veggies that cook up perfectly when you get them home, and don't require further fussing to make them taste phenomenal. Add a crisp baguette, a strip steak, and a drizzle of zingy Trader Joe's Aioli Garlic Mustard Sauce, and you've got a simple, satisfying steak dinner for two.

ingredients.0: 1 TJ's All-Natural USDA Choice Premium Angus Beef New York Strip Steak
ingredients.2: TJ's Sea Salt & Black Pepper Grinders
ingredients.3: 1 bag TJ's Organic Green Vegetable Foursome
ingredients.4: TJ's Aioli Garlic Mustard Sauce OR Dijon Mustard

parsed_ing.0: All-Natural USDA Choice Premium Angus Beef New York Strip Steak

steps.0: Unwrap steak and season liberally with salt and pepper. Let rest for 30 minutes.
steps.1: Coat steak with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Heat a cast iron skillet over medium-high. Add steak to skillet and cook about 2 minutes per side, until the internal temperature reaches 120°F (this will take about 10 minutes, leaving you with a medium-rare steak after resting- if you prefer your steak medium, add a few more minutes of cook time and remove the steak when it reaches 130°F). Transfer steak to a plate to rest.
steps.2: Add vegetables to skillet and saute 4-5 minutes, until heated through. Use a slotted spoon to transfer vegetables to a serving platter. Slice steak and arrange atop vegetables. Serve with a generous drizzle of mustard sauce, garnish with parsley, and dig in!

304.title: Umami Turkey Burgers
304.description: Umami is the word used to describe the fifth taste - in addition to sweet, salty, sour, and bitter.
