Place sheet on center rack of oven and bake 20 minutes, or until the sauce begins to thicken. Remove sheet from oven and lightly sprinkle drumsticks with cashew pieces. Return sheet to oven and bake another 5 minutes or until the cashew pieces begin to brown and chicken reaches internal temperature of 165°F. Remove drumsticks from oven and let cool slightly. Serve over rice.

ingredients.0: TJ's Kalamata Olive Oil (for pan)
ingredients.2: 1 package TJ's Pork Carnitas, heated to package directions (substitute: cooked ground beef)
ingredients.3: 6 TJ's Green Onions, sliced, green tops preserved for garnish
ingredients.6: 1 package TJ's Corn Tortillas, cut into strips
ingredients.7: 1 package TJ's Mexican Shredded Cheese Blend

steps.0: Pre-heat the oven to 450°. Swab bottom of a baking dish (appx. 8" x8") with olive oil & a small amount of enchilada sauce; set aside. In a bowl, mix carnitas, green onions, jalapenos and 3 tbsp of sliced olives together with a small amount of enchilada sauce. Cover bottom of dish with a layer of tortilla strips. Top with half of carnitas mixture, followed by a small amount of sauce and about one-fourth of the cheese. Repeat second layer in the same order. Top second layer with strips of tortillas, remainder of sauce and remainder of cheese. Garnish with remainder of olives and green onion tops. Place in oven and bake until cheese is melted, the edges are browned and sauce is bubbly; about 20-30 minutes. Remove from oven and sit for 10 minutes before cutting. Top with slices of Avocado. WOW! Enjoy.

371.title: Chicken Breast Stuffed with Bacon 'n Feta

ingredients.0: 1 tub TJ's Crumbled Feta Cheese
ingredients.1: 1 package TJ's Uncured Bacon, cooked and crumbled
ingredients.2: 6 TJ's Boneless, Skinless Chicken Breasts, pounded flat
ingredients.3: 1 tbsp TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil
ingredients.4: 1 tsp (each) TJ's Dried Oregano, Dried Basil
ingredients.5: 1 can (28 oz.) TJ's Diced Tomatoes & Juice From Can
ingredients.6: Toothpicks or kitchen twine (or whatever you can find in your kitchen drawer)

steps.0: Combine feta and bacon in a mixing bowl. Place 1/4 cup of the cheese/bacon mixture on the center of each chicken breast. Fold breast over to enclose mixture; fasten with a toothpick or kitchen twine. Heat a large saute pan and add oil. Heat oil to medium and add stuffed breasts; turn breasts while cooking to brown on all sides. Add tomatoes and seasoning to pan. Lower heat to a simmer; cook about 15 - 20 minutes or until chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165°. Place chicken on a serving platter (remove toothpicks or twine) and spoon tomato sauce over.

ingredients.0: 3/4 pound TJ's Whole Wheat Pasta
ingredients.1: 2 slices TJ's Applewood Smoked Bacon, chopped
ingredients.5: 1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
ingredients.6: 1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste

steps.0: Cook pasta according to package directions & set aside. Saute bacon in pan until fat is rendered, about 1-2 minutes. Add apple, leek and thyme. Add salt and pepper; cook until tender, about five minutes. Add scallops and cook over high heat until just cooked, one to three minutes. Serve atop Trader Joe's Whole Wheat Pasta.

373.title: Queso Sonrisas, Ole'! Ole'! (Cheese Smiles, Hooray! Hooray!)

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Joe's Diner Mac n' Cheese or TJ's Gluten Free Mac & Cheese, cooked according to package instructions
ingredients.2: 3 pinches TJ's Mexican Shredded Cheese Blend (optional)

steps.0: In a medium bowl, mix mac n' cheese and salsa. Top with a sprinkle of cheese and sour cream for added flair (optional, but delicious).

374.title: Tropical Banana Bread
374.description: If we were to rename Trader Joe's Banana Bread Mix, we'd call it the Best Banana Bread Mix, Maybe Ever. Because it is. The secret to its sweet banana goodness? No surprise-it's banana. Or to be more accurate, dehydrated banana flakes. The flake format makes mixing so much easier, and ensures rich, ripe, consistent banana flavor in each loaf.While it makes a classic loaf prepared per the package instructions, this veritably versatile, undoubtedly delicious Mix is amenable to all manner of mix-ins-walnuts, chocolate chips, dried fruit, more banana... In this decidedly more tropical take, on a banana bread recipe, we've added organic coconut and chopped candied ginger to the batter before baking.

ingredients.0: TJ's Coconut Oil Spray or Canola Oil Spray
ingredients.2: 1/2 cup TJ's Organic Unsweetened Flake Coconut
ingredients.3: 1/3 cup finely chopped TJ's Uncrystallized Candied Ginger Pieces
ingredients.5: 3/4 cup canned TJ's Organic Coconut Milk
ingredients.8: TJ's Creamy Peanut Butter, melted (optional, for garnish)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a loaf pan with coconut oil spray, set aside.
steps.1: Add banana bread mix, coconut and chopped ginger to a large bowl and stir to combine. Set aside. In a medium bowl, whisk eggs, coconut milk, banana and sunflower oil. Fold wet mixture into dry mixture just until combined. Pour batter into prepared pan and smooth top.
steps.2: Bake on center rack of oven for 50 minutes, until loaf is dark golden brown and firm to the touch. Remove from oven and let cool before slicing.
steps.3: Optional garnish: Slice an additional banana into coins and place on top of the batter in the loaf pan before baking.
steps.4: After the banana bread is cooled, slightly heat creamy peanut butter and drizzle it over the slices.

375.title: Strawberry Champagne Cake
375.description: Nothing says romance like couple of strawberries fizzing away in a flute of Champagne! (Actually, we can think of several other things that ‘say' romance-a dozen roses, a slow dance under the stars, a "don't worry; I'll do the dishes"-but we digress...) We took our taste for Champs n' berries to the Trader Joe's test kitchen and came up with a recipe for boozy, berrylicious Strawberry Champagne Cake that we can sign our name on. Literally.

ingredients.0: 1 stick (1/2 cup) TJ's Unsalted Butter, melted
ingredients.2: 1 cup RSVP Brut Sparkling Wine or your favorite Champagne, room tempature
ingredients.3: 1 package TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix
ingredients.4: 1 stick (1/2 cup) TJ's Unsalted Butter, softened
ingredients.5: 1 3/4 cup TJ's Organic Powdered Sugar, sifted
ingredients.9: 1/8 cup TJ's Organic Strawberry Fruit Spread
ingredients.10: 1 package TJ's Freeze Dried Strawberries, pulverized

steps.0: Cake:
steps.1: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8x8" baking pan with butter, set aside.
steps.2: In a medium bowl, combine eggs, melted butter, and sparkling wine. Add cake mix. Whisk together until batter is smooth.
steps.3: Spread batter in pan, filling corners and leveling top.
steps.4: Place on the center rack in oven and bake for 40 - 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Remove from oven. Let cool and remove from pan.
steps.5: Frosting:
steps.6: While cake is cooling, make buttercream frosting.
steps.7: Add butter to a stand mixer fitted with a paddle (a hand mixer will work, too) and beat at medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Add sugar, salt, cream, and vanilla; mix at low speed until just combined. To fully incorporate all of the sugar, stop mixer as needed and scrape down sides of bowl with a rubber spatula.
steps.8: Increase speed to high and mix until smooth and fluffy, about 3 to 5 minutes.
steps.9: Add strawberry spread and mix until just combined.
steps.11: Pulverize freeze-dried strawberries in a food processor or thoroughly crush by hand; set aside.
steps.12: Using an offset spatula or frosting knife, spread buttercream frosting into an even layer on top of the cooled cake.
steps.13: Carefully spoon pulverized freeze-dried strawberries over top of cake until completely covered, gently spreading & pressing them into the frosting as you go.
steps.15: Optional Stenciling: Draw (or trace) desired shapes & letters onto a piece of paper. Cut them out. Arrange on top of frosted cake and press into place lightly.
steps.16: Spoon pulverized strawberries over frosting very slowly, keeping spoon within close range of cake and spreading/pressing the strawberries in place as you go. Once top of cake is covered in a thick, even layer, peel paper stencils off cake. Voila!

376.title: Chocolate Truffles
376.description: Cookies, berries, and coffee-oh, my! What Trader Joe's provisions will you pulverize for your Chocolate Truffles? We rolled ours in finely ground Vanilla Joe-Joe's, Freeze-Dried Strawberries, Instant Coffee, and Pistachios, but you're more than welcome to improvise... Let this easy-peasy Truffle recipe be your guide!

ingredients.0: 1/2 bar TJ's Pound Plus Dark Chocolate
ingredients.3: 2 packets TJ's Instant Coffee Packets All Dressed Up with Creamer & Sugar
ingredients.5: 1/2 bag TJ's Dry Roasted & Salted Pistachio Nutmeats

parsed_ing.3: Instant Coffee Packets All Dressed Up with Creamer & Sugar

steps.0: Chop the chocolate finely with a sharp, serrated knife. Place in a small, heatproof mixing bowl.
steps.1: Heat the cream in a small saucepan, just until it starts to boil. Remove from heat immediately and pour over the chopped chocolate. Let the mixture sit for 30 seconds, then add vanilla extract and carefully whisk together until the chocolate is completely melted. *
steps.2: Set aside in the fridge for one hour, or until chocolate mixture is solid but still easy to scoop.
steps.3: One at a time, crush dried strawberries, pistachios, and Joe-Joe's in a food processor (separately, not together) until each topping reaches a finely ground, powdered consistency. Place the three different powders in separate piles on a flat surface, with some space between them. Open the instant coffee packets and pour powdered contents into a pile on the same flat surface.
steps.4: With a melon baller, scoop round balls of the chilled chocolate mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
steps.5: Roll each dollop of chocolate in hands to make a smooth, round ball.
steps.6: Roll each ball of chocolate in the finely ground topping of your choice; depending on the size of your truffles, you will have enough for either four, five, or six of each flavor.
steps.7: Serve at room temperature and enjoy.
steps.8: *Note: If chocolate does not completely melt, place bowl in the microwave in 15-second increments, stirring in between, until chocolate is fully melted.

377.title: Peanut Butter Cup Brownies
377.description: Do you like warm, chocolaty brownies? What about gooey, melted peanut butter cups? If that's a ‘yes' to both, then this one's for you! (And if that's a ‘no' to either, then frankly we're confused, but we digress...) Enjoy this classic, easy-bake recipe from the Trader Joe's vault, starring two of our most enduring dessert darlings: Trader Joe's Truffle Brownie Mix and Trader Joe's Dark Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups.

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Truffle Brownie Mix
ingredients.3: 1 container TJ's Peanut Butter Cups, unwrapped

steps.0: Preheat the oven to 350°.
steps.1: Prepare brownies according to package instructions.
steps.2: Remove brownies from oven and press half of the the peanut butter cups, bottoms down, into the warm brownies making rows that cover the top of the brownies entirely. Place brownies back into the oven for one to two minutes, or until the peanut butter cups soften. Use a spatula or knife to spread softened peanut butter cups into a gooey frosting over the brownies .
steps.3: Optional: chop the rest of the peanut butter cups in half, then press them into the already-melted "frosting" or use as garnish.
steps.4: Allow to cool (if you can). Enjoy!

378.title: Panettone & Egg Nog Bread Pudding
378.description: Could you even imagine the holidays at Trader Joe's without pyramids of Panettone in our stores? We certainly can't! This light, moist, & elegantly sweet fruitcake-in-a-big-red-box has been calling Trader Joe's its home for the holidays for nearly 20 years! Here, we've combined it with our Egg Nog-another holiday classic-for a two-ingredient bread pudding to beat the band...

ingredients.0: 1 package (26.5 oz) TJ's Panettone

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 9 x 13 baking pan (or casserole dish) with butter or cooking spray; set aside.
steps.1: Remove panettone from packaging and chop into approx. 1-inch cubes.
steps.2: Place cut panettone in a large bowl and pour egg nog over the bread. Toss together until egg nog is mostly absorbed.
steps.3: Pour mixture into the greased pan and bake for about 40 minutes, or until liquid thickens and center is set.
steps.4: Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Serve warm and enjoy!
steps.5: Recipe Credit: Our excellent Crew Member Mandi at store #136 in Vancouver, WA!

379.title: Chocolate Mint Star Brownies
379.description: When you wish upon a Trader Joe's Mini Dark Chocolate Mint Star... You get Chocolate Mint Star Brownies! Inspired by everyone's favorite five-pointed, dark chocolate-covered, chocolate-mint shortbread cookies, we really aimed for the stars with this super-simple, extra-rich recipe-and we're pretty positive we got there. "O, these are the star-spangled Brownies we crave..."

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Mini Dark Chocolate Mint Stars (seasonal), divided in half
ingredients.1: 1 package TJ's Brownie Truffle Baking Mix

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8 x 8 x 2 baking pan with butter or cooking spray and set aside.
steps.1: Chop roughly 1/2 package of the cookies into pieces and set aside.
steps.2: Melt butter until creamy-looking (approx. 1 minute in microwave or 5 minutes in saucepan over medium heat).
steps.3: Whisk eggs into melted butter until blended.
steps.4: Add brownie mix and stir until moistened. Mix in chopped cookies.
steps.5: Spread batter in pan, filling corners and leveling top.
steps.6: Bake for 25 - 30 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean. Allow to cool for 30 minutes before removing from pan.
steps.7: Once cooled, cut brownies into squares. Using a butter knife, spread an even layer of fudge sauce on top of each brownie. Place remaining cookies on top of each brownie to decorate.

380.title: No-Bake Peanut Butter Chocolate Crisp Rice Cereal Treats
380.description: Everyone already knows the magic of mixing our Organic Crisp Rice Cereal with marshmallows... But what about the magnificent, mouthwatering magic of mixing it with peanut butter? Or chocolate? Or BOTH? We think you'll find this recipe arguably even easier-no baking involved!-and the results are definitely just as delicious...

ingredients.0: 1 cup TJ's Organic Brown Sugar
ingredients.1: 1 cup TJ's Organic Raw Blue Agave Syrup
ingredients.2: 1 cup TJ's Organic Creamy Peanut Butter (salted style suggested)
ingredients.3: 7 cups TJ's Organic Crisp Rice Cereal

steps.0: Combine brown sugar and blue agave syrup in saucepan and bring to a near boil, stirring often. Continue stirring until brown sugar dissolves. Remove from heat.
steps.1: Add peanut butter to mixture. Mix well. Add Organic Crisp Rice Cereal. Mix well. If desired, add chocolate chips, then mix well again.
steps.2: Press the mixture into 13 x 9 x 2-inch greased baking pan. Refrigerate for several hours to cool and harden. To harden more quickly, place in freezer for about an hour.
steps.3: Remove from pan and cut into squares. Enjoy!

381.title: Peppermint S'mores Cake
381.description: S'mores aren't just a summertime treat. When combined with peppermint & chocolate-a classic holiday flavor combo-they're a wintertime treat, too! What are you waiting for? Deck the halls & preheat the oven, because this moist-cake-meets-chewy-melted-marshmallow dessert is about make your holiday season even brighter...

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Oil Spray
ingredients.1: 1 cup TJ's Honey Graham Crackers, crumbed
ingredients.3: 2 sticks (1 cup) TJ's Unsalted Butter, melted and divided
ingredients.6: 1 package TJ's Chocolate Peppermint Loaf & Baking Mix (seasonal)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 9x11-inch baking pan with canola oil spray, set aside.
steps.1: In a medium mixing bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and one stick (1/2 cup) of melted butter. Mix until combined. Press mixture into an even layer on the bottom of the greased pan.
steps.2: In a medium bowl mix egg, water, and the rest of the melted butter to combine. Add baking mix and stir, just until batter comes together. Pour batter in the pan on top of the crust and spread into an even layer, completely covering the crust.
steps.3: Bake on the middle rack of the over for about 40 - 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.
steps.4: Remove cake from oven, leaving oven on. Arrange marshmallows in a single layer on top of the cake, completely covering its surface. Place back in oven for about 5 minutes, or until marshmallows begin to brown on top. (For an extra-crisp top layer, toast the marshmallows with a kitchen torch after the cake comes out of the oven.)
steps.5: Let cool completely. Remove from pan and enjoy!

382.title: Mango Melba Shortcake
382.description: If Dame Nellie Melba had known about mangos, she would have asked Chef Escoffier to make the dessert with this luscious tropical fruit instead of peaches... well, at least we think so!

ingredients.0: 1 jar TJ's Organic Reduced Sugar Raspberry Preserves
ingredients.1: 1 bag TJ's Organic Frozen Mango Chunks, thawed
ingredients.2: 1 package TJ's Buttermilk Biscuits, baked and cooled
ingredients.4: TJ's Super Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream

parsed_ing.4: Super Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream

steps.0: In a small sauce pan, over low heat, heat the jam until syrupy. Fold in mango chunks and remove from heat.
steps.1: Split biscuits in half, spread whipped cream on the bottom half and fill with mango mixture.
steps.2: Top with a scoop of ice cream.

383.title: Charlotte's Chocolate Bread Pudding
383.description: Trader Joe's Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips are a sweet baking essential that can be added to all manner of desserts for a boost of chocolatey goodness. With a rich, smooth flavor falling somewhere between milk and dark chocolate, they really shine in this delectable chocolate bread pudding recipe, forming a creamy chocolate custard which is used to soak pieces of crisp French baguette, and then the whole thing is baked to gooey perfection. This unbelievably easy recipe is sure to up your dessert game and impress anyone who takes a bite. Topping the finished pudding with whipped cream is not required (but highly encouraged).

ingredients.0: TJ's Unsalted Butter, to grease pan
ingredients.2: 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons TJ's Organic Cane Sugar
ingredients.5: 1 teaspoon TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
ingredients.6: 4 cups cubed TJ's French Baguette (about half of a baguette)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 325°F. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan with butter, set aside.
steps.1: Add cream and 1/2 cup sugar to a heavy-bottomed saucepan and bring to a gentle simmer, stirring until sugar dissolves.  Remove from heat and whisk in 1 cup chocolate chips until melted and smooth, set aside.
steps.2: In a large mixing bowl, whisk egg and vanilla.  Gradually whisk in cooled chocolate mixture. Let chocolate custard mixture cool for 10 minutes, stirring often.
steps.3: Fold bread cubes and remaining chocolate chips into chocolate custard.  Transfer mixture to baking pan and sprinkle with remaining sugar.
steps.4: Bake pan on center rack of oven for 50 minutes, until custard thickens and center is set. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Serve warm with whipped cream, if desired.

384.title: Pumpkin Bars
384.description: One of our favorite things about Trader Joe's Pumpkin Bread & Muffin Mix is the way the subtle flavor of the pumpkin is perfectly complemented by the zesty additions of spices like cinnamon and nutmeg. Second to that fantastic flavor is its ease of use: Follow the package instructions and you'll get a loaf of moist and fluffy, lightly spiced pumpkin bread, or a dozen standard-sized muffins, every time. But if you're seeking something even more dessert-y, say, for an after-dinner treat or booster club bake sale, you can follow the recipe below for a pumpkin bar of sorts that's decidedly more "brownie" in texture than "bread." The sweet, sour cream topping is by no means required, but will make these bars all the more delicious.

ingredients.0: 2 Large TJ's Eggs
ingredients.1: 1 stick TJ's Unsalted Butter, melted and cooled
ingredients.2: 1 box TJ's Pumpkin Bread & Muffin Mix (seasonal)
ingredients.6: 1/2 teaspoon TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan with canola oil spray, set aside.
steps.1: In a medium bowl, whisk eggs. Slowly add butter, whisking to incorporate. Add pumpkin bread mix, sugar and water to bowl. Fold together with a spatula just until combined. Transfer batter to prepared baking pan, smoothing into an even layer (batter will be sticky).
steps.2: Bake on center rack of oven for about 35 minutes, until top is a dark golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and let cool completely on cooling rack before slicing.
steps.3: In a small bowl, whisk sour cream and vanilla. Add powdered sugar and continue whisking until combined. Cover and refrigerate.
steps.4: To serve, slice into squares and top with a dollop of sour cream topping. Sprinkle with pumpkin pie spice, if desired, and serve.

385.title: Baked Apples
385.description: There's a reason dates are often called "nature's candy," and that has everything to do with the natural sweetness and intensely satisfying flavor they deliver. Trader Joe's Chopped Medjool Dates are the star in this simple, stuffed baked apple dessert, alongside brown sugar, chopped pecans, butter, and spices. In addition to being a seriously comforting, cold-weather dessert, this recipe's warm, spiced aromas will make your kitchen smell amazing, too!

ingredients.0: 1 bag (2 pounds) TJ's Honeycrisp Apples
ingredients.2: 1/3 cup TJ's Gluten Free Rolled Oats
ingredients.4: 1/3 cup TJ's Unsalted Dry Toasted Pecan Pieces
ingredients.5: 1 teaspoon TJ's Pumpkin Pie Spice (seasonal) or TJ's Ground Cinnamon

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Core apples using an apple corer or sharp paring knife, making sure all of the hard core and seeds are scooped out. Set aside.
steps.1: In a medium-sized mixing bowl, combine dates, pecans, brown sugar, oats, pumpkin pie spice, and softened butter. Stuff cored apples with the date mixture, making sure to completely fill the hole left from the core.
steps.2: Place stuffed apples in a 9 x 13-inch baking dish and pour spiced cider into the bottom of the dish. Cover with aluminum foil and bake on center rack of oven for 30 minutes. Remove foil and continue to bake for an additional 10-20 minutes, or until apples are easily pierced with a fork.
steps.3: Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Serve warm as-is, or alongside a scoop of Trader Joe's Super Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream.

386.title: Berry Crazy Sundae
386.description: Made with super-sweet Thai strawberries enrobed in luscious dark chocolate, Trader Joe's Gone Berry Crazy Chocolate Covered Strawberry Slices capture the sweetness of summer in bite-size treat form. Ready to eat right out of the box (you don't even need to defrost them!), there's nothing standing between you and dessert. And if you somehow manage not  to eat the whole box on your way home from the store, we recommend using them to top a sundae with TJ's Super Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream and Belgian Butter Waffle Cookies.

ingredients.0: TJ's Super Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream
ingredients.1: TJ's Gone Berry Crazy Chocolate Covered Strawberry Slices
ingredients.2: TJ's Organic Midnight Moo Chocolate Flavored Syrup

parsed_ing.0: Super Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream
parsed_ing.1: Gone Berry Crazy Chocolate Covered Strawberry Slices
parsed_ing.2: Organic Midnight Moo Chocolate Flavored Syrup

steps.0: Scoop your desired amount of ice cream into a bowl. Top with chocolate covered strawberry slices, drizzle generously with midnight moo, and garnish with waffle cookies. Enjoy!

387.title: Preposterously Peanut Butter Cup Cookies
387.description: Trader Joe's Creamy Salted Peanut Butter is simple, and simply scrumptious. There are just two ingredients inside every jar: peanuts from the southeastern United States, and salt. That is all. However, with just a few more ingredients (and this handy recipe), you can take peanut butter from simply scrumptious to downright droolworthy. Here, we've turned the classic peanut butter cookie on its head by enveloping the dough around our customers' favorite Trader Joe's Dark Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups before baking. The result is an ooey-gooey, sweet-salty cookie treat that's not to be missed. Be sure to have an ice-cold glass of milk or your favorite non-dairy beverage handy when these come out of the oven!

ingredients.0: 2 cups (1 jar) TJ's Creamy Salted Peanut Butter, stirred
ingredients.1: 2 cup TJ's Organic Cane Sugar, plus more for rolling cookies
ingredients.4: 2 teaspoons TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
ingredients.5: 16 TJ's Dark Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups, wrappers removed

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper, set aside. Pour a bit of sugar on a shallow plate for rolling cookies, set aside.
steps.1: In a large bowl, mix peanut butter, sugar, eggs, baking soda, and vanilla until combined. Take a large scoop of cookie dough, place peanut butter cup in the center and pat dough closed around the cup to form a dough ball. Roll dough ball in sugar and place on prepared baking sheet. Repeat with remaining ingredients until you have 8 dough balls per baking sheet.
steps.2: Bake sheets, one at a time, on center rack of oven for about 13 minutes, until golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring cookies to cooling racks. Cookies are best enjoyed warm!

388.title: Cocoa Almond Crêpe Wafer Cookies
388.description: Trader Joe's Crêpe Wafer Cookies are made following an authentic French recipe that was allegedly kept secret for years. Our supplier carefully folds dozens of extra-thin, extra-delicate layers of all-butter dough on top of one another multiple times over, then cuts the multilayered dough into triangles and bakes them to crisp perfection. The result is a batch of unique, fan-shaped Cookies that taste a bit like a cross between an actual crêpe and a homemade warm-vanilla waffle cone, and that eat a bit like a croissant-another extra-buttery, light-and-flaky French specialty that we know & love.While these Crêpe Wafer Cookies have been known to incite "Yums!" of crunchy delight served solo, they're also excellent served alongside ice cream, coffee, sliced fruit, freshly whipped cream, pudding...

ingredients.0: 1 jar TJ's Cocoa Almond Spread
ingredients.2: 2 TJ's Bananas, peeled & sliced into coins

steps.0: Transfer 4 or 5 heaping spoonfuls of cocoa almond spread to a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on half-power for 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until melted.
steps.1: Divide cookies among 4 shallow serving bowls. Top each with banana coins, followed by drizzles of cocoa almond spread. Enjoy immediately.

389.title: Neapolitan Joe-Joe Truffles
389.description: Trader Joe's Neapolitan Joe-Joe's, like all our Joe-Joe's, consist of a creme filling sandwiched between two wafers-but what makes these sandwich-creme cookies truly unique among our Joe-Joe's options is that each cookie component presents a different flavor. The dark brown wafer is cocoa-flavored, while the golden wafer tastes like vanilla. Between the wafers is a layer of strawberry-flavored creme that includes flecks of freeze-dried strawberries. While we consider Neapolitan Joe-Joe's to be cosmopolitan cookies in their own right, we're always up for some sweet experimentation. In this recipe, we blend them with velvety cream cheese, then coat the cookie mixture in deep, dark chocolate to create rich truffles that are packed with Neapolitan Joe-Joe flavor.

ingredients.0: 1 box TJ's Neapolitan Joe-Joe's (limited)
ingredients.2: 1 TJ's Pound Plus 72% Dark Chocolate Bar

steps.0: Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper, set aside. Add cookies to the bowl of a food processor. Pulse 10-15 times until you have fairly uniform crumbs. Transfer two handfuls of crumbs to a small bowl, set aside.
steps.1: Unwrap cream cheese, break into pieces and add to food processor. Process cookies and cream cheese 10-20 seconds, until thoroughly combined. Use a small cookie scoop or two teaspoons to form mixture into small balls and place them on the prepared cookie sheet (these will be the "insides" of your truffles). Cover and freeze at least 2 hours, or overnight.
steps.2: Remove cookie balls from freezer, set aside. Break up the chocolate bar into small pieces. Add 1/3 of the chocolate to a large, microwave-safe bowl or measuring cup. Microwave on half-power for 30 second intervals, stirring in between, until most of chocolate is melted. Use a fork to stir and smooth out any lumps.
steps.3: Gently place a prepared cookie ball in the melted chocolate. Use a spoon to cover completely with chocolate, then lift the truffle out of the bowl with a fork to drain any excess. Place truffle back on baking sheet and sprinkle with reserved cookie crumbs. Repeat with remaining ingredients, melting more chocolate in batches as needed. Return cookie sheet to freezer for 15 minutes or until chocolate is set.
steps.4: Enjoy truffles immediately, or keep refrigerated until ready to serve.

390.title: Marshmallow Blondies
390.description: Shaped like a brownie and with the same craveably chewy texture, the Blondies prepared with a box of Trader Joe's Blondie Bar Mix also possess the brown sugary goodness of your favorite chocolate chip cookie. Irresistible on their own, they're an excellent stand-in for graham crackers in this chocolatey, gooey, bakery-style take on s'mores, just in time for summer.

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Oil Spray
ingredients.4: 1 box TJ's Blondie Bar Baking Mix
ingredients.5: 2-1.75 oz bars Trader Joe's Milk Chocolate, roughly chopped

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8X8-inch baking pan with canola oil spray, set aside. Using a pair of clean kitchen scissors, cut marshmallows into quarters, set aside.
steps.1: In a large mixing bowl, slowly whisk melted butter into egg. Gently fold in blondie bar mix just until combined, followed by marshmallows and chocolate. Spread blondie mixture evenly into greased pan.
steps.2: Place pan on center rack of oven and bake until blondies are deep golden brown, about 30-33 minutes. (Marshmallows will puff up-don't fret! They'll sink back down as they cool.) Remove pan from oven and let cool completely on a wire rack prior to slicing and serving.

391.title: Nutty Monkey Banana Bites
391.description: What's better than a frosty handful of Trader Joe's Gone Bananas? How about Gone Bananas dipped in creamy, salted peanut butter and topped with flaked coconut?

ingredients.0: 1 box TJ's Gone Bananas

steps.0: Remove Gone Bananas from package and arrange on a serving platter. Use a spoon to dollop peanut butter on each piece. Sprinkle a pinch of coconut on the peanut butter. Enjoy promptly!

392.title: Chewy Chocolate Mochi Cake
392.description: Inspired by Hawaii's classic butter mochi, Trader Joe's Mochi Cake Mix starts with a base of sweet rice flour. This glutinous flour is the key to creating that delightfully chewy, almost bouncy texture that mochi admirers know and love, while the addition of sugar and coconut milk powder add delightful sweetness. Prepare this Mochi Cake Mix per the box directions, and you'll be rewarded with a gluten free, sweet, buttery, golden yellow treat, with notes of vanilla and a satisfying chew. Motivated to experiment with your Mochi Cake? Add some matcha powder or a handful of blueberries to the Mix. Use coconut milk in place of the water and garnish the batter with shredded coconut before baking. Or go for the ultimate in chocolaty goodness as we've done here, with TJ's Unsweetened Cocoa Powder and plenty of Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips...

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Oil Spray or Coconut Oil Spray

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan with canola oil spray, set aside.
steps.1: In a large bowl, whisk cake mix and water until smooth. Add butter, eggs, and cocoa powder, whisk until smooth. Stir in chocolate chips.
steps.2: Pour batter into greased pan. Bake on center rack of oven for 45-50 minutes, or until the cake begins to pull away from the sides of the pan. Remove from oven and place on cooling rack for 15-20 minutes prior to slicing.

393.title: Baked Banana Pudding
393.description: In this recipe, the classic banana pudding gets a salty-sweet twist, thanks to the addition of Trader Joe's Fleur de Sel Caramel Sauce. Spectacularly sweet and fit to feed a crowd, serve it warm out of the oven for the ultimate in gooey banana goodness; should you have any leftovers, simply refrigerate and enjoy cold the next day.

ingredients.0: 1 cup TJ's Organic Brown Sugar
ingredients.1: 1 cup TJ's Organic Cane Sugar, divided
ingredients.6: 1/2 stick (4 tablespoons) TJ's Salted Butter, plus an extra pat
ingredients.7: 2 teaspoons TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
ingredients.8: 1 bag TJs Organic Vanilla Wafer Cookies
ingredients.10: TJs Fleur de Sel Caramel Sauce
ingredients.11: 1/4 teaspoon juice from a TJ's Lemon

steps.0: In a medium saucepan over medium-low heat, whisk brown sugar, half of cane sugar, flour, salt, egg yolks and milk. Cook the mixture, whisking continually to keep from scorching, 10 to 15 minutes or until thickened. Remove pan from heat, add butter and vanilla, and stir until butter is completely melted. Allow custard to cool completely.
steps.1: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 2 1/2 quart baking dish with a pat of butter. Arrange vanilla wafers in a single layer on bottom and sides of the baking dish. Arrange banana slices in a single layer atop wafers. Repeat alternating layers with remaining wafers and bananas. Drop spoonfuls of caramel sauce over bananas. Pour the cooled custard atop the caramel sauce; set aside.
steps.2: Add room temperature egg whites and lemon juice to a glass or nonreactive metal bowl of a stand mixer and whip with the whisk attachment until frothy. Add remaining cane sugar 1 tablespoon at a time, beating well after each addition, until peaks form. (Rub a bit of the beaten meringue between your thumb and forefinger to make sure sugar has dissolved; it should not feel gritty.) Use a spatula to quickly spread meringue evenly over the banana pudding.
steps.3: Place banana pudding on a large rimmed baking sheet. Bake on center rack of oven about 20 minutes, or until the top of the meringue is toasted. Remove from oven and let cool 10-15 minutes before serving.

394.title: Strawberry Icebox Cake
394.description: Trader Joe's Organic Vanilla Wafer Cookies are light, crumbly, and altogether craveable. Organic natural vanilla flavor and other natural flavors contribute to their namesake vanilla aroma, buoyed by the sweetness of organic sugar. And unlike other vanilla wafer cookies on the market that are made with palm oil, these Vanilla Wafer Cookies are made with organic cultured butter, lending rich, buttery flavor and a golden-yellow glow to each bite. Irresistible right out of the bag, these Cookies are equally excellent when used as the base of a trifle or pie crust. Or, layer them with fluffy whipped cream and sweet strawberries in this easy, no-bake recipe for icebox cake!

ingredients.0: 1 bag TJ's Organic Vanilla Wafer Cookies
ingredients.1: 1 pound TJ's Strawberries, rinsed and dried
ingredients.3: 1 teaspoon TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
ingredients.5: 3/4 cup TJ's Organic Powdered Sugar, divided
ingredients.6: Zest of 1 TJ's Lemon, for garnish (optional)

steps.0: Set aside a handful of cookies and 3-4 large strawberries for garnish. Hull and chop remaining strawberries and place in a medium bowl.  Gently fold in 1/4 cup powdered sugar. Set aside and let berries macerate in their juices.
steps.1: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment (or, using a hand mixer), whip the heavy cream at medium-high speed until peaks form. Add mascarpone, vanilla and 1/2 cup of powdered sugar and whip until the mascarpone cheese is evenly blended into cream, stopping to scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed.
steps.2: Arrange a single layer of cookies on the bottom of an 8-inch square baking pan. Break a few more cookies and fill the open spots in the pan so it is mostly covered.
steps.3: Spread 1/3 of the whipped cream mixture evenly atop the wafers. Top whipped cream with 1/2 of the strawberries. Create one more layer of cookies, followed by 1/3 of the whipped cream and the remaining strawberries. Top with the remaining whipped cream. Cover and refrigerate for several hours, or up to a day before serving.
steps.4: Just before serving, halve the remaining cookies, and hull and chop the remaining strawberries. Garnish cake with cookies and strawberries, followed by a shower of lemon zest, if using. Serve immediately.

395.title: Butter Toffee Pretzel Bark
395.description: Combining the sweetness of sugary toffee with the saltiness of oh-so-snackable mini-pretzels (and elevating them to the power of their combined crunchiness), Trader Joe's Butter Toffee Pretzels are the star of the show in this recipe for chocolate marshmallow bark. Make a batch for the neighbors and one for yourself-you'll be happy you did.

ingredients.0: 1 bar TJ's Pound Plus Milk Chocolate, broken into chunks
ingredients.1: 1 1/2 cups TJ's Butter Toffee Pretzels (seasonal), divided

steps.0: Line a quarter-sheet rimmed baking pan with parchment paper. Spread 1 cup pretzels and 1 cup marshmallows in an even layer in pan, set aside.
steps.1: Fill a sauce pot half-full with water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to allow the water to simmer. Rest a large stainless bowl over the top of the pan, making sure that the bottom of the bowl does not touch the water. Add chocolate to the top bowl and stir occasionally as chocolate melts, until it becomes smooth. Turn off heat.
steps.2: Pour melted chocolate over lined pan, using a spatula to smooth it evenly across pretzels and marshmallows. Top melted chocolate with remaining pretzels and marshmallows. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Remove from refrigerator and let sit 15 minutes before slicing.

396.title: Egg Nog Cake with Rum Buttercream Frosting
396.description: To satisfy your nascent nog needs, we have Trader Joe's Egg Nog and Light Egg Nog (90% less fat and 40% fewer calories than the original), both of which are perfectly pleasing on their own or with the traditional splash of rum (vodka or whiskey works here, too, for the rum-averse). Its velvety texture and nutmeg-forward flavor makes it especially excellent as a replacement for milk when preparing TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix. Go the extra holiday mile and infuse the nog-based buttercream frosting on top with TJ's Rum Of The Gods.

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Oil Spray
ingredients.3: 1/2 cup (1 stick) TJ's Unsalted Butter, melted
ingredients.4: 1 box TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix
ingredients.8: 2 teaspoons TJ's Rum of the Gods
ingredients.11: Handful TJ's Roasted & Salted Pecan Halves, for garnish (optional)

steps.0: Prepare the cake: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8-inch pan with canola oil spray and set aside.
steps.1: In a large mixing bowl, combine egg nog, eggs, and melted butter. Add cake mix and nutmeg, and stir until batter is smooth. Spread cake batter into greased pan. Bake on center rack of oven for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and allow to cool 10 minutes. Invert cake onto a cooling rack and remove pan; allow to cool completely before frosting (you can hasten the cooling process by placing the cake in the freezer for 10-15 minutes).
steps.2: Prepare the frosting: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment (or using a hand mixer in a large bowl), beat powdered sugar, butter, rum, and 2 tablespoons of egg nog on low speed until combined (add more egg nog if necessary to achieve desired texture). Add sea salt and beat on medium speed until smooth.
steps.3: Assemble cake: Transfer cooled cake to a serving platter. Frost generously and top with pecans, if desired. Slice and enjoy!

397.title: Pumpkin Pie Milkshake
397.description: Like Pi itself, this milkshake recipe is truly transcendental. The spiced custardy pie filling and tender, buttery crumb of Trader Joe's Pumpkin Pie are whirled at a furious pace with Trader Joe's Super Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream and milk, then topped with fluffy clouds of whipped cream and more pie crust crumbles. The recipe makes enough for two shakes, but we won't blame you if you don't want to share.

ingredients.0: 1/3 TJ's Pumpkin Pie, broken into pieces (reserve some of the crust edges for garnish)
ingredients.2: 4-5 scoops TJ's Super Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream

parsed_ing.2: Super Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream

steps.0: Place two glasses in the freezer to chill. Add pie, milk, and ice cream to a blender pitcher. Cover and pulse ingredients together on low to combine, then blend on high until smooth and uniform. Remove glasses from freezer. Pour milkshake into glasses and garnish with whipped cream and reserved pie crust. Enjoy!

398.title: Chocolate Dipped Pumpkin Pie Bites
398.description: How do you make Trader Joe's Pumpkin Pie even better? Dip it in chocolate, of course! The dark, rich flavors of Trader Joe's Pound Plus 72% Dark Chocolate Bar lend a welcome contrast to the sweetly spiced pie, while the addition of sliced almonds and crushed Sweet & Spicy Pecans add craveable crunch. (Pro tip: freezing the pie for an hour before you slice and dip makes for much easier prep work!)

ingredients.0: 1/2 of a TJ's Pound Plus 72% Dark Chocolate Bar, broken into pieces
ingredients.1: 1 TJ's Pumpkin Pie, frozen for 1 hour
ingredients.2: Crunchy garnish of your choice: Sea Salt, Sliced Almonds, Sweet & Spicy Pecans, Pistachios, Sunflower Seeds...

parsed_ing.2: of your choice: Sea Salt, Sliced Almonds, Sweet & Spicy Pecans, Pistachios, Sunflower Seeds...

corrected_ing.2: Sea Salt, Sliced Almonds, Sweet & Spicy Pecans, Pistachios, Sunflower Seeds.

steps.0: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside. Add chocolate to a microwave-safe dish. Microwave on high for 1-minute intervals, stirring in between, until melted and smooth.
steps.1: Remove pie from freezer. Gently remove pie tin and place pie on a clean work surface. Use a sharp knife to slice pie into 1-inch cubes.
steps.2: Using a fork, dip a pie bite into melted chocolate. Allow excess chocolate to drip back into dish, and place bite on prepared parchment. Sprinkle with crunchy toppings before chocolate hardens. Repeat process with remaining bites. Enjoy immediately, or refrigerate up to 3 hours before serving.

399.title: Maple Spiced Whipped Cream
399.description: How you dress your pie is almost as important as the pie itself. This whipped cream recipe is tasty with Trader Joe's Pumpkin Pie, of course, but would also be incredible atop a slice of Trader Joe's Pancake Bread or Trader Joe's Vegan Banana Bread. (And if you really want to spice things up, add a pinch of cayenne to offset the sweet, velvety cream-you'll be glad you did!)

ingredients.0: 1 cup TJ's Heavy Whipping Cream
ingredients.1: 5-6 teaspoons your favorite TJ's Maple Syrup

steps.0: Pour whipping cream into a large bowl. Using a hand mixer or whisk, whip until soft peaks form. Fold in syrup and cinnamon. Serve with pumpkin pie, scones, coffee, muffins, ice cream...

400.title: Coconut Cream Pie
400.description: Rich, dense, and buttery, Trader Joe's Gluten Free Pie Crust comes already formed in its very own tin, so all you have to do is bake it, allow it to cool, and fill it with whatever mouth-watering filling you desire, like velvety coconut cream. This recipe makes enough to fill one pie crust, and then some-pour the extra filling into ramekins and chill for a luxurious single-serve dessert.

ingredients.0: 1 cup TJ's Organic Unsweetened Flake Coconut, divided
ingredients.3: 2 tablespoons TJ's Gluten Free All-Purpose Flour
ingredients.7: 1 teaspoon TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
ingredients.8: 1 TJ's Gluten Free Pie Crust, baked according to package directions (seasonal)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Spread flake coconut on a medium sized baking sheet. Bake on center rack of oven for 3-5 minutes, until lightly browned. Remove from oven and set aside to cool.
steps.1: In a medium bowl, beat eggs with a fork, set aside. In a medium saucepan, combine sugar, flour and salt. Stir in coconut cream. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring constantly, until thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat.
steps.2: Slowly pour half of the hot coconut cream mixture into the beaten eggs, stirring to combine. Return egg mixture to cream mixture in saucepan and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until almost boiling (do not boil!). Reduce heat to low and cook 2 minutes more. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla and half of the toasted coconut.
steps.3: Pour coconut mixture into the prepared pie crust and sprinkle with remaining toasted coconut. Cover pie with cling wrap and chill 3-4 hours before serving.

401.title: Chocolate Cream Pie
401.description: Rich, dense, and buttery, Trader Joe's Gluten Free Pie Crust comes already formed in its very own tin, so all you have to do is bake it, allow it to cool, and fill it with whatever mouth-watering filling you desire-using our creamy, decadent, oh-so-chocolaty Belgian Chocolate Pudding means most of the work is done for you!

ingredients.0: 1 tub TJ's Belgian Chocolate Pudding

steps.0: Add pudding and instant coffee to a small bowl (if omitting instant coffee, skip to next step). Mix to incorporate. Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes.
steps.1: Preheat oven to 375°F. Unwrap crust and poke holes all over to allow air to escape. Bake on center rack of oven until golden brown, about 15 minutes. Remove from oven, place on a cold sheet pan and place in the freezer for 10 minutes to cool.
steps.2: Remove pudding from refrigerator and stir (instant coffee should be dissolved). Spoon pudding evenly into cooled pie crust and level the top. Cover with cling wrap and freeze 2 hours.
steps.3: Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, whisk heavy cream and powdered sugar until soft peaks form, about 5 minutes. Cover and refrigerate.
steps.4: 20 minutes prior to serving, remove pie from freezer. When ready to serve, use a spatula to gently spread whipped cream atop pie. Grate dark chocolate atop whipped cream and serve.

402.title: Easy As Pumpkin Pie
402.description: Rich, dense, and buttery, Trader Joe's Gluten Free Pie Crust comes already formed in its very own tin, so all you have to do is bake it, allow it to cool, and fill it with whatever mouth-watering filling you desire. In this recipe, velvety pumpkin gets a fall flavor boost from the generous addition of TJ's Pumpkin Pie Spice.

ingredients.0: 1 TJ's Gluten Free Pie Crust, baked according to package directions (seasonal)
ingredients.6: 1 teaspoon TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
ingredients.8: 2 TJ's Large Eggs plus one egg yolk, lightly beaten
ingredients.9: TJ's Organic Powdered Sugar, for garnish (optional)

parsed_ing.8: Large Eggs plus one egg yolk

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Combine canned pumpkin and brown sugar in a large bowl and stir until smooth (pro tip: do not use a whisk when preparing the filling, or the top of your finish pie will look like the surface of the moon!).
steps.1: Add evaporated milk, butter, pumpkin pie spice, vanilla, and salt to the pumpkin mixture and stir until combined. Taste and adjust seasonings if needed. Gently fold in eggs until combined.
steps.2: Place crust on a rimmed baking sheet and pour filling into crust. Place sheet on center rack of oven and bake for 1 hour. Remove from oven and let pie cool completely before slicing. Dust with powdered sugar, if desired.

403.title: Daylight Savings Sundae
403.description: Trader Joe's Super Premium Pumpkin Ice Cream is thicker and creamier than other ice creams because we don't whip excess air into our product, and we use just the right amount of butterfat to ensure that every spoonful tastes rich and delicious. Top it with crumbled Speculoos Cookies and Candied Pecans for an out-of-this-gourd frozen dessert experience.

ingredients.0: TJ's Super Premium Pumpkin Ice Cream

steps.0: Crumble a couple of speculoos cookies into a serving bowl. Scoop ice cream on top of cookies and top with more cookies and handful of candied pecans. Grab a spoon and dig in!

404.title: Pumpkin Madeleine Cookie Sandwiches
404.description: Spiced, cake-like Madeleine cookies are the perfect vehicle for sweet, tangy, cream cheese frosting.

ingredients.0: 1 tub TJ's Whipped Cream Cheese
ingredients.3: 2 packages TJ's Spiced Pumpkin Madeleine Cookies (seasonal)

steps.0: Add cream cheese, powdered sugar, and cinnamon to a medium sized bowl. Use a hand mixer or spoon and mix thoroughly until combined.
steps.1: Hold a madeleine cookie shell side-down and frost generously with cream cheese frosting. Top with another cookie. Repeat process with remaining ingredients. Enjoy sandwiches immediately, or refrigerate up to four hours before serving.

405.title: Fudge Chip Ice Cream Sandwiches
405.description: In the mood for a sweet DIY treat, but don't want to turn on the oven? Put baking on the backburner and break out this ice cream sandwich recipe instead. Trader Joe's Gluten Free Crispy Crunchy Chocolate Chip Cookies provide a sturdy, buttery base for creamy, dreamy Organic Vanilla Fudge Chip Ice Cream, and building it yourself means the ice-cream-to-cookie ratio can be adjusted on a whim.

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Gluten Free Crispy Crunchy Chocolate Chip Cookies (14 cookies)
ingredients.1: 1 quart TJ's Organic Vanilla Fudge Chip Ice Cream

parsed_ing.0: Gluten Free Crispy Crunchy Chocolate Chip Cookies
parsed_ing.1: Organic Vanilla Fudge Chip Ice Cream

steps.0: Place a parchment-lined baking sheet in the freezer. To assemble sandwiches, place a scoop of ice cream atop the flat side of one cookie. Top with another cookie and press down very gently (cookies are fragile!) to create a sandwich. If desired, smooth sandwich "edges" with a butter knife. Place sandwich on baking sheet inside freezer. Repeat with remaining ingredients. Let sandwiches set in freezer 30 minutes prior to serving.

406.title: Chocolate Pistachio Lava Cake
406.description: Somewhere between cake and souffle, you'll find the classic Trader Joe's Chocolate Lava Cake. Spongy, round cakes with deep chocolate flavor, filled with gooey chocolate fudge... what more could you want? How about more chocolate fudge! And chopped pistachios! And just a few minutes of microwave prep (yes, you read that right)!

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Chocolate Lava Cakes
ingredients.2: Handful TJ's Roasted Pistachio Nutmeats, roughly chopped

steps.0: Remove lid from fudge sauce and microwave jar for 30 second intervals until warm, stirring in between. Place lava cakes on serving dishes and microwave according to package directions. Garnish with fudge sauce and pistachios, and enjoy immediately.

407.title: Chocolate Dipped Raspberry Stars
407.description: What better way to enjoy tender, crumbly shortbread cookies than uniting them with a layer of sweet, seedless raspberry jam? In all honesty, we haven't encountered a shortbread cookie as delightful as our Raspberry Stars. That is, until we decided to dip said Stars in chocolate.

ingredients.0: 1 box TJ's Raspberry Stars Shortbread Cookies (seasonal)
ingredients.1: 1 TJ's 72% Dark Chocolate Pound Plus Bar, broken into small pieces

steps.0: Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside. Add half of the chocolate pieces to a medium microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on half-power for 1 minute intervals, stirring in between, until chocolate is melted.
steps.1: Dip cookies in melted chocolate and place on prepared baking sheet. Place sheet in refrigerator for 10 minutes to set chocolate (cookies will set even faster in the freezer, if you're on a time-crunch). Repeat process with remaining cookies and chocolate.
steps.2: Use a spatula to transfer cookies to a serving plate, and enjoy!

408.title: Cookie Butter Sandwich
408.description: Not yet on the Trader Joe's Cookie Butter bandwagon? May we do our best to convince you to jump on board?  Speculoos cookies are classic Belgian biscuits with great crunch, and a slightly caramelized, almost-but-not-quite-gingerbread flavor. After the cookies are baked to a fabulous finish, they're crushed and mixed with vegetable oils and turned into a spread.Spread it on bagels or waffles. Use it as a dip for pretzels or apple slices. Melt in the microwave and pour it over ice cream. Or turn the classic peanut butter & jelly on its head, by swapping the p.b. for Cookie Butter and the jelly for tart Raspberry Preserves. Trader Joe's Sliced French Brioche bread turns this into an especially soft treat of a sandwich.

ingredients.0: 2 slices TJ's Sliced French Brioche

steps.0: Slather once slice of brioche with cookie butter. Slather the other slice of brioche with raspberry preserves. Arranged sliced bananas atop cookie butter and close sandwich. Enjoy!

409.title: Tahini Caramel Brownies
409.description: Trader Joe's Brownie Truffle Baking Mix continues to be a customer favorite, and it's easy to see why: Loaded with rich, chocolatey goodness, it goes from box to brownie pan in mere minutes, and comes out moist and fudgy in the middle with delightfully chewy edges. PSA: These brownies are excellent served warm-and even more excellent when accompanied by a scoop of TJ's French Vanilla Ice Cream.

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Oil or Coconut Oil Spray, to grease pan
ingredients.2: 1 box TJ's Brownie Truffle Baking Mix
ingredients.3: 1 stick (4 oz) TJ's Salted Butter, melted
ingredients.5: 1/4 cup TJ's Fleur de Sel Caramel Sauce, warmed in the microwave

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan with canola oil spray; set aside.
steps.1: In a large bowl, whisk eggs. Add brownie mix and melted butter, stir to combine (do not overmix). Pour batter into prepared pan, spreading evenly to pan edges with a spatula. Drizzle warmed caramel and tahini atop batter. Gently drag a sharp knife along the surface of the batter to swirl the tahini and caramel.
steps.2: Place pan on center rack of oven and bake 25-30 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool 45 minutes before slicing.

410.title: Frank's Blueberry Muffins
410.description: The best thing about family recipes - other than eating them, of course - is the history they bring to the table. The recipe for Frank's Blueberry Muffins evolved in a Crew Member's home kitchen, perfected over time by Frank himself, who became locally famous for these mega muffins. They were mainstays at family breakfasts and brunches, made surprise appearances in workplaces and classrooms, and were even offered as incentives for gold medal showings in statewide athletic contests.Frank always made sure the muffins were delivered warm, and he always advised the addition of butter before eating. He was also good enough to share the recipe, so that future generations can share in the blueberry goodness in every warm, crumbly bite.

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Oil Spray
ingredients.4: 1 cup TJ's Organic Sugar, plus more for sprinkling
ingredients.8: 1 teaspoon TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
ingredients.9: 2 cups TJ's Frozen Blueberries (do not thaw)
ingredients.10: TJ's Cultured Butter, for serving (optional, but encouraged)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 425°F. Grease muffin tin with cooking spray; set aside. In a large bowl, mix flour, baking powder, salt and sugar; set aside.
steps.1: In a large bowl, combine eggs, milk, butter and vanilla. Add one-third of dry mixture to wet ingredients and stir to combine. Repeat addition of dry ingredients until fully incorporated. Gently fold in blueberries.
steps.2: Scoop muffin batter into greased muffin pan (cups will be very full-almost overflowing-this is ok!). Lightly sprinkle muffin batter with sugar. Place pan on center rack of oven and bake 22-25 minutes, until muffins are golden. Let cool 10 minutes, then gently remove muffins from tin. Enjoy warm, with a generous smear of TJ's Cultured Butter.

411.title: Chocolate Maple Pecan Shortbread Bars
411.description: A similar recipe for these Bars on a popular cooking website calls for more than 10 individual ingredients...here, we've done some measuring for you with our pre-portioned Maple Pecan Shortbread Bar Mix.

ingredients.0: 1 box TJ's Maple Pecan Shortbread Bar Mix (seasonal)
ingredients.1: 1 stick (1/2 cup) plus 2 tablespoons TJ's Unsalted Butter, divided
ingredients.5: TJ's Cooking Oil Spray, to grease pan

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8 x 8-inch baking pan with cooking oil spray; set aside.
steps.1: Slice 1 stick of butter into 8 pieces; put back in fridge to chill, if necessary. Empty crust mix into the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, add chilled butter and beat on low speed until mixture becomes crumbly. Increase speed to medium and beat until dough comes together.
steps.2: Turn dough out into greased baking pan and use your hands to press evenly into pan bottom and up sides. Bake on center rack of oven until edges begin to brown, about 18 to 20 minutes. Remove from oven and cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes.
steps.3: Melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter. Empty contents of filling packet into a medium mixing bowl, whisk in egg, melted butter, and water; mix until combined. Pour filling evenly over crust and sprinkle with chocolate chips. Return pan to oven and bake until center of filling is set, 30 to 35 minutes. Cool to room temperature in the pan on a wire rack or stove top. Once cooled, cut into 16 bars and enjoy.

412.title: Pumpkin Pie
412.description: Take this handy recipe (straight from our TJ's Pie Pumpkin label), throw in some dough rolling, light stirring and a can-do attitude, and you'll have a pie worthy of your Thanksgiving spread.

ingredients.0: 1 TJ's Pie Pumpkin
ingredients.1: 1 TJ's Frozen Pie Crust, thawed according to package directions
ingredients.2: 1/2 cup to 1 cup whipping cream (use more for a larger Pie Pumpkin)
ingredients.4: 1/2 cup to 1 cup TJ's Organic Brown Sugar (use more for a larger Pie Pumpkin)
ingredients.7: 1 teaspoon TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Wash and dry pumpkin, slice in half and remove stem. Use a spoon to scrape out string and seeds and discard (or toast seeds for a snack). Place pumpkin halves cut-side down on a foil-lined baking sheet. Bake 1 1/2 hours, until tender. Remove sheet from oven and remove foil; set aside to cool.
steps.1: Gently unroll thawed crust into a 9" pie pan. Fold crust edge so it doesn't hang over the edge of the pan, and use a fork to crimp edge, if desired. Set aside.
steps.2: Scoop pumpkin flesh into a large mixing bowl and mash with a fork until smooth. Add butter, cream, sugar, vanilla, pumpkin pie spice, and salt and mix until combined. Taste and adjust seasonings and sugar if needed. Fold in eggs. Pour filling into crust.
steps.3: Place pie on center rack of oven and bake 1 hour. Cool 1 hour before slicing. Serve with whipped cream, if desired.

413.title: For The Love Of Pumpkin (Cheesecake)
413.description: Our Pumpkin Cheesecake gets turned up to 11 in this recipe, thanks to a drizzled web of chocolate-y Fudge Sauce and crushed Sweet & Spicy Pecans-and it pairs perfectly with a hot mug of Pumpkin Spice Coffee!

ingredients.0: 1 TJ's Pumpkin Cheesecake, defrosted (note: place cake on serving platter prior to defrosting to avoid a gooey mess)
ingredients.2: 1 bag TJ's Sweet & Spicy Pecans, crushed

steps.0: Spoon half of the fudge sauce into a microwave-safe dish. Heat on half-power for 30 second intervals until melted, stirring in between. Drizzle melted fudge sauce over cheesecake (and feel free to top with even more melted fudge, if that's your thing). Top with crushed pecans, and then slice, serve and enjoy!

414.title: Peach Slab Pie
414.description: The dough for our classic Trader Joe's Frozen Pie Crusts is crafted from scratch, with pure butter you can taste. Each one bakes into a wonderfully golden crust that's flaky on the fork and sturdy enough to carry a hearty amount of filling. Plus, these Crusts are extra easy to work with, so you can skip all that pastry chef perspiration! Simply remove one from the box (there are two), let it thaw, unroll it into a pie plate, fill, then bake. This functionally flattened pie recipe (featuring the aforementioned flaky Crusts) is perfect for picnics and parties. Feel free to substitute your favorite fruit for the peaches-just be sure to taste and adjust the sugar accordingly prior to baking.

ingredients.0: 2 boxes TJ's Pie Crusts, thawed
ingredients.2: 1/2 cup TJ's Brown Sugar, plus more for sprinkling
ingredients.7: You will also need an 11x15-inch rimmed baking sheet

parsed_ing.7: also need an 11x15-inch rimmed baking sheet

steps.0: Preheat oven to 425°F. Position one rack on bottom rung of oven and one in the center. Place a large cookie sheet on bottom rack of oven.
steps.1: Unroll two circles of dough onto parchment-lined cutting board, with edges overlapping. Using a flour-dusted rolling pin, roll together cracks in the dough. Fold edges inward to create a rectangle, slightly larger than the baking sheet. Transfer dough to baking sheet, fitting edges up and over the sides of the pan. Refrigerate for 10 minutes.
steps.2: Remove baking sheet from refrigerator and prick holes in dough with a knife. Place sheet on center rack of oven and bake for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside. Reduce heat to 375°F.
steps.3: Repeat the rolling process with remaining dough to create the top layer of pie. Refrigerate for 10 minutes.
steps.4: Add thawed peaches, brown sugar, lemon juice, cinnamon and ginger to a large bowl and gently fold together with a spatula. Pour peach mixture into a strainer to drain excess liquid. Pour strained peaches evenly into par-baked crust, and cover with remaining dough.
steps.5: Use a fork to crimp the edges of dough together around the edges of the baking sheet. Poke scattered holes in the dough to vent while baking (alternatively, use a knife to cut desired shapes out of dough).
steps.6: In a small bowl, whisk the egg. Brush top crust with egg wash and sprinkle with brown sugar. Place pie in center rack of oven and bake for 70 minutes, rotating pan halfway through. Remove pie from oven when crust is golden and filling is bubbly. Let cool one hour prior to serving.

415.title: No-Bake Cheesecake
415.description: This tangy, mousse-like dessert is perfect for hot days when turning on the oven is not an option.

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Oil Spray
ingredients.6: 2/3 cup TJ's Organic Powdered Sugar, divided

steps.0: Prepare the crust: Coat a 9-inch springform pan with cooking spray and line bottom of pan with parchment. Set aside. Stir together graham crackers, butter, sugar, cinnamon, and a pinch of salt; press evenly into bottom of pan. Refrigerate crust while preparing filling.
steps.1: Prepare the filling: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with paddle attachment, beat sour cream, 1/3 cup sugar, the cheeses, vanilla extract, and lemon zest on medium-high speed until very smooth, about 6 minutes. Pass mixture through a fine mesh strainer into a large mixing bowl and set aside.
steps.2: Add heavy cream and remaining sugar to empty stand mixer bowl. Beat at medium speed until peaks form. Fold whipped cream into cheese mixture. Pour filling into prepared crust and spread evenly. Smooth top, cover with cling wrap and freeze until firm, at least 2 hours.
steps.3: To serve cheesecake, remove pan from freezer and let sit 10 minutes. Run a knife around the edge to separate cake from pan. Release sides to remove form, and carefully transfer cake to a serving platter. Let sit another 10 minutes prior to serving. Enjoy plain, or top with strawberry preserves, fresh blueberries, chopped mint...

416.title: Peanut Butter Cup Cinnamallow Treats
416.description: Take your marshmallow treats to the next level with Cinnamon Crunchy Squares and Dark Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups.

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Oil Spray
ingredients.4: 20 TJ's Dark Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups, cut into thirds

steps.0: Coat a 13x9 pan with canola oil spray and set aside. Remove cereal bag from outer box. With cereal still in the bag, use your hands to crush cereal into smaller pieces; measure out 6 cups and set aside.
steps.1: In a large pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add marshmallows and stir until melted. Turn off heat and add crushed cereal and 2/3 of the peanut butter cups to pan. Stir quickly to incorporate into marshmallow mixture.
steps.2: Press the cereal mixture into greased pan with the back of a spoon. Top with remaining peanut butter cups. Using a piece of waxed paper, gently press peanut butter cups into treats. Let cool, then cut into squares and enjoy!

417.title: Gone Bananas Sundae
417.description: Trader Joe's Gone Bananas takes the chocolate-covered banana to new heights. The bananas are sliced first, and then dipped in chocolate-this process creates a higher chocolate-to-banana ratio, and bite size pieces that make this time-honored treat even easier to enjoy. Savor them one bite at a time, or pile them atop an ice cream sundae with Trader Joe's Fudge Sauce, graham cracker crumbs, and dried cherries for a fabulous frozen treat.

ingredients.0: TJ's French Vanilla Ice Cream
ingredients.2: TJ's Gone Bananas (or, for a strawberry version of this sundae, substitute with TJ's Gone Berry Crazy)

steps.0: Scoop ice cream into a bowl. Top with fudge sauce, bananas, dried cherries and crushed graham crackers. Grab a spoon and dig in!

418.title: Pineapple Upside Down Cake
418.description: For a twist on this tropical treat, try soaking the pineapple fans in TJ's Rum of the Gods overnight prior to baking.

ingredients.0: 1/4 cup TJ's Salted Butter
ingredients.2: 5 TJ's Fresh Pineapple Spears, sliced into small fans
ingredients.3: 1 box TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Add 1/4 cup butter to an 8-inch square baking pan and place in oven to melt, 3-5 minutes. Remove pan from oven and sprinkle brown sugar over butter. Layer pineapple fans over butter and sugar mixture to cover base of pan; set aside.
steps.1: In a large bowl, add cake mix, eggs, melted butter and milk. Stir to combine. Pour cake batter evenly atop pineapple fans. Place pan in oven on center rack and bake 45 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove pan from oven and immediately run a knife around edges to loosen cake. Carefully flip pan onto a heatproof serving plate. Leave pan over plate for 5 minutes.
steps.2: Remove baking pan and rearrange any pineapple slices that did not transfer to the cake. Serve warm, with TJ's Vanilla Ice Cream, if desired.

419.title: Matcha Matcha Cupcakes
419.description: Trader Joe's Japanese Matcha Green Tea and trusty Trader Joe's Vanilla Cake Mix form the base of these virescent cupcakes, complete with Matcha-tinted buttercream frosting. Whip up a batch and say hello to spring green!

ingredients.0: 1 box TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix
ingredients.3: 1/2 cup (1 stick) TJ's Unsalted Butter, melted
ingredients.4: 4 TJ's Single Serve Matcha Green Tea Packets
ingredients.6: 1/2 cup (1 stick) TJ's Unsalted Butter, softened
ingredients.8: 2 TJ's Single Serve Matcha Green Tea Packets

parsed_ing.4: Single Serve Matcha Green Tea Packets
parsed_ing.8: Single Serve Matcha Green Tea Packets

steps.0: Prepare the cupcakes: Preheat the oven to 350°F and move the oven rack to the lower third of the oven. Line a muffin pan with baking cups; set aside. In a large mixing bowl, combine melted butter, eggs, milk and cake mix; whisk until smooth. Add 4 matcha packets to bowl and whisk to combine.
steps.1: Using a serving spoon or ice cream scoop, fill baking cups 2/3 full with matcha cake batter. Place pan in oven and bake for 15-17 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove pan from oven and allow cupcakes to cool completely before frosting.
steps.2: Prepare the frosting: While cupcakes are baking, in the bowl of an electric mixer with paddle attachment (or in a bowl with a hand mixer), beat softened butter on medium speed until smooth. Reduce speed to medium low and add powdered sugar to bowl in 1/2 cup increments, mixing thoroughly between additions. Scrape bowl with a spatula. Add milk and 1 1/2 matcha packets to bowl and beat on medium-low speed to combine. Using a spatula, generously frost cooled cupcakes and sprinkle with remaining matcha powder. Enjoy immediately!

420.title: Sunflower Seed Spread Cookies
420.description: What's more comforting than a warm, fresh-baked cookie? How about a warm, fresh-baked cookie made with only five ingredients, that can be pulled together in about 15 minutes? Made with Trader Joe's Unsweetened Sunflower Seed Spread, these soft, gooey cookies are simple to prepare, and simply irresistible to any self-respecting cookie-lover.

ingredients.0: 1 cup TJ's Unsweetened Sunflower Seed Spread
ingredients.1: 1 cup TJ's Organic Sugar, plus more for rolling cookies
ingredients.4: 1 teaspoon TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper; set aside.
steps.1: In a medium sized bowl, mix all ingredients. Spread additional sugar on a small plate. Roll walnut sized pieces of cookie dough into balls, then roll in sugar and place on lined baking sheet. Using a fork, lightly press down on the dough balls to create a crisscross pattern.
steps.2: Place baking sheet on center rack of oven and bake 11 minutes. Let cookies cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to cooling rack. Enjoy warm, or store in an airtight container for up to 3 days.

421.title: Vanilla Chai Cake with Spiced Apples
421.description: Prior to stirring milk into this cake mix, it's simmered with Trader Joe's Spiced Chai Tea and imbued with an array of fragrant spices. After baking, the cake is topped with a pile of sliced apples that have been sauteed in golden ghee and perfume-y cinnamon. The resulting dessert is warm, wintry, and downright satisfying-and as an added bonus, you'll warm up the house by turning on the oven!

ingredients.0: 3 tablespoons TJ's Ghee, divided
ingredients.5: 1 package TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix
ingredients.6: 3 Envy Apples, peeled and sliced (if unavailable, Granny Smith or Cripps Pink apples will work just fine)
ingredients.8: Whipped Cream or TJ's Vanilla Ice Cream, for serving (optional)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease an 8-inch pan with 1 tablespoon Ghee and set aside. In a small saucepan, add milk and Spiced Chai Tea Bags and cook over medium heat. Simmer for 10 minutes, stirring frequently, being careful not to scorch the milk. Remove from heat and let cool completely; discard tea bags.
steps.1: In a large mixing bowl, combine cooled Chai milk, eggs and melted butter. Add Vanilla Cake Mix and stir to combine. Spread cake batter into greased pan. Bake for 40 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and set aside.
steps.2: While cake is baking, add remaining ghee to a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add sliced Envy apples and cinnamon to skillet, stirring to coat. Let cook for 5 minutes without disturbing apples. Stir, cover pan and cook for another 15 minutes, until apples are soft.
steps.3: Slice cake and top each piece with a scoop of warm spiced apples. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream, if desired.

422.title: Jennie's Blackstrap Molasses Cookies
422.description: If your recipe calls for molasses, we think Trader Joe's Organic Blackstrap Molasses will add a depth of flavor not found in regular or dark molasses. Rich and dark-hued, it's the most robust tasting Molasses our product developers could find, making it the perfect addition to all manner of holiday baking. Try it in this recipe for molasses cookies (straight from a Trader Joe's Crew Member's home kitchen!), or add it to cakes, breads, or sauces...you can even use it to glaze a holiday ham!

ingredients.0: 11/2 cups (3 sticks) TJ's Unsalted Butter
ingredients.1: 2 cups TJ's Organic Cane Sugar, plus 1/2 Cup for garnish
ingredients.2: 1/2 cup TJ's Organic Blackstrap Molasses (available Oct-Dec)

steps.0: Plan ahead! This cookie dough requires at least three hours in the refrigerator prior to baking.
steps.1: Place butter in a glass measuring cup; heat in the microwave on half-power for 30-second intervals until melted. Set aside to cool. Add 2 cups sugar, eggs and molasses to a stand mixer (a hand mixer will work, too) fitted with a paddle; beat at medium speed. Add melted butter and beat just until incorporated; set aside.
steps.2: In a separate bowl, sift together remaining dry ingredients. Add one cup of dry ingredients to wet ingredients and beat at medium speed just until combined. Scrape the sides of the bowl and repeat the addition of dry ingredients, one cup at a time, until fully combined with wet ingredients. Cover dough with cling wrap and refrigerate at least three hours or overnight.
steps.3: Preheat oven to 375°F and line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. Spread remaining 1/2 cup sugar on a large dinner plate. Form refrigerated dough into golf ball-sized balls and roll in sugar. Place on cookie sheet 2 inches apart and bake for 10-12 minutes. Remove sheet from oven; let cookies cool for five minutes prior to removing them from the baking sheet. Makes 48 cookies.

423.title: Caramel Pumpkin Cheesecake
423.description: This stunning Pumpkin Cheesecake looks (and tastes) like it came straight from a fancy pâtisserie.

ingredients.0: 1 TJ's Pumpkin Cheesecake (seasonal), defrosted (note: place cake on serving platter prior to defrosting to avoid a gooey mess)
ingredients.1: 1/2 jar TJ's Fleur de Sel Caramel Sauce
ingredients.2: 1/2 cup TJ's Pumpkin Spiced Pumpkin Seeds (seasonal)
ingredients.3: 1/4 cup TJ's Candied Pecans or Candied Walnuts

steps.0: Spread caramel sauce on top of cheesecake (use more than half the jar for extra gooey results, if desired). Top with pumpkin seeds and candied nuts. Serve immediately.

424.title: Pumpkin Spice Whipped Cream
424.description: Spoon this fluffy whipped cream atop warm Chocolate Babka or freshly baked Pumpkin Bread for a sweet taste of fall.

ingredients.0: 1 8-ounce carton Whipping Cream

steps.0: Pour whipping cream into a large bowl. Using a hand mixer or whisk, whip until soft peaks form. Add Pumpkin Pie Spice and sugar and continue whipping to desired texture. Serve with scones, coffee, muffins, ice cream...

425.title: Kick S'moreover Dip
425.description: If you're looking to really commune with your compatriots, then individual assembly is out; dip is in.

ingredients.0: 1 1/2 cups TJ's Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips
ingredients.1: 1/4 cup TJ's Organic Reduced Fat Coconut Milk (or Cream)
ingredients.2: 12 TJ's Marshmallows (available May-Aug), cut in half

steps.0: Preheat oven to 425ºF.
steps.1: In a 6" cast iron skillet, pour in the chocolate chips, followed by the coconut milk. Give the mixture a quick stir. Arrange the halved marshmallows in a single layer covering the chocolate mixture.
steps.2: Place the skillet in the oven, on the center rack; let heat for about 8-10 minutes. Keep an eye to make sure the marshmallows aren't burning (every oven is calibrated slightly differently).
steps.3: When the marshmallows are golden and toasted, carefully remove the skillet from the oven. Let cool ever so slightly and serve with your desired dip accompaniments (featured for inspiration: fresh strawberries; pear slices; banana chips; graham crackers; lattemiele cookies, dark chocolate crisps).

426.title: Ridge Crispy S'moreover Bars
426.description: Ridiculous with Ridge Cut Potato Chips, Marshmallows, Butter and a rainbow of Candy Coated Chocolate Drops, these bars pack craveable sweet-and-salty cunch. Scrumptiously irresistible!

ingredients.0: 1 stick TJ's Unsalted Butter
ingredients.2: 1 bag TJ's Ridge Cut Potato Chips with Sea Salt, crushed
ingredients.3: 1 bag TJ's Candy Coated Chocolate Drops or TJ's Candy Coated Chocolate Peanuts

parsed_ing.2: Ridge Cut Potato Chips with Sea Salt

steps.0: Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in marshmallows and melt completely. In a large mixing bowl, pour the crushed chips, followed by the melted marshmallow and mix together thoroughly (take care to use utensils while mixing - the melted marshmallows are HOT!). Fold in the chocolate drops, and then press the mixture into a 9" x 13" baking pan (you can use 9" x 9" if you like your bars super dense). Let cool (place in freezer for 5 minutes to expedite); cut and serve.

427.title: Mango, Mango Frozen Cheesecake
427.description: This is basically the sunshine and pleasures of summer blended into a vibrant, irresistible cheesecake with Mango, Mango, coconut cashews, strawberries, honey...

ingredients.0: 2 cups TJ's Coconut Cashews
ingredients.1: 3/4 cup TJ's Soft & Juicy Dried Mango
ingredients.2: 2 tbsp TJ's Organic Virgin Coconut Oil
ingredients.3: a pinch of TJ's Sea Salt, to taste
ingredients.4: 2 cups (roughly 3 Mangoes) TJ's Mango, peeled, pitted & coarsely chopped
ingredients.8: 1 container TJ's Mango Greek Nonfat Yogurt
ingredients.11: a few sprigs of TJ's Organic Mint, to garnish
ingredients.12: a sprinkling of TJ's Organic Flaked Coconut, to garnish

steps.0: Grind coconut cashews, soft and juicy mango, coconut oil, and salt in a blender or a food processor for about a minute, or until the mixture coarsely comes together. Flatten the mixture out on the bottom of an 8-inch non-stick spring form pan.
steps.1: Chill crust in fridge while the filling is made. Blend mango, lemon juice and honey. Add mascarpone and mango Greek yogurt; blend until uniform color. Pour filling over chilled crust and freeze for at least two hours.
steps.2: Remove from freezer ten minutes before serving. Top cheesecake with fresh mango and strawberries, garnish with coconut flakes and mint sprigs. Serve immediately.

428.title: Mango Yogurt & Granola Parfait
428.description: Sweet, creamy yogurt; crunchy granola with a nutty-ginger bite; fresh, juicy mango; bittersweet, tangy berries; sesame honey cashews - layers that lead your mouth through the looking glass (apologies, Mr. Carroll).

ingredients.0: 1/2 cup TJ's Ginger Almond & Cashew Granola Cereal
ingredients.3: 1/2 cup TJ's Mango, peeled, pitted & chopped

steps.0: In your preferred parfait glass (featured in 11-ounce glass), layer half of granola, followed by half of yogurt. Repeat layers with remaining granola and yogurt. Atop final layer, place raspberries (optional: place one berry aside to use as garnish). Atop berries, place mango pieces. Atop mango, sprinkle sesame honey cashews. Enjoy!

429.title: In the Garden of…Cake
429.description: Vanilla cake zested with orange with layers of Fresh Strawberry buttercream frosting and fresh pack Strawberry Preserves - this creation takes garden party "tea" cakes to new heights.

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Oil Spray
ingredients.4: 2 boxes TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix
