ingredients.13: 6 Fresh TJ's Strawberries, whole & beautiful with green tops

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F.
steps.1: Prepare three 8-inch square cake pans: use bottom of a cake pan to measure/trace 3 circles on parchment paper; cut out the circles and set aside. Spray the inside of the pans with canola oil. Place parchment circles in the pan bottoms and spray over top with canola oil. Set aside.
steps.2: Prepare & Bake Cakes: in a large mixing bowl, combine eggs, melted butter, and milk. Add cake mix. Whisk together until batter is smooth; fold in orange zest. Divide batter evenly among the 3 cake pans. Place on center oven rack and bake; at 40 minutes, test cake centers with a toothpick; when toothpicks come out clean, remove cakes and let cool (in pans) for 10 minutes. After 10 minutes, run a knife around the inside of each cake pan, flip pans upside down and ease cakes out onto a cooling rack to cool completely, about 40-50 minutes.
steps.3: Prepare Frosting: while cakes are cooling, make buttercream frosting. Add butter to a stand mixer (a hand mixer will work too) fitted with a paddle; beat at medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Add sugar, cream, and vanilla; mix at low speed until just combined. Increase the speed to high and mix until smooth and fluffy, about 3 to 5 minutes. If it becomes too thick, add a little more cream. If it's too thin, add more powdered sugar.
steps.4: Measure about 1 cup of plain buttercream frosting, set aside. Fold in diced strawberries into remaining frosting.
steps.5: Assemble Cake: place dollop of frosting in center of cake stand or platter to anchor. Place first cake, top side down, over the frosting and center on the plate. Carefully apply strawberry buttercream along the edges, leaving bare a medium-sized circle in the center of the cake. Spoon 2 to 3 tablespoons of strawberry preserves into the frosting-less center; top preserves with fresh sliced strawberries. Place the next layer on top of the first and repeat strawberry buttercream, preserves and sliced strawberries steps.
steps.6: Place the last cake layer on top and frost with strawberry buttercream; as lightly as you'd like, frost sides of the entire cake with plain buttercream. Decorate the top of the cake with whole strawberries and slices of orange.

430.title: Decadence on Display Cake
430.description: Truffle Brownies, Blondies, and Vanilla Cakes - oh, my - layered with buttercream frosting and pools of Fleur de Sel Caramel Sauce, then gilded with Fudge Sauce and a cookie-brownie trio. It looks as decadent as it tastes.

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Oil Spray 5 large TJ's Eggs 1 cup TJ's 2% Milk, cold 3 sticks TJ's Unsalted Butter, separated and melted 1 box Trader Joe's Truffle Brownie Mix 1 box TJ's Blondie Bar Mix 1 box TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix 1 1/2 sticks TJ's Unsalted Butter, softened 2 1/4 cup TJ's Organic Powdered Sugar 3 Tbsp TJ's Heavy Cream 1 tsp TJ's Vanilla Extract 1/2 jar TJ's Fleur de Sel Caramel Sauce, for the layers 1/2 jar TJ's Fudge Sauce 4 TJ's Sea Salt Brownie Petites, halved 4 TJ's Chocolate with Vanilla Bean Cream Joe-Joe's, halved 8 TJ's Crispy Crunchy Chocolate Chip Cookies

parsed_ing.0: Canola Oil Spray 5 large TJ's Eggs 1 cup TJ's 2% Milk

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F.
steps.1: Prepare 3 Cake Pans (8"x8"x2"): use bottom of a cake pan to measure/trace 3 circles on parchment paper; cut out the circles and set aside. Spray the inside of the pans with canola oil. Place parchment circles on the bottom of each pan and spray over top with butter flavored oil. Set aside.
steps.2: Prepare & Bake Cakes: in three separate bowls, prepare each cake mix. For vanilla cake, mix together 2 eggs, 1 stick of melted butter, and 1 cup milk; add dry mix and whisk until batter is smooth; pour into cake pan. For brownies, whisk together 2 eggs with 1 stick of melted butter; add dry mix and stir until moistened; pour into cake pan. For blondies, whisk together 1 egg with 1 stick of melted butter; add dry mix and stir until moistened; pour into cake pan. Bake all three cakes per directions on package (note: the vanilla cake takes about 10 minutes longer, so make this one first). Remove cakes and let cool (in pans) for 10 minutes. After 10 minutes, run a knife around the inside of each cake pan, flip pans upside down and ease cakes out onto a cooling rack to cool completely, about 40-50 minutes.
steps.3: Prepare Frosting: while cakes are cooling, make buttercream frosting. Add butter to stand mixer (a hand mixer will work too) fitted with a paddle; beat at medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Add sugar, cream, and vanilla; mix at low speed until just incorporated. Increase the speed to high and mix until smooth and fluffy, about 3 to 5 minutes. If it becomes too thick, add a little more cream. If it's too thin, add more powdered sugar.
steps.4: Assemble Cake: place a dollop of buttercream on cake stand or platter to anchor, place brownie layer on top. Pipe or spread buttercream frosting along the edges of the cake; fill in center with 1/4 jar of caramel sauce. Top with blondie cake and repeat buttercream and caramel step. Top with vanilla cake layer; as lightly as you like frost sides of the entire cake with remaining buttercream.
steps.5: Decorate Cake: warm the jar of fudge sauce for 10 seconds in the microwave and pour 1/2 over the top of the cake and allow to flow down the sides in long drips. Decorate top of the cakes with brownie petites and cookies.

431.title: Peeled Banana & Cookie Butter Cake
431.description: Cookie Butter milk-soaked Banana Bread cake, layered with Double Cookie Butter Cream Cheese Frosting and sliced bananas. Whether you're bananas for cookie butter or cookie for bananas, this takes the cake!

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Oil Spray
ingredients.5: 2 pkgs (16 oz.) TJ's Cookie Butter Cream Cheese, softened
ingredients.7: 2 tsp TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
ingredients.8: 1 cup TJ's Speculoos Cookie Butter, divided
ingredients.11: 8 TJ's Cookie Butter Sandwich Cookies, cut in half
ingredients.13: 1/2 cup TJ's Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips, melted (optional)

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F.
steps.1: Prepare 2 Cake Pans (8"x8"x2"): use bottom of cake pan to measure/trace 2 circles on parchment paper; cut out the circles and set aside. Spray the inside of the pans with canola oil. Place parchment circles in the bottom of each pan and spray over top with butter flavored oil. Set aside.
steps.2: Prepare Cakes: in a large mixing bowl, whisk together eggs, oil, and water. Add both boxes of dry mix to the liquids in the bowl; stir with a large spoon, until the ingredients are just combined. Divide batter between the 2 cake pans and bake for 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove cakes and let cool completely, about 1 hour.
steps.3: Prepare Frosting: while cakes are cooling, prepare the frosting. Whip cookie butter cream cheese, cookie butter, and vanilla until fluffy, blended together, and thoroughly mixed. Refrigerate frosting until ready to use.
steps.4: Prepare Milk Soak, Bananas, & Cake Layers: once cake is cooled, prepare the milk soak. Place 1 cup cookie butter and 1/2 cup milk into a sauce pan over a low flame; stir until melted together. Add a little more milk if needed to make it slightly runny.
steps.5: Cut bananas into 1/4 inch round slices.
steps.6: Remove cakes from pans to a wire rack. Use a serrated knife to cut off cake crowns and slice each cake into 2 layers. Set the crowns aside for another use (ideas: crumbled & toasted for ice cream topping; use to craft trifles, banana bread pudding, or cake pops; blend into a chocolate shake).
steps.7: Assemble Cake: place a dollop of cookie butter frosting on cake plate or platter to anchor. Place first layer of cake over the frosting and center on the plate. Spoon 1/3 of the cookie butter/milk soak over top of layer; frost; cover with sliced bananas. Repeat with second and third layers of cake. Add the fourth (top) layer and frost liberally. Decorate the top layer: place 8 (or so) cookie halves upright around the edge of the cake; place 3/4 of walnuts and remainder of bananas around the center of the cake. Crush remaining cookies and walnuts and sprinkle over the cake. If you're feeling bananas, drizzle with melted chocolate.

ingredients.0: TJ's Canola Oil Spray
ingredients.1: 20 TJ's Joe-Joe's (Chocolate Cookies with Vanilla Bean Creme)
ingredients.2: 14 oz (1 tub) TJ's Dark Chocolate Covered Espresso Beans
ingredients.3: 8 Tbsp (1 stick) TJ's Salted Butter, melted
ingredients.4: 1 quart TJ's Coffee Bean Blast Ice Cream, softened slightly
ingredients.7: 1 cup TJ's Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate
ingredients.10: You will also need a 9-inch pie dish OR a 9-inch springform pan AND a hand mixer

steps.0: Generously coat a 9-inch pie dish or springform pan with canola oil spray and set aside. Reserve about 25 dark chocolate covered espresso beans for garnish and set aside.
steps.1: To make the crust: In a food processor, combine 20 Joe-Joe cookies, remaining dark chocolate espresso beans (about 1.5 cups) and 8 Tablespoons of melted butter. Pulse until uniform crumbs form. Scoop cookie mixture into your oiled pie dish and press along the bottom and the sides to form an even crust.
steps.2: Add softened ice cream atop the crust and smooth into an even layer with a spatula. If ice cream is too runny once added to the dish, place pie dish into the freezer until it hardens slightly, about 10 minutes. Remove the lid from the fudge and microwave about 30 seconds or until lightly warmed. Spread the jar of hot fudge over the ice cream in an even layer. Place pie dish into freezer until fudge and ice cream layers harden, about 1 hour. If layers have not hardened before adding the whipped cream they will overflow, so use caution (the springform pan is a little more forgiving).
steps.3: To make the cold brew whipped cream: Meanwhile, with a stand mixer or hand mixer, in a large bowl, whip 2 cups heavy cream, 1 cup cold brew and 2 tsp sugar until firm peaks form. Cover and refrigerate. Once ice cream and fudge layers harden, remove dish from freezer, then add whipped cream. Garnish the top with reserved chocolate covered espresso beans and sliced almonds.
steps.4: Place dish back into freezer 6-8 hours or overnight until completely solid. To serve, let pie soften a few minutes in room temperature and slice with a knife warmed in hot water.
steps.5: Enjoy immediately!

ingredients.0: 6 Tablespoons TJ's Shredded Sweetened Coconut, divided
ingredients.1: 1 3/4 cup TJ's Non-Dairy Coconut Beverage (Vanilla Flavor), divided
ingredients.2: 1 1/2 cups TJ's Coconut Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate (or original TJ's Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate)
ingredients.4: You will also need 12 wooden craft sticks, 12 small square pieces of foil and 12 small paper cups to use as molds

parsed_ing.4: also need 12 wooden craft sticks, 12 small square pieces of foil and 12 small paper cups to use as molds

corrected_ing.4: also need 12 wooden craft sticks, 12 small square pieces of foil and 12 small paper cups to use as molds

steps.0: Arrange 12 paper cups on a small tray. Sprinkle 1/2 tablespoon of shredded coconut in the bottom of each cup. Pour 1 Tablespoon of coconut milk into each cup and swish until the shredded coconut is completely saturated. Place tray of cups in the freezer for at least 1.5 hours or until layer solidifies.
steps.1: Meanwhile, in a small pitcher combine remaining 1 cup of coconut milk, 1.5 cups of cold brew and 3 teaspoons of sugar. Stir, cover and set aside.
steps.2: Once the coconut milk layers are solid, remove tray from freezer and add about 3 tablespoons of your cold brew mixture to each cup. Cover each cup with foil and puncture with a wooden craft stick down the center. Stick the pops in the freezer for about six hours. Peel the paper away and enjoy!

434.title: Grilled Nectarine Shortcake & Sriracha BBQ Glaze
434.description: Grilling the nectarines lends an element of smokiness to this classic, sweet summer dessert.

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Shortcake Biscuits (available Mar-Sep)
ingredients.2: 1/4 cup plus 1 Tablespoon TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil, divided
ingredients.3: 1/4 cup TJ's Organic Sriracha and Roasted Garlic BBQ Sauce
ingredients.4: 1 tub TJ's Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream

parsed_ing.3: Organic Sriracha and Roasted Garlic BBQ Sauce

steps.0: Cut nectarines into thick wedges (about 6-7 wedges per nectarine). Heat a cast-iron grill on the stovetop over medium heat and grease with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Pour olive oil in a small bowl and dip nectarine wedges until fully immersed in oil. Place wedges on grill and sear until grill marks appear, about 2-3 minutes. Flip and repeat. Baste wedges with Sriracha BBQ Sauce on all sides, then remove from grill and set aside to cool slightly.
steps.1: Gently split biscuits in half-careful, they are fragile! To serve, scoop ice cream onto the bottom half of the biscuit then top with grilled and glazed nectarine wedges. Add an extra drizzle of Sriracha BBQ Sauce for an extra zing. Enjoy immediately!

435.title: Cookie Butter & Bacon Stuffed French Toast

ingredients.0: 1 package Uncured Apple Smoked Bacon
ingredients.6: TJ's Organic Midnight Moo Chocolate Flavored Syrup, to taste

parsed_ing.6: Organic Midnight Moo Chocolate Flavored Syrup

steps.0: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
steps.1: Place bacon on foil lined baking sheet and bake 12 minutes or until desired crispness.
steps.2: While the bacon cooks, carefully slice the croissants ALMOST all of the way through. Remove some of the breading from the inside to create shallow cavities for filling.
steps.3: Remove bacon to a plate and let cool. Once cool enough to handle, crumble or cut to desired size.
steps.4: Spread 1 tablespoon of cookie butter into the cavity of each cut side of the croissants. Sprinkle bacon pieces evenly among the croissants (or more in your own if no one is looking). Press the 2 sides back together.
steps.5: In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter.
steps.6: In a shallow dish, beat the eggs and milk together. Dip each croissant in the mixture, ensuring an even coating on all sides.
steps.7: Add the croissants to the skillet, working in batches, if necessary. Cook about 2 minutes on each side until desired darkness, watching carefully to make sure they don't burn.
steps.8: Finished croissants can be held in the warm oven while the others cook if working in batches. Serve warm and drizzled with Midnight Moo chocolate syrup.
steps.9: Recipe Credit: Trader Joe's 2015 Strut Your Stuffed Recipe Contest 1st Runner-Up - Jeannette Powers of

ingredients.0: 4 TJ's Apricots
ingredients.1: 1 (4.5 oz.) tub TJ's Goat's Milk Creamy Cheese or 1 (5 oz.) log TJ's Chevre with Honey, warmed to room temperature
ingredients.2: 3 Tablespoons TJ's Sliced Honey Roasted Almonds

steps.0: Halve the apricots, remove seeds and place the hollow side facing skywards on a platter
steps.1: In a small bowl, mix together the goat cheese and almonds
steps.2: Using a knife, cut off the bottoms of the coconut macaroons
steps.3: Place a generous dollop of the goat cheese mixture on each apricot half
steps.4: Crown goat cheese mounds with the top portions of the macaroons
steps.5: Dot the blueberries with a small amount of goat cheese, then gingerly place atop the point of each macaroon
steps.6: Serve immediately, ideally with Trader Joe's English Breakfast Tea
steps.7: Recipe Credit: Trader Joe's 2015 Strut Your Stuffed Recipe Contest Winner - Jessica Volz of Denver, CO

437.title: Caramel Dipped Persimmons
437.description: Trader Joe's Fleur de Sel Caramels are made by hand with Fleur de Sel, a delicate sea salt that's hand-harvested off the coast of France. In this sophisticated spinoff of the classis caramel apple, persimmons are dipped into the velvety melted caramel, then topped with pumpkin seeds, pecan pieces, or pomegranate seeds for crunch.

ingredients.0: 2 tubs (20 oz) TJ's Fleur De Sel Caramel Squares (for easy handling, chill caramel candies in refrigerator for 10 minutes)
ingredients.2: 10 TJ's Persimmons (seasonal), washed and stickers removed
ingredients.3: 1 bag TJ's Roasted & Salted Pumpkin Seeds (or Pumpkin Spiced Pumpkin Seeds, available seasonally)
ingredients.4: 1 bag TJ's Unsalted Dry Toasted Pecan Pieces

steps.0: Line a baking sheet with wax or parchment paper and set aside. Remove all plastic wrappers from caramels. Place caramel squares and water into a mini crock pot on HIGH for 1 to 1.5 hours until melted completely, stirring occasionally (Alternatively, place caramels and water into a bowl and use the double boiler method* to melt candies completely). The caramel is ready for dipping once it reaches a smooth and uniform consistency.
steps.1: Place all toppings (pumpkin seeds, pecan pieces and pomegranate seeds) onto separate plates for easy application. Hold the persimmons by the leaves and dip into the caramel, coating the bottom half of the fruit. Immediately roll the persimmon into the topping of choice, pressing any stray toppings gently with your hand to secure them to the fruit.
steps.2: Place finished persimmon onto the lined baking sheet to cool, about 5 minutes. Enjoy once caramel has hardened slightly. Store remaining caramel dipped persimmons in the refrigerator, up to three days.
steps.3: *Double boiler method: Fill a large pot or pan half full with water. Boil the water. Reduce the heat to allow the water to simmer. Rest a large bowl over the top of the pan, making sure that the bottom of the bowl does not touch the water. Add caramels and water to the top bowl. Stir the caramels as they melt, until they become smooth.

ingredients.0: 1 pound (4 cups) TJ's Organic Rainier Cherries (seasonal), pitted
ingredients.2: 4 ounces (1/2 cup) TJ's Dry Roasted, Unsalted Pistachio Nutmeats Halves & Pieces
ingredients.4: 1 TJ's Gourmet Pie Crust, defrosted through step one of package directions
ingredients.5: 2 Tbsp TJ's Unsalted Butter, diced & chilled
ingredients.9: *You will also need 1 sheet of parchment paper

parsed_ing.9: also need 1 sheet of parchment paper

steps.0: Add pistachios to a food processor and process until about half the nuts are powdered. Sift powder into a bowl. Set aside remaining nut pieces. Add pitted cherries, sugar and lemon juice to the bowl of pistachio powder; toss well and set aside for at least 30 minutes. Place pie dough onto parchment lined baking sheet, unfold and press together any cracks or breaks; place in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 400°F. Remove dough from refrigerator, place cherry filling in the center of dough, sprinkle with diced butter and remaining nuts. Use the parchment as a guide to fold the dough up and pinch around cherries to form an open top shell. Gently lay the parchment back down once the shell has been formed. Pinch together any breaks in the shell to hold juices in. In a small bowl, combine 1 egg with 1 Tablespoon of cold water to create an egg wash. Brush shell with egg wash and sprinkle with turbinado sugar. Place in oven and bake for about 35 to 40 minutes or until crust is golden brown and juices are bubbling. Remove from oven and rest for at least 10 minutes before slicing.

ingredients.0: 1 pound (4 cups) TJ's Sweet Red Cherries (seasonal), pitted
ingredients.4: 1 TJ's Gourmet Pie Crust, defrosted through step one of package directions
ingredients.5: 2 Tbsp TJ's Unsalted Butter, diced & chilled
ingredients.9: *You will also need 1 sheet of parchment paper

parsed_ing.9: also need 1 sheet of parchment paper

steps.0: Add pitted cherries, sugar, almond flour and cherry juice to a bowl; toss well and set aside for at least 30 minutes. Meanwhile, place pie dough onto parchment lined baking sheet, unfold and press together any cracks or breaks; place in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 400°F. Remove dough from refrigerator, place cherry filling in the center of dough and sprinkle with diced butter. Use the parchment as a guide to fold the dough up and pinch around cherries to form an open top shell. Gently lay the parchment back down once the shell has been formed. Pinch together any breaks in the shell to hold juices in. In a small bowl, combine 1 egg with 1 tablespoon of cold water to create an egg wash. Brush dough shell with egg wash and sprinkle with turbinado sugar. Place in oven and bake for about 35 to 40 minutes or until crust is golden brown and juices are bubbling. Remove from oven and rest for at least 10 minutes before slicing.

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Toasted Meyer Lemon Thins
ingredients.2: 1 container TJ's French Vanilla Ice Cream

steps.0: Place a spoonful of mango sorbet on one cookie and flatten with the back of the spoon, taking care not to press too hard - these cookies are fragile! Repeat with the vanilla ice cream. Combine each side of your sandwich and place on a baking sheet in the freezer. Keep sandwiches in freezer until ready to serve. Enjoy!

441.title: Strawberry Dome Cake
441.description: With red & blue berries topping an impressive mound of vanilla ice cream, buttressed by a foundation of vanilla cake, this recipe answers that all-important question: "What should we serve our Independence Day guests for dessert?"

ingredients.0: 1 pound TJ's Strawberries
ingredients.1: 1 half gallon TJ's French Vanilla Ice Cream, softened
ingredients.2: 1 TJ's Chantilly Cream Vanilla Bean Mini Sheet Cake (or 18 ounces of YOUR favorite TJ's Bakery cake)

parsed_ing.2: Chantilly Cream Vanilla Bean Mini Sheet Cake

steps.0: Lay a large sheet of plastic wrap inside a 2-quart stainless steel bowl, with the plastic edges overhanging, set aside.
steps.1: Rinse strawberries and cut off the tops and tips. Slice each strawberry into 3-4 thin circles. Arrange strawberry slices in a single layer on the inside of the bowl, starting in the center and working out to the edges. Scoop softened ice cream over the top of the strawberries and smooth out until the surface is flat.
steps.2: In a separate bowl, crumble the cake with your fingers. Spread the cake crumbles in a thick layer atop the ice cream and gently press down to secure. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place in freezer for about 5 hours or until firm.
steps.3: To serve, soak the bottom of the bowl in a separate bowl of warm water for a few seconds to help dislodge the cake. Remove the plastic wrap from the top of the bowl, place a serving plate over the cake and flip. Remove bowl and plastic wrap. Garnish cake with whipped cream, fresh blueberries and mint leaves. Serve immediately.

ingredients.0: 1 3/4 cups TJ's Coconut Milk

steps.0: Place coconut milk and mango chunks in a blender and pulse a few times, just enough until the mango chunks break into smaller pieces. Pour the mixture into a medium bowl and stir in chia seeds, shredded coconut and clover honey until well incorporated. Fill each paper cup with the mixture until about 3/4 full. Cover each cup with foil and puncture with a craft stick down the center. Stick pops in the freezer for about six hours, or until frozen through. Peel the paper away and enjoy immediately!

ingredients.0: 2 rolls (1 box) TJ's Pie Crust, defrosted in fridge overnight
ingredients.1: 1 bag (1 1/2 cups) TJ's Frozen Wild Boreal Blueberries
ingredients.4: 1 tsp TJ's Unbleached All Purpose Flour, plus more for rolling dough
ingredients.5: 1 large TJ's Egg, beaten with 1 tsp Water
ingredients.6: 1/4 cup TJ's Turbinado Sugar (optional for sanding tops)
ingredients.7: *You will also need a wide-mouthed jar or circular cookie cutter (3.5 in diameter = about 7 hand pies)

steps.0: Remove both pie crust rolls from refrigerator and soften to room temperature. Pour bag of frozen blueberries in a strainer and rinse with water to defrost. Set aside.
steps.1: Once dough is softened, working in two batches, unroll and smooth together any cracks with your hands over the top of the plastic film of the dough. Remove plastic film and place dough onto a floured surface. Cut out 7 circles from one roll and 7 circles from the other (it could be more or less depending on the size of your cookie cutter, just make sure you end up with an even number). Place all dough circles onto two baking trays lined with parchment paper and place back in refrigerator to chill.
steps.2: In a medium bowl, combine strained blueberries, lemon zest, lemon curd and flour. Stir and set aside. Prepare egg wash by whisking egg with water in a small bowl. Set aside.
steps.3: Remove dough from refrigerator and place a spoonful of the lemon-blueberry mix onto 7 of the dough circles, making sure not to overfill or touch the edges of the dough. Brush egg wash around the perimeter of each filled dough circle. Place the remaining 7 dough circles on top of the mounds, then crimp the edges of the dough with a fork to seal each pie. Place prepared pies back in refrigerator to chill another 10 minutes before baking.
steps.4: Preheat oven to 375°F. Remove pies from refrigerator and brush tops generously with egg wash. With a sharp knife, cut a slit or a small design on the top of each pie to help steam release while baking. Sprinkle turbinado sugar over the top of each pie, if using. Bake pies on center rack of oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the blueberry juices start bubbling and the pastry is golden brown. For even baking, rotate sheet halfway though. Transfer to a cooling rack and serve warm.

ingredients.0: 2 rolls (1 box) TJ's Pie Crust, defrosted in fridge overnight
ingredients.1: 1 jar (about 2 cups) TJ's Dark Morello Cherries, drained
ingredients.2: 1 tsp TJ's Unbleached All Purpose Flour, plus more for rolling dough
ingredients.4: 1 large TJ's Egg, beaten with 1 tsp Water
ingredients.5: 1/4 cup TJ's Turbinado Sugar (optional for sanding tops)
ingredients.6: *You will also need a wide-mouthed jar or circular cookie cutter (3.5 in diameter = about 7 hand pies)

steps.0: Remove both pie crust rolls from refrigerator and let soften to room temperature. Once dough is softened, working in two batches, unroll and smooth together any cracks with your hands over the top of the plastic film of the dough. Remove plastic film and place dough onto a floured surface. Cut out 7 circles from one roll and 7 circles from the other (it could be more or less depending on the size of your cookie cutter, just make sure you end up with an even number). Place all dough circles onto two baking trays lined with parchment paper and place back in refrigerator to chill.
steps.1: In a medium bowl, combine strained cherries, flour and cocoa almond spread (Cocoa almond spread will be difficult to stir at first, but it will eventually incorporate as it comes to room temperature). Set aside. Prepare egg wash by whisking egg with water in a small bowl. Set aside.
steps.2: Remove dough from refrigerator and place a spoonful of the cherry-cocoa mix onto 7 of the dough circles, making sure not to overfill or touch the edges of the dough. Brush egg wash around the perimeter of each filled dough circle. Place the remaining 7 dough circles on top of the mounds, then crimp the edges of the dough with a fork to seal each pie. Place prepared pies back in refrigerator to chill another 10 minutes before baking.
steps.3: Preheat oven to 375°F. Remove pies from refrigerator and brush tops generously with egg wash. With a sharp knife, cut a slit or a small design on the top of each pie to help steam release while baking. Sprinkle turbinado sugar over the top of each pie, if using. Bake pies in center rack for 20-25 minutes, or until the cherry juices start bubbling and the pastry is golden brown, rotating sheet halfway through. Transfer to a cooling rack and serve warm.

ingredients.0: 2 rolls (1 pkg) TJ's Pie Crust, defrosted in fridge overnight
ingredients.1: 4 small TJ's Gala Apples, peeled, cored & diced
ingredients.4: 1 tsp TJ's Unbleached All Purpose Flour, plus more for rolling dough
ingredients.6: 3 Tbsp Fleur de Sel Caramel Sauce (or more, to taste)
ingredients.7: 1 large TJ's Egg, beaten with 1 tsp Water
ingredients.8: 1/4 cup TJ's Turbinado Sugar (optional for sanding tops)
ingredients.9: *You will also need a wide-mouthed jar or circular cookie cutter (3.5 in diameter = about 7 hand pies)

steps.0: Remove both pie crust rolls from refrigerator and let soften on counter (about 15 minutes). Place diced apples in a medium bowl, cover with lemon juice and set aside.
steps.1: Working in two batches, unroll softened dough and smooth together any cracks with your hands. Remove plastic film and place dough onto a floured surface. Cut out 7 circles from one roll and 7 circles from the other (it could be more or less, depending on the size of your cookie cutter, just make sure you end up with an even number). Place all dough circles onto two baking trays lined with parchment paper and place back in refrigerator to chill.
steps.2: Add cinnamon, flour, sea salt and caramel sauce to bowl of diced apples. Stir and set aside. Prepare egg wash by whisking egg with water in a small bowl. Set aside.
steps.3: Remove dough from refrigerator and place a spoonful of the apple-caramel mix onto 7 of the dough circles, making sure not to overfill or touch the edges of the dough. Brush egg wash around the perimeter of each filled dough circle. Place the remaining 7 dough circles on top of the mounds, then crimp the edges of the dough with a fork to seal each pie. Place prepared pies back in refrigerator to chill another 10 minutes before baking.
steps.4: Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Once oven is heated, remove tray of pies from refrigerator and brush tops generously with egg wash. With a sharp knife, cut a slit or a small design on the top of each pie to help steam release while baking. Optional: for added texture, sprinkle turbinado sugar over the top of each pie.
steps.5: Bake pies in center rack for 20-25 minutes, or until the juices start bubbling and the pastry is golden brown. For even baking, rotate sheet halfway though. Transfer to a cooling rack and serve warm.

ingredients.0: 1 cup TJ's Organic Coconut Sugar

steps.0: Pour the sugar and water into a large sauce pan or pot and heat to medium. Stir constantly until sugar bubbles and melts completely. Stir in coconut cream, milk, salt, and vanilla and heat to a rolling boil. Keep stirring constantly for about 10 to 15 minutes, until mixture reaches desired thickness and turns dark in color. Serve warm. Makes about 1/2 cup, serve 1 tablespoon per person.

ingredients.0: 2 cups crumbled TJ's Triple Ginger Snaps
ingredients.2: 12 ounces TJ's 72% Dark Chocolate Pound Plus Bar, finely chopped
ingredients.10: 8 oz. TJ's Milk Chocolate Pound Plus Bar, shaved into flakes
ingredients.11: 3/4 cup Fresh TJ's Raspberries or TJ's Strawberries
ingredients.12: 11-inch tart pan with a removable bottom

steps.0: PREPARE THE CRUST: Preheat oven to 325°F. In the bowl of a food processor combine ginger snap crumbs with melted butter and process until moist. Pour mixture into an 11-inch tart pan with removable bottom; press firmly into pan bottom and up sides. Place pan on a rimmed baking sheet. Set aside.
steps.1: MELT THE CHOCOLATE: Add chopped 72% dark chocolate and heavy whipping cream to a medium saucepan. Place over low heat and stir gently until melted and smooth. Remove from heat and set aside.
steps.2: MIX THE FILLING: In a medium bowl whisk together egg yolks, egg, sugar, flour, salt and cinnamon. Gradually whisk chocolate mixture into egg mixture until well blended. Pour into crust and smooth out to edges.
steps.3: BAKE: Bake until filling puffs slightly at edges and center is softly set, about 30 minutes. Remove from oven and cool in pan 35 minutes.
steps.4: PREPARE GARNISH: While tart is cooling, prepare the milk chocolate flakes. To do this, let the unwrapped milk chocolate bar come to slightly higher than room temperature. Hold the bar in one hand-you may want to hold it in a piece of parchment or waxed paper to stop the bar from melting in your hand-then slowly and carefully, use a vegetable peeler to shave along the length of the bar to form chocolate flakes.
steps.5: SERVE: Finally, gently remove tart pan sides and using a spatula, carefully slide tart onto a serving dish. Once completely cooled, top with milk chocolate flakes and fresh fruit. Cut into 12 wedges and serve.

ingredients.0: 1 lb assorted TJ's Nuts (TJ's Raw Cashew Pieces, TJ's Raw Pecan Pieces, TJ's Walnut Halves & Pieces)

steps.0: Place assorted nuts into a large bowl, set aside.
steps.1: In a medium pot, combine the milk, sugar, salt and pumpkin pie spice and place over medium heat. Stir constantly for about 5 minutes until the sugar dissolves. Allow the mixture to come to a boil until it reaches at least 235°F but no more than 245°F.
steps.2: Tip: If you do not have a candy thermometer, a great way to determine if you've reached this temperature range is to drop a spoonful of hot syrup into a bowl of very cold water. In the water, use your fingers to gather the cooled syrup into a ball. If it has reached soft-ball stage, the syrup easily forms a ball while in the cold water, but flattens once removed from the water-now you know!
steps.3: Remove pot from heat, add vanilla extract, stir and pour over the bowl of mixed nuts. Using a wooden or silicone spatula, coat the nuts and lay on a flat surface covered with parchment or wax paper to cool. Once cooled, break apart and enjoy! Use as a topping on a salad, add to a fruit and cheese plate or simply eat by the handful.

ingredients.0: 20 ounces of your favorite Joe-Joe's Sandwich Cookies
ingredients.1: 1 Box TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix
ingredients.3: 1 stick (8 Tbsp) TJ's Unsalted Butter, melted
ingredients.5: 3/4 block (6 oz) TJ's Cream Cheese, at room temperature
ingredients.6: 1/2 stick (4 Tbsp) TJ's Unsalted Butter, at room temperature
ingredients.8: 2 1/2 - 3 1/2 cups TJ's Organic Powdered Sugar, to taste

parsed_ing.0: of your favorite Joe-Joe's Sandwich Cookies

steps.0: Prepare the cupcakes: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line the wells of 2 cupcake pans with 18 paper liners, set aside.
steps.1: Coarsely chop 10 Joe-Joe's Cookies, set aside. In a medium bowl, prepare Vanilla Cake Mix according to package instructions. Add chopped cookies to mix and gently fold in with a rubber spatula until evenly incorporated, being careful not to over mix.
steps.2: Evenly divide the batter into lined cupcake pan, filling each cup about 3/4 full. Bake for 16-18 minutes, rotating the pans halfway through baking, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and allow cupcakes to cool completely.
steps.3: Prepare the frosting: Combine the cream cheese, butter and vanilla in the bowl of an electric mixer. Beat on medium speed until smooth, 1-3 minutes, scraping down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. Blend in the vanilla flavor. Add the powdered sugar in half-cup increments and blend to desired sweetness and thickness.
steps.4: Frost the cooled cupcakes, then garnish with Joe-Joe cookie halves and crumbs. Enjoy!

ingredients.0: 1 large tub (32 oz) TJ's Honey Greek Yogurt (or four 8 oz tubs)
ingredients.2: 1 (12 oz) package TJ's Frozen Organic Blueberries
ingredients.4: You will also need 10 wooden craft sticks and 10 small paper cups to use as molds

parsed_ing.4: also need 10 wooden craft sticks and 10 small paper cups to use as molds

corrected_ing.4: also need 10 wooden craft sticks and 10 small paper cups to use as molds

steps.0: Slice the tops off 15-20 strawberries and toss into a blender with 1/2 cup of yogurt and 6 mint leaves. Blend. Distribute the "red" strawberry mixture into 10 paper cups about 1/3 of the way high. Place cups on a tray and pop in the freezer. If you want clean and distinct layers, it's best to wait another hour or so until you add the next layer. For faster prep, just leave the cups in the freezer to firm up a bit while you prepare the remaining ingredients. Rinse your blender, then add half the bag of blueberries with 1/2 cup of yogurt. Blend. For more texture, stir in the other half of the bag of blueberries without blending. Remove pops from the freezer and carefully spoon in the "white" second layer, the honey yogurt until each cup is about 2/3 full. Lastly, pour the third "blue" layer, the blueberry mixture over the top of the plain honey yogurt, filling each cup almost to the top. Cover each cup with foil and puncture with a popsicle stick down the center. Stick the pops in the freezer for about six hours. Peel the paper away and enjoy!

ingredients.0: 1 TJ's Pie Crust, defrosted according to package instructions
ingredients.1: 2 bags TJ's Roasted & Mashed Sweet Potatoes (seasonally available), defrosted

steps.0: Preheat oven 350° F. Unroll pie crust over a 9 inch pie pan, per "Using Crust" package instructions. Mix together the sweet potatoes, 1/2 of the cream, 1/2 of sugar, butter, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt, until smooth. Taste and adjust seasoning (add more cream if desired or if mixture is too dry). In a separate small bowl, whip eggs with a whisk, and then fold into the sweet potato mixture. Pour mixture into the pie crust. Place pie in oven and bake for 1 hour or until the center is firm and dry (use a tooth pick to test). It may be a little brown around the edges. Remove from oven and allow pie to cool on a rack before cutting and serving. Serve with a dollop of whipping cream (see package directions).

452.title: Pumpkin Pie Donuts with Maple Glaze
452.description: Trader Joe's Organic Pumpkin, fragrant Pumpkin Pie Spice, sweet Organic Maple Syrup...this is the stuff donut dreams are made of...

ingredients.0: 1 1/4 cups TJ's Almond Meal
ingredients.6: 1/4 cup TJ's Salted Butter or Earth Balance Buttery Spread, melted

steps.0: Preheat oven to 350°F. Spray a donut pan with canola oil spray. Combine almond meal, spice and baking soda. In a separate bowl, thoroughly mix eggs, pumpkin, maple syrup, melted butter and vanilla. Add pumpkin mixture to almond meal to create batter. Evenly distribute batter in donut pan. Bake for 11-13 minutes. Let cool.
steps.1: Combine powdered sugar, maple syrup and vanilla to create maple glaze. Drizzle on cooled donuts and serve.

ingredients.0: 1 package TJ's Ginger Molasses Cookie Dough (seasonal), baked according to directions
ingredients.1: 1 cup TJ's Vanilla Ice Cream or Your Favorite TJ's Ice Cream

steps.0: Fill each pair of cookies with about 2 tablespoons (or more!!!) of ice cream to make a total of six ice cream sandwiches. Eat right away, or wrap in aluminum foil and freeze until you’re ready to indulge.

ingredients.0: 1/2 package Almondina Cookies
ingredients.1: 1 tub TJ's Organic Whipped Cream Cheese
ingredients.4: 1 tablespoon TJ's Organic Powdered Sugar (more or less to taste)

steps.0: Add cream cheese, vanilla, lemon juice and powdered sugar to blender or food processor and mix well. Spread cheese mix on almond cookie and top with another to make sandwich. Repeat assembly with remaining ingredients. Enjoy sandwiches with a cup of coffee or hot tea.

ingredients.0: 1 TJ's Gourmet Pie Crust, defrosted through step one of package directions
ingredients.4: 1/3 stick TJ's Unsalted Butter, diced and chilled

steps.0: Preheat oven to 400º F. Place dough onto parchment lined baking sheet, unfold and press together any cracks or breaks in dough. Add peaches to a mixing bowl and toss together with brown sugar and cinnamon. Top dough with peach mixture and dot with butter. Fold dough up and pinch around; peaches will stick out of top. Pinch together and smooth any breaks in dough or juices will leak out. Brush dough with milk and sprinkle with Turbinado sugar. Place in oven and bake for about 45 minutes or until crust is golden brown and peaches are bubbling. Remove from oven and rest for about 10 minutes before slicing.

ingredients.0: 1 stick TJ's Unsalted Butter, softened to room temperature
ingredients.4: 1/4 cup TJ's Walnut Halves and Pieces
ingredients.6: 1 package TJ's Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough, softened to room temperature

steps.0: Preheat the oven to 350°F. In a large bowl, whisk butter and eggs. Add brownie mix and stir gently, just until combined. Fold in cherries and walnuts; set aside.
steps.1: Grease an 8-inch square baking pan with canola oil spray. Place softened cookie dough chunks haphazardly around the bottom of the pan (there may be a few pieces of cookie dough leftover; do with them what you must). Pour the brownie mix evenly over the cookie dough and smooth out the top with a spatula.
steps.2: Place pan on center rack of oven and bake 30-35 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove pan from oven and let brownies cool slightly prior to slicing and serving. Enjoy as-is, or alongside a scoop of TJ's French Vanilla Ice Cream.
